story:
Short Summary

 

We are asking for people to help us to save our home. We have 3 generations living in this home. We have my wife and I, my in-laws, and our 5 children, ages 3 to 16. Before I met my wife, my mother-in-law would take care of hospice patients in the spare bedroom. A little over two years ago, the last patient passed away, and my mother-in-law also lost her job. Between both losses, a lot of income was lost. With the housing market the way it is, the government was talking about how they were creating programs for people who had a loss of income and were upside down in their mortgages. The programs were to help people obtain a modification on their home loan through their bank. My in-laws applied for a modification and were turned down. After being turned down, they hired an attorney. Since then, they have been fighting with the bank every step of the way trying to save the home. With the money that we have not used to pay for the mortgage, we paid off vehicles and other bills, and paid the attorney fees. The other day, we called the bank’s loan service officer handling our case and she told us that the only way we would be guaranteed to be able to save our home was to pay the entire amount that is behind. That is almost $40,000. She mentioned that if we wanted to pay half of that, they would submit us for a program that might let us keep the home. She stressed the word “might,” saying that if we give them $20,000, they may still proceed with the foreclosure anyway. We do not want to lose what we have here. We want to fight to keep the house.

I have already told you a little about my mother-in-law. My father-in-law has been retired for a long time and is getting up there in age. My wife has two medical conditions that leave her to where she is unable to work. Trust me; she would want to work if she could. As far as I am concerned, I have worked my entire life until last year. I spent time in the Army, then the last 9 ½ years that I worked, I was a deputy. I had a car accident a few years ago, and due to the injuries, I have had two back surgeries that have failed. I am in need of another back surgery, but it is highly unlikely that another surgery would help. So far, I have tried a lot of different pain medications that have not provided any relief for the pain yet. My doctor is going down the list that the insurance will cover, and hopefully they will finally find one that helps lower the amount of agony I am in. I spend most of my day either in my recliner, or lying in bed. It’s hard to believe that if I sit too long, it increases the pain. Lying down is the only thing that helps to lower the pain some. I have filed for social security disability. I was denied twice so far, and I am waiting for a court hearing. My attorney said that with my injuries, once I make it to court, the judge will award the disability. If we can get the help to save our home, once my disability comes through, we will be in a financial position to maintain the payments.

If we are unable to save our home, then any donations you have provided will assist us in finding a new home to move into. We thank you all for your help. We are asking people to not look at the big number. Please just give what you feel comfortable giving, and more importantly, please; just share our link so that others can help. If we could get a lot of people to donate a simple $5 or $10, then the grand total will build quickly.

Remember, no donation is too small. Even if everyone was only able to pay $5, we would be able to reach our goal if we can get enough people to make that small donation.

What good is it, my brothers, if someone says he has faith but does not have works? Can that faith save him? If a brother or sister is poorly clothed and lacking in daily food, and one of you says to them, “Go in peace, be warmed and filled,” without giving them the things needed for the body, what good is that? So also faith by itself, if it does not have works, is dead. James 2:14-17

Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ. Galatians 6:2

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to save our home and not have to worry again, it will take $60,000. I know that is a lot, but this will get us caught up, and pay a few months until my social security disabilty can get approved.

  • We are a family of 9 living in the home. Two grand parents, Two parents, and five children. The youngest is 3 and the oldest is 16. 4 are girls, and our only son is intellectually disabled and has asperber's syndrome, a form of autism. Your funding will help to make sure that our wonderful children do not end up homeless.
  • If we do not receive enough funding to save our home, then the funding that we do receive will help us to find somewhere else to live that will accomodate our large family, hopefully long enough to allow for my disability to be approved.

The Impact

Your contributions will help to keep one large family from becomng homeless. You will be providing a secure environment for children to grow up. You will be giving all of of peace of mind, and reducing our daily stress level tremendously.

  • If we do not raise enough money to save our home, your contributions will at least help us to find another residence that will work for our family. The main goal is to find a way for us to stay off the streets and keep our kids safe.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

    • If you are unable to help, thank you for looking at our campain anyways. You can still help by contacting your legislators and having them press laws that pressure the banks to modify mortgages for people who want to keep their homes. We are hearing a lot of hype about programs the help people keep their homes, but the banks are not required to abide by those programs. Most banks are choosing not to work with the government programs and are choosing to proceed with foreclosures regardless of the outcome of the families that they are displacing. A good example is our sitation so far. In September of 2011, we had a court ordered mediation scheduled. We showed up with our attorney and the mediator was there, but the Attorney for the bank did not show up, and they are still proceeding with the forclosure process.
    • I am new to this site, but it mentions that there are tools attached that will allow you to help spread our campaign. Please tell your friends and family so that we may be able to reach our goal, one contributor at a time.
    o use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Alternative Winter Break India

Hello,

My name is David Mandell and I am the coordinator for the USC Alternative Winter Break Trip to India.  We are taking 20 students to the slums. 

Our main goal while working in the slum is the idea to “help them help themselves.”  The focus of our trip is community empowerment and sustainable lifestyle through education.  With this focus we will be working on four projects while we are there.  We have two work times allocated during the week: the morning session and the afternoon session. 

 The school group stays with the kids.  With the school we teach English to the children.  One of the largest industries in India is tourism, therefore preparing these kids with a foundation of English we can help prepare them for opportunities for work in the future.  There are different levels and we will break the kids up into their respective levels.  Teachers are there but we would be taking over the class for those two weeks for a more intensive English camp.  Having the teachers there is very helpful however because they can act as a translator at times.*

The woman’s group walks a short distance to the sewing facility which is based out of a very small house.  Women come here who are often recovering from domestic violence and abusive relationships.  Here they learn how to sew which is a great skill to make clothes for their family and have the possibility to sell these clothes for profit.  Our group works with the women to teach basic entrepreneurship skills and woman’s empowerment.  We will work with them individually to help find their identity as a woman and feel significant as a person.  Last year we got a great response from these women and this year we plan to help them sew pants and actually sell the pants themselves for profit.* 

The men’s group was a project we started last year.  A large issue in these communities for poverty is that many of the men turn to gambling and alcoholism and cannot support their family.  We gathered the group of men in the community who are no longer in school but have not yet started a family.  We created this group in order to teach them the importance of sustainable living.  We have also introduced the idea for them to form their own volunteer projects.  This will create a great ideal in the community.

story:
Here's The Story

Hi! My name is Claire, I'm a 25-year-old transgender woman, a community organizer, activist, and advocate. I've done a lot to help build the transgender community in San Diego and now I need your help to accomplish my next project.

Transgender and gender non-conforming people struggle with affording electrolysis which can be vital to living safely and comfortably in the society we inhabit (Think, a trans woman struggling with a beard shadow often can't move through society unharmed and get a job. Many who do not have a shadow are still racing a clock each day before their hair grows back out.) 

We also struggle to find electrologists that are welcoming, understanding, and we can feel safe with. By helping me afford going to school and the equipment to become an electrologist I can work with local non-profits to permanently removal hair for transgender people who can't afford it or who have been turned away by other electrologists who are not transgender themselves.

By contributing you help one trans woman build a business (rare), gainfully employ her for life (rare), and most importantly empower her to provide this vital service for hundreds of trans people in her region for free (unheard of).

What I Need & What You Get

I need $28,000. A big number, I know. But every dollar counts and has a purpose. Here is what it all goes to:


  1. Electrolysis machine - The machine needed costs 10k. Because it is made by Dectro International, a company that specializes in these machines and has a partnership with my chosen school (American Institute of Education), I will be able to afford it at a small student discount. If I can get it for less than 10k any extra money will go to other costs associated with the maintenance of it (upkeep, probes, sterilization devices, etc.) 
  2. Tuition - The complete cost of tuition is 9,845. However, I have already qualified for a scholarship for this school and so I was quoted for 7,845. The school allows you to work at your own pace and start/stop whenever you want. This quoted tuition cost stays the same no matter how quickly or how long I take. Knowing my own abilities and the qualifications to take the state exam I have estimated myself to only need 6 months, adjusting an extra month in case I some how manage to fail the state exam the first time. That is highly, highly unlikely to happen but it's not unwise to plan in case of it.
  3. Living expenses - I estimate my living costs in the area of the school (Santa Ana) to be about this: 750/mo for rent, 200/mo for food, and 200/mo for gas. I plan on graduating and passing the state exam within a 6 month period. I plan on living very bare-bones. I'm not there to have fun in Santa Ana. I'm there to study.
  4. Emergency and miscellaneous - Some things can not be predicted but can at least be prepared for. 3,255 will be enough to take care of anything unexpected that could arise during this 6 month period. Flat tires, medicine, clothing unknown text book purchases, and anything along the same lines would fall into this category. (Any miscalculation that would have given me excess in a different  category would overflow into this category. If I have miscalculated and a different category ends up being more expensive this category would siphon into it.)
What happens if we don't raise enough? That's okay! I will hold on to it and leave it untouched until I save up the rest on my own, I'll run a secondary fundraiser, or I'll take out a loan. I feel so confident about the success of this that I am comfortable with any of these options.
Now, what do you get for helping me afford this? Check out our perks section, but here is a rundown:
I have perks that range from $9 to $999. ALL of them give you a place on the future website's front page letting everyone know you are responsible for making this wonderful thing happen! For $39 you can get a tee shirt with our logo on it. For $39-$999 you can get a choice of one or multiple hours in electrolysis sessions with me when the private business aspect of this begins.

Other Ways You Can Help Support This

Can't afford to contribute but still want to help? That's okay, no worries. God bless you for wanting to. Please, please, please use the share tools to let the world know! Put this effort on blast on Facebook, Twitter, to bloggers, anyone, and anything.

story:
Dr. Sara Campolonghi

Who I am

I am an enthusiastic Psychologist, Heathy food Coach, Trainer, Educator, and Teacher of Italian Language for Foreigners. 

I am an expert on Eating and life-style behaviours, obesity and related diseases and National Secretary of ASAS, Italian Association for Health.

Look at my website www.coachalimentare.it (Italian only, for now!)

What I do for people

Seven years ago, as a Clinical and health psychologist, I linked together my competences in Healthy Eating, Psychology and Coaching, in order to help people change the wrong habits and lose weight definitely, and fill the gap existing between the dietologists' and nutritionists' prescriptions, that is, knowledge and theoretical advice about what everyone should do or eat to lose weight and stay healthy, and the effective and concrete change of behavior, habits, knowledge and awareness about food, eating, exercise, every aspect of the daily routine management that really allow people to enjoy good health, lose and maintain their body-weight without efforts and staying healthy steadily.

Usually doctors simply prescribe people diets to follow, but food is strictly connected with people's lives, culture or stories, personal taste, opinions, their personal and social world. On the other hand, psychologists are often focused on feelings or motivation only, without taking into account how bad food and wrong habits can influence brain, mental processes and behaviour.

But when peolpe go back home, living the daily routine, it is impossible for them to keep a strict diet forever, maintain a stable weight and a good and balanced and satisfying relation with food or their own body, and change their wrong habits just working on feelings.  

People rather need a guide who can help them change the previous unhealthy routine with a different one they are not used to, proceeding step by step, and discovering that it is much easier than expected.

They need practical advice to know for instance how to buy groceries consciously or read lables correctly, how to combine different food in a meal or cook a particular vegetable or beans, what are the best choises in a restaurant's menu. 

Peolple also need to understand the reasons of their desire for some kind of food, to distinguish the right signals of hunger and fullness, improve their organization skills to settle the lunch at work, outdoor, with family. 

And much more.

My mission

This is my job, and my purpose: make people conscious and independent about their daily routines and weight management; allow them to improve their knowledge and practical skills about food, cooking and activity, eating behavior and emotions, connections between brain and body signals, etc.; make them curious, happy and satisfied, learning and doing things to improve their own well-being and health by themselves everyday.

What's more, I am working hard to change the attitude of people and the common culture about food and nutrition, in order to modify the way people and families choose their nourishment every day.

All this, definitely enhances the quality of life of people.

What I look for

At present, I feel the need to improve my competences moving to a place where prevention and promotion of health are very important and practised, and doctors and psychologists usually work together in team in order to pursue it effectively. Australia is the right place, actually.

Furthermore, this one-year Master of Science in Coaching Psychology at the University of Sydney seems to have been made especially for me. It matches precisely my profession and interests and I am sure it is the right way to improve my competence, and go ahead in my mission about promotion of health. 

Unfortunately, I don't have the possibilities to pay for this Master nor to move to Sydney for one year because of the high cost of living.

What I need

This one-year Master, starting on May 2015, costs 36,800.00 AUD (more than 26.500,00 Euros). 

You can find more details here: http://sydney.edu.au/courses/master-of-science-in-coaching-psychology). 

I need help to pay living costs (house rent, food, transports etc.)much higher in Australia than in Italy, as long as I find a part time job there.

Moreover, University will ask me probably to attend a mandatory and expensive English course before the Master: even a 7.5 Academic IELTS score is required! I've got a good 7.0 overall, enough to be accepted, but only with a conditional offer.

In case I won't reach the entire goal...

I will use the funds collected to try to start a PhD in Health at the University of Queensland, Brisbane. 

In fact, there is a great Professor at the University of Queensland who is working on good Parenting and Children's overweight. I had the possibility to start a PhD with him last year but unfortunately I didn't get the scholarship because of extremely competitive, and I couldn't go. With your donations I could start to work with him and try to get the scholarship again with many more chances.

I will appreciate every donation you will give me, because this means you trust in my purpose as much as me.

Even donating 1 Euro only, you will give a great boost to my campaign!

What You Get

If you contribute to help me, I can offer you not presents only but my expertise in two ways:

1) As a Health coach I can help you cook better, lose (or take) weight, change the wrong habits, improve your health and welbeing, and become friend with good and healthy food.

2) As a Teacher of Italian for foreigners, I can help you improve your fluency and knowledge in Italian language with professional conversation lessons.

SO, discover all the benefits I offer and choose your favourite perk!

Even donating 1 Euro only, you will give a great boost to my campaign!

_____________________________________________________________________________

** Christmas time! **

If you want to give as a gift something special to your relatives and friends, (or to yourself!) for Christmas, profit by the perks available!

_____________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

If  you can't donate but you TRUST my project and my competences

SPREAD THE WORD!
Tell your friends about my campaign and my purpose, share this link on Facebook or the other social networks. You can easily use the Indiegogo share tools as well.

THANK YOU EVERYONE!!!

_____________________________________________________________________________

Amici Italiani

Anche con una donazione di 1 EURO potrete dare una spinta importante alla mia campagna!

Se volete approfondire visitate il mio sito www.coachalimentare.it. Troverete tante informazioni, consigli e ricette per migliorare la vostra salute e mantenervi in forma.

_____________________________________________________________________________

ABOUT ME

Some opinions and experiences of patients, colleagues and friends.

Francesco, Graduated in International Relations. 24

"I met Sara Campolonghi three years ago, when I had already started to modify my diet by myself, since I wanted to lose some weight. Yet in a few talks she completely changed my way of looking at alimentation: she explained me the qualities of different kinds of food, the health risks of certain industrial products - some of which are very popular - and, what counts the most, she suggested me how and even where to easily get healthy food in a metropolitan area such as Rome.  Moreover, thanks to Sara's advice, I am now able to cook my dishes in a healthier way, but as tasty as before: for example, by using spices in place of salt, or by introducing certain vegetables. 

Furthermore, being a psychologist, Sara applies a 'soft' approach in her job, which fosters cooperation from the patient in changing his lifestyle. Last but not least, she takes full advantage of social networking, by publishing useful tips for a good diet on a daily basis. I personally consider that modern Western society, with its obesity rate and poor alimentary education, needs higher numbers of such a professional figure."

Domenico Tiso, MD, President of ASAS Italian Association for Health.

"Dr. Sara Campolonghi is a trained person, accurate and reliable. What strikes me about her, in particular, is the passion and motivation which she tackles any project and initiative with. I consider her prone to listening and proactivity, and cut out for teamwork. I personally believe that Dr. Sara Campolonghi is a very earnest and responsible person, she can be a virtuous resource in any context."

Andrea, Student, film-maker and actor. 23

"I didn't expect I could appreciate so much such a different eating style and healthier food, unlike what I was used to, and lose weight at the same time. Thanks to Sara now I am more aware and careful about what I put in my mouth and my body, I am feeling much better and losing weight without sacrifices. I will go on, definitely!"

Fabiana, Make-up artist. 33

"I met Sara a long time ago and I appreciate her both as a friend and as a professionist. She helped me live my coeliac disease not as a limit, but as a possibility for a different and healthy eating, and I'm really experiencing this change now, during my pregnancy. I absolutely have no cravings for junk food, and my eyes shine only for fruit and vegetables!"

Stefano, Lawyer and Conductor. 38

I was managing my daily life badly, and I was frequently ill in the past. Dr. Campolonghi has really helped me:  since I took advice from her, I started and learned to eat more consciously, and doing excercise with plasure; my daily habits are changed and I have lost weight gradually. I am a different person now, healthier and happier than before."

Clarissa, Child care Center Teacher. 32

"I attended one of Dr. Campolonghi's speeches last year during an interesting big congress about healthy lifestyle, that she organised with her association Asas for Health in Piacenza. Her talk about the importance of a healthy eating was so engaging that it gave a great boost to my desire for change. 

Her inspiring words made me understand how what we eat affects us and our health, and that the only way of changing our life and eating style is our inner willing of doing that."

Micaela, Employee. 42

"I began this path with Dr. Campolonghi getting practical guidelines, that could leave out problems due to bad nutrition. Then we started analysing automatic behaviours, emotions and states of mind that influenced the way I looked at and judged myself.Not a diet, but a way to recover ourselves and our freedom!"

Isabella, Secretary. 52

"I tried lots of diets. I usually was so nervous, frustrated, I wanted to quit... but since I met Dr. Campolonghi, talking and working with her, I'm actually seeing things clearly, and everything becomes easier to do. I don't feel guilty or ashamed anymore because now I know  I am not failing but changing my habits progressively, step by step, enjoying the achievements and working on the next aims. With her I can see the way to handle problems and difficulties with confidence and more peacefully. She makes me feel good."

Ignazia, Employee. 49

"Before I met Dr. Campolonghi, I had tried to lose weight but with poor results, I take lots of cortisone and for me it is not easy to lose weight ... in nearly two months of "non-diet" but healthy eating, I lost almost 6 pounds, what makes me happiest is that my blood analysis have been getting better, and I have reduced the dose of cortisone! There is still much to be done but I am determined to continue my experience with my health coach and the healthy eating"

"I am very glad I met you, Dr. Campolonghi, I am not an outgoing person, I  am not  good with words, but I like you very much not only as a professionist, but also as a person."

Maria Cecilia, Lowyer. 60

"Dr. Campolonghi is the only person who succeeded- with cheerfulness and perseverance - in dismantling my armor, making me able to see myself and the world I live in more realistically and allowing me to think that I can change and improve my life, in all fields."

Many thanks to all of you for your statements and support! 

If you like, why not help?

Even donating 1 Euro only, you will give a great boost to my campaign!

Thank you everyone
story_txt:
Dr. Sara CampolonghiWho I amI am an enthusiastic Psychologist, Heathy food Coach, Trainer, Educator, and Teacher of Italian Language for Foreigners. I am an expert on Eating and life-style behaviours, obesity and related diseases and National Secretary of ASAS, Italian Association for Health.Look at my website www.coachalimentare.it (Italian only, for now!)
What I do for people
Seven years ago, as a Clinical and health psychologist, I linked together my competences in Healthy Eating, Psychology and Coaching, in order to help people change the wrong habits and lose weight definitely, and fill the gap existing between the dietologists' and nutritionists' prescriptions, that is, knowledge and theoretical advice about what everyone should do or eat to lose weight and stay healthy, and the effective and concrete change of behavior, habits, knowledge and awareness about food, eating, exercise, every aspect of the daily routine management that really allow people to enjoy good health, lose and maintain their body-weight without efforts and staying healthy steadily.Usually doctors simply prescribe people diets to follow, but food is strictly connected with people's lives, culture or stories, personal taste, opinions, their personal and social world. On the other hand, psychologists are often focused on feelings or motivation only, without taking into account how bad food and wrong habits can influence brain, mental processes and behaviour.But when peolpe go back home, living the daily routine, it is impossible for them to keep a strict diet forever, maintain a stable weight and a good and balanced and satisfying relation with food or their own body, and change their wrong habits just working on feelings.  People rather need a guide who can help them change the previous unhealthy routine with a different one they are not used to, proceeding step by step, and discovering that it is much easier than expected.They need practical advice to know for instance how to buy groceries consciously or read lables correctly, how to combine different food in a meal or cook a particular vegetable or beans, what are the best choises in a restaurant's menu. Peolple also need to understand the reasons of their desire for some kind of food, to distinguish the right signals of hunger and fullness, improve their organization skills to settle the lunch at work, outdoor, with family. 
And much more.
My mission
This is my job, and my purpose: make people conscious and independent about their daily routines and weight management; allow them to improve their knowledge and practical skills about food, cooking and activity, eating behavior and emotions, connections between brain and body signals, etc.; make them curious, happy and satisfied, learning and doing things to improve their own well-being and health by themselves everyday.
What's more, I am working hard to change the attitude of people and the common culture about food and nutrition, in order to modify the way people and families choose their nourishment every day.
All this, definitely enhances the quality of life of people.


What I look for

At present, I feel the need to improve my competences moving to a place where prevention and promotion of health are very important and practised, and doctors and psychologists usually work together in team in order to pursue it effectively. Australia is the right place, actually.


Furthermore, this one-year Master of Science in Coaching Psychology at the University of Sydney seems to have been made especially for me. It matches precisely my profession and interests and I am sure it is the right way to improve my competence, and go ahead in my mission about promotion of health. 

Unfortunately, I don't have the possibilities to pay for this Master nor to move to Sydney for one year because of the high cost of living.
What I need

This one-year Master, starting on May 2015, costs 36,800.00 AUD (more than 26.500,00 Euros). 


You can find more details here: http://sydney.edu.au/courses/master-of-science-in-coaching-psychology). 


I need help to pay living costs (house rent, food, transports etc.)much higher in Australia than in Italy, as long as I find a part time job there.


Moreover, University will ask me probably to attend a mandatory and expensive English course before the Master: even a 7.5 Academic IELTS score is required! I've got a good 7.0 overall, enough to be accepted, but only with a conditional offer.

In case I won't reach the entire goal...
I will use the funds collected to try to start a PhD in Health at the University of Queensland, Brisbane. 
In fact, there is a great Professor at the University of Queensland who is working on good Parenting and Children's overweight. I had the possibility to start a PhD with him last year but unfortunately I didn't get the scholarship because of extremely competitive, and I couldn't go. With your donations I could start to work with him and try to get the scholarship again with many more chances.
I will appreciate every donation you will give me, because this means you trust in my purpose as much as me.

Even donating 1 Euro only, you will give a great boost to my campaign!

What You Get

If you contribute to help me, I can offer you not presents only but my expertise in two ways:


1) As a Health coach I can help you cook better, lose (or take) weight, change the wrong habits, improve your health and welbeing, and become friend with good and healthy food.


2) As a Teacher of Italian for foreigners, I can help you improve your fluency and knowledge in Italian language with professional conversation lessons.

SO, discover all the benefits I offer and choose your favourite perk!
Even donating 1 Euro only, you will give a great boost to my campaign!
_____________________________________________________________________________


** Christmas time! **

If you want to give as a gift something special to your relatives and friends, (or to yourself!) for Christmas, profit by the perks available!




_____________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help
If  you can't donate but you TRUST my project and my competences

SPREAD THE WORD!

Tell your friends about my campaign and my purpose, share this link on Facebook or the other social networks. You can easily use the Indiegogo share tools as well.

THANK YOU EVERYONE!!!_____________________________________________________________________________
Amici Italiani
Anche con una donazione di 1 EURO potrete dare una spinta importante alla mia campagna!
Se volete approfondire visitate il mio sito www.coachalimentare.it. Troverete tante informazioni, consigli e ricette per migliorare la vostra salute e mantenervi in forma.







_____________________________________________________________________________

ABOUT ME


Some opinions and experiences of patients, colleagues and friends.




Francesco, Graduated in International Relations. 24
"I met Sara Campolonghi three years ago, when I had already started to modify my diet by myself, since I wanted to lose some weight. Yet in a few talks she completely changed my way of looking at alimentation: she explained me the qualities of different kinds of food, the health risks of certain industrial products - some of which are very popular - and, what counts the most, she suggested me how and even where to easily get healthy food in a metropolitan area such as Rome.  Moreover, thanks to Sara's advice, I am now able to cook my dishes in a healthier way, but as tasty as before: for example, by using spices in place of salt, or by introducing certain vegetables. 
Furthermore, being a psychologist, Sara applies a 'soft' approach in her job, which fosters cooperation from the patient in changing his lifestyle. Last but not least, she takes full advantage of social networking, by publishing useful tips for a good diet on a daily basis. I personally consider that modern Western society, with its obesity rate and poor alimentary education, needs higher numbers of such a professional figure."

story:
We are starting a yearly Christmas Tree lot to benefit our neighborhood Denver school, DCIS at Fairmont.  We will be selling Christmas trees, wreaths, and garland to the community.  We need money to cover the costs of starting up the lot with a display system, lights, insurance, signs, rental equipment, etc. Your donation is tax deductable and will be amplified many times with the income from the tree lot and the volunteer hours.  We project to make $10,000-$12,000 this year from sales.  In future years the tree lot  has the potential to be a major fundraiser every year raising $30,000 plus.  We just need the initial starter money.  Here is a list of our startup costs.   

Display system and drill.       $2500
Insurance.                                 400
Truck Shipping                         2000
Advertising.                               400
Lights.                                        200
Fence.                                        400
Sales trailer rent.                      1500
Supplies.                                     250

My name is John Krauklis.  My family and I live in the historic neighborhood of Baker just south of downtown Denver.  My son William is in Kindergarden at our neighborhood school, DCIS at Fairmont.  It is an amazing school filled with wonderful students, faculty and lots of great energy.  The school was a D rated school up until last year when our principle Anne Jacobs took over, reorganized everything, and turned around the school to one that is filled with energy and learning. 

I owned and operated a Christmas tree lot for eight yeas before moving to Denver.  With a wife, two kids, and a house I do not have time to run a tree lot by myself now.  I want to use my vast knowledge of the Christmas tree business to help out our local public school.  I feel it is the perfect time and opportunity to start a new Christmas tree lot and it could not be for a better cause. 

We have secured a lot only a few blocks from the school on the busy main drag of Broadway (101 Broadway).  We have the ok from the school to go ahead with the fundraiser.  We have the necessary permits and licenses to conduct business.  We just need the capitol to cover the start up costs associated with creating a fun, festive Christmas tree lot. 

Thank you for your time and consideration of this fundaiser.  Remember, your donation is fully tax deductable.

Denver Center for International Studies at Fairmont (DCIS at Fairmont), is a Denver public elementary school located in the Baker neighborhood.

After the end of a year-long transformation, led by principal Anne Jacobs, a low-performing school has been remad into a thriving learning community. The school will focus on high academic achievement through an international studies-focused mission and curriculum.

Your donation will go to the PTA.   We as an official board decide and vote on where the money is to be spent. We have a goal of raising $50,000 this year.   We will be funding field trips, art and music supplies, teacher aides, international connections and studies, attendance awards, and other school enrichment programs.

story:
The Campaign & It's Impact

Bikram yoga is a series of 26 Hatha yoga poses practiced in a room heated to 41 degrees at humidity levels of 105 degrees. Why the heat? 41 degrees is the temperature the body reaches when exercising, maintaining this temperature in a 90 minute class allows the body to work safely through stretching and muscle strengthening. There are really positive reasons why this yoga is popular with athletes and dancers but more importantly anyone can do it. I talk about Bikram alot and have shared this yoga with so many friends and its a delight for me to see them improving their health with this practice. I want to bring this yoga to my local community, it all starts with me.

Bikram yoga teachers train with Bikram at his yoga college in LA, the nine week course is an intensive, six days a week sixteen hours a day, immersion in the ethos and details of the practice. The teaching method is uniform and the standards are high. Wherever in the word that you attend a Bikram class, the routine will not deviate from the 26 postures, the series has been designed with intent and all Bikram teachers are certified by Bikram.

The Money Side

*UPDATE 16/08

The good news is that i've been given a place although i haven't been awarded a scholarship.

September is the final teaching programme of 2012, the course dates are 16th September - 18th November, the fees for this session are $10'900 this covers fees and lodgings at the Radisson LAX in Los Angeles, it is mandatory to stay here for the length of the training and living expenses are not included. The fees for Bikram Teacher Training are beyond the budget of anyone that I help and i have applied for a scholarship. The deadline for scholarship announcements has been pushed back from July to August 15th after which unsuccessful candidates are allowed a further two weeks to raise funds for the course. If i am not successful in either receiving a scholarship or meeting my funding target any funds raised will roll forward to apply to next year's session which will be in April 2013 at a higher cost. Any funds i raise above my target will roll forward to Phase II- opening a bikram yoga studio.

My funding target is $17500. Indiegogo will levy a commission on all donations and I have alowed for the lack of a scholarship, living expenses and flights. Donations can be made in GB£, US$ and Euros and are recieived in to s secure PayPal account. All donations will be transfered to me on 11th September.

As i face this challenge i am aware that your resources may not stretch to a donation and, if you can assist me by sharing this campaign amongst your community and get the word out across your network i would be most grateful.

The Perks & What You Will Get

Indiegogo Perks

In the year since I left my last job I’ve discovered something about my skillset, there are things that I do without thinking about it too much, that other people really value. I’ve barter exchanged a few of those skills delighted that i could contribute to someone else’s success. This is how I’ve been able to keep my yoga attendance consistent trading my admin skills for yoga classes.

I’ve been taking a lot of photos this year, I take these photos with nothing more in mind than capturing what I see, looking for beauty every day has me finding a lot of beauty on my wonderings and this has enriched my life. I’ve had some wonderful feedback on my blog and on Instagram and I’ve been invited to take part in a global real-time gallery project #Ubiquography. The photos mean a lot to me and I’ve included them in some of the Perks here.

I am active on social media and have a network thati'm engaged with, you can find out some more about this on my blog thefifthelemental.wordpress.com/indiegogocampaign. I have two blogs that I post on and the fact is I have a fair amount of exchange and dialogue on Twitter and this might be something that could work for you. I’ve included blog mentions in some of the Perks too because hundreds of people read blogs each month, and Klout tells me my influence reaches 1.4k people.

story:
My Name is Benedetta Mwongeli, I am 28 years old. I was born and brought up in the Viwandani slum in Nairobi. I went to primary school in Viwandani and to high school in a town called Thika here in Kenya. I am a strong woman who has fought for her community to change the lives of young people. I am the founder of  Mukuru Talent Development (“MTD”) a community based organization aimed at giving the youth in Viwandani a chance to take ownership of their lives by developing job skills and education in areas such as performing arts, computer skills and health, while at the same time giving them a symbolic voice in the community.

Growing up in Viwandani, I saw firsthand how young men and women in the slum lose their lives to drugs and criminal activities and the way in which the cycle of poverty get endlessly repeated. But also I experienced firsthand empowerment from an organization called Mukuru Promotion Center which is owned by Sisters of Mercy who gave me a scholarship to pursue my high school education.

 I also attended peer education training from JHPIEGO and Hope Worldwide on reproductive health, HIV/AIDS and behavior change. It is through these trainings, and the opportunity to go to school that I believe it is possible to change the desperate situation in the slum where I was raised. I have also managed to bring people from the slum together to take action and responsibility for their own future. Many young people have testified experiencing a big change in their lives ever since they joined Mukuru Talent Development. Parents have also said they have seen great progress in their children who are in our MTD family.

Now that I have managed to help bring about this big change in my community it is important I add more knowledge about how best to handle the increasing number of people in our slum who are in need of our services. And by that I have secured myself a place to study at University College Utrecht in the Netherlands with a scholarship of 12,500 Euros per year for tuition. But now I need money to cover my living expenses e.g. flight expenses, books, insurance, and other personal expenses that I may incur during my first years of study. I am looking at raising 9,000 Euros (11,000 USD) for my first year.

By helping me, you are helping to improve the welfare of the slum community - Viwandani – where I am from. I dedicate my life to improving the quality of life of my home and my community.

 

Your help is very much appreciated.

My Name is Benedetta Mwongeli, I am 28 years old. I was born and brought up in the Viwandani slum in Nairobi. I went to primary school in Viwandani and to high school in a town called Thika here in Kenya. I am a strong woman who has fought for her community to change the lives of young people. I am the founder of  Mukuru Talent Development (“MTD”) a community based organization aimed at giving the youth in Viwandani a chance to take ownership of their lives by developing job skills and education in areas such as performing arts, computer skills and health, while at the same time giving them a symbolic voice in the community.
Growing up in Viwandani, I saw firsthand how young men and women in the slum lose their lives to drugs and criminal activities and the way in which the cycle of poverty get endlessly repeated. But also I experienced firsthand empowerment from an organization called Mukuru Promotion Center which is owned by Sisters of Mercy who gave me a scholarship to pursue my high school education.
 I also attended peer education training from JHPIEGO and Hope Worldwide on reproductive health, HIV/AIDS and behavior change. It is through these trainings, and the opportunity to go to school that I believe it is possible to change the desperate situation in the slum where I was raised. I have also managed to bring people from the slum together to take action and responsibility for their own future. Many young people have testified experiencing a big change in their lives ever since they joined Mukuru Talent Development. Parents have also said they have seen great progress in their children who are in our MTD family.
Now that I have managed to help bring about this big change in my community it is important I add more knowledge about how best to handle the increasing number of people in our slum who are in need of our services. And by that I have secured myself a place to study at University College Utrecht in the Netherlands with a scholarship of 12,500 Euros per year for tuition. But now I need money to cover my living expenses e.g. flight expenses, books, insurance, and other personal expenses that I may incur during my first years of study. I am looking at raising 9,000 Euros (11,000 USD) for my first year.
By helping me, you are helping to improve the welfare of the slum community - Viwandani – where I am from. I dedicate my life to improving the quality of life of my home and my community.
 
Your help is very much appreciated.

story:
STOP! Please make future contributions at www.globalci.org/donate rather on this page. The latest updates about the progress of our fundraising campaign will be posted there.


Short Summary

Hi, this is Yumi Kuwana writing on behalf of Global Citizens Initiative (GCI). This summer in 2014, we are hosting a Global Citizens Summit for Youth (GCSY) at the Harvard Faculty Club. The summit will bring twenty-four 16-18 year olds together to discuss the potential for global citizenship and the themes of "freedom and fairness" in the world today. The summit will be led by veteran professors from the Phillips Exeter Academy. We are looking for financial support to bring talented youth from modest economic backgrounds to the summit. We are also in the process of purchasing an online platform which will allow students to stay connected with each other and with their mentors with video-conferencing throughout the year. In this way, the program at Harvard will act as a springboard for these young leaders. Through the "C4 Leadership principles" of Collaboration, Creation, Character, and Critical thought, we plan to instill values of positive citizenship throughout the world, and to spark initiatives led by students when they return home. This will allow our GCI youth to take action and follow their passion in this ever increasing globalized and digitalized world. I hope you will join me in making this summit a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to support five scholarships for the program. This will amount to $6,700 per student, including international airfare. In addition, we will need $5,000 for subscriptions to online language and curriculum content, as well as $11,500 to cover the teaching expenses and programming costs of maintaining the program in the coming year.

Individual sponsors will be recognized for their contributions with the following honors:

Leader (contribution of $5,000 or more)

•Official Recognition as the leading individual sponsor during the summit in printed publications and on the GCI website
•Invitation to a GCI presentation of GCSY research findings
•Opening special thanks and acknowledgement in GCSY film
•Complimentary copy of the GCI Textbook

This funding will help underwrite a virtual online GCI platform and community engagement in the coming year.


Catalyst (contributions of $2,500 or more)


•Official Recognition as sponsor during the summit in printed publications and on the GCI website
•Acknowledgement in the opening credits in GCSY film
•Recognition in GCI online platform
•Complimentary copy of the GCI Textbook

This funding will underwrite pre & post-GCSY program books for participants

Fellow (contributions of $1,000 or more)

•Official Recognition as sponsor during the summit
•Recognition in the closing credits in GCSY film
•Recognition in GCI online platform
•Complimentary copy of the GCI Textbook

This funding will underwrite polo shirt uniforms for all students

Mentor (contributions of $500 or more) 


•Official Recognition as sponsor during the summit
•Recognition in GCI online platform
•Complimentary copy of the GCI Textbook

This funding will underwrite honorarium for thought-leader speakers


Scholar (contributions of $250 or more)

• Recognition in GCI online platform
• Complimentary copy of the GCI Textbook

This funding will underwrite A.V. rentals for the classroom sessions.


Friend (contributions of $100 or more)

• Complimentary copy of the GCI Textbook

This funding will underwrite faculty and student transportation for fieldtrips

  • If we do not meet out funding goal, all of the funding up to $10,000 will go to supporting student scholarships. Donations above this will be used to support the various program needs in the order listed above.

The Impact

Launching the Global Citizens Summit for Youth has a dual impact. On the one hand, it will provide mentorship for young, inspired students, who will be encouraged to use a global perspective and consciousness as the basis for change in their local communities. Even after the summit, students will be empowered by a network formed at the summit, connected by a virtual platform which your contributions will help support. On the other hand, the summit will serve as a pilot for future work. Research from the event (conducted by a Harvard Graduate School of Education doctoral researcher) will be used to analyze which aspects of the summit can be scaled and applied to schools looking to enrich their global educational programs. In this way, through your help, we can “Unleash the Potential of Global Leaders” on a wide scale.

Other Ways You Can Help

•  Forward this to potential sponsors
•  Forward this to potential applicants
•  Join the GCI community at www.globalci.org
•  Spread the word about GCI and GCSY to friends, parents and educators

Stay tuned for our research findings and live blog feeds on our website. We hope you will be part of an evolving conversation about global citizenship and education in the months ahead.

STOP! Please make future contributions at www.globalci.org/donate rather on this page. The latest updates about the progress of our fundraising campaign will be posted there.

story:
Over These Prison Walls is a program that brings art and writing workshops to the young people held at Donald E. Long Juvenile Detention Center in northeast Portland, Oregon. These minors often face long prison sentences ahead of them and are mostly black and hispanic minorities.


Context

The program was founded in 2007 by professor Barry Sanders as part of his “Prisons, Pain, and Punishment” course. He started by bringing his undergraduate students out to DEL to teach creative workshops to the youth there. In these workshops the kids learn about the power of language and art as tools for creative expression.

The work created by the boys in the weekly sessions is collected and published at the end of the semester in a zine that is distributed widely to the DEL students, their families, the PNCA community, and well beyond.

The boys take a lot of pride in the fact that their work is published--so much so that we receive submissions of work they have done in their free time, too. The zine also offers a unique kind of access to the incredible creativity and vibrant imaginations of these young people, which otherwise goes unnoticed or neglected.

We currently are in need of funding to cover major printing costs for the zine.


The Impact

With your support and through the power of word-of-mouth, we can bring their voices to the greater public, and call more attention to the issues of juvenile justice and mandatory sentencing.

Please help us spread the word!

Thank you for your time, your interest, and your generous support! Please help us spread the word about it by sending a link to this campaign page to your friends, family, classmates, colleagues, neighbors, professors, and students. Every last contribution makes a difference.


Fall class of 2013


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Links to published articles on Over These Prison Walls and the D.E.L Center:

New Library Center Opens in Donald E. Long Home

PNCA students, incarcerated teens collaborate to create art show

story:
#30Days of ThanksgivingLO  

You may not know this about me, but I had the AMAZING opportunity to go through a program called Legal Outreach in high school. Legal Outreach works with students from underserved neighborhoods around NYC and prepares them to succeed in high school, college, and beyond.  

I'm fundraising this November to make it possible for more students like me to go through Legal Outreach.  

My Story  

My name is Ama Darkwa and I grew up in an underserved neighborhood in New York City.

Because of Legal Outreach, I was encouraged to apply to colleges and attended Brandeis University. LO supported me beginning in 8th grade, and I left LO four years later inspired and equipped for college. 

Your support can change the lives of more students like me!

Your Support Will... 

Make it possible for more students like me to go through Legal Outreach for four years of free programming, including a debate program, SAT prep, writing classes, mentoring, college application workshops, and much more! 

Of the students LO supports: 

  • 100% graduated HS on time (only 66% of NYC public school students do) 
  • 99% went on to colleges and universities 

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Donate to my campaign before December 2nd, 2014 
  • Share my campaign on social media 
  • Encourage your networks to support my campaign 

I'm thankful for LO and I'm thankful for your support!  

#30DaysofThanksgivingLO
www.legaloutreach.org
www.facebook.com/legaloutreach
@legaloutreach

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Asher! I am a Life Scout with Troop 51 in Frisco, Texas. I have been very interested in aviation for all of my life and I am an airplane photographer. The airport has a dedicated park called Founder's Plaza where people can watch airplanes take off and land. https://www.dfwairport.com/founders/index.php

My campaign is to raise money for my Eagle Scout project, which is adding a permanent sign that will help visitors identify the specific planes that take off and land at the airport. I will also be planting some drought-tolerant plants at the park.

This project is very important to me because I would love to see people of all ages learn about planes and aviation in my community. My contributors will help me achieve the funding for the sign, sign graphics, installation fees, and plants.

What I Need 

  • I will need $4,000 to add the sign and graphics, and installing the sign, plus some plants nearby.

The Impact

  • It is valuable to the community and contributors because it helps increase aviation knowledge to visitors and educates people to the different types of planes that fly through Dallas/Fort Worth Airport.

Risks & Challenges

  • One of the risks is that this is a more expensive Eagle Project than most Boy Scouts typically tackle, so reaching my goal is a strech. I am very passionate about aviation I would really love to see people learn more about it!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • It would help to pass my project onto other people you know!

It would help to pass my project onto other people you know!

story:
The Guardian Princesses

The Guardian Princesses are new superheroines who work together to protect the people and the planet.  They are a group of racially and culturally diverse leaders who model compassion and intelligence, as well as the power of knowledge and collective action. Our stories transform the cultural meaning of the princess from a damsel-in-distress to brave heroines providing better role models for all children.

Princess Ten Ten, Guardian of the Skies

With your help, we will publish the fourth story of the series: Princess Ten Ten & The Dark Skies. This first-ever gender independent princess defies the gender norms of her culture; she refuses to wear dresses, has short messy hair, and practices a martial art that has traditionally been exclusively for boys. Because of Princess Ten Ten’s gender non-conformity, she is bullied by other children and even her own father rejects her. 

This story reveals how Princess Ten Ten perseveres and becomes a superheroine. She earns the title Guardian of the Skies by tackling the problem of air pollution. While raising awareness about the global impact of fossil fuel dependent economies, this story teaches readers about East Asian cultures. This story brings together Chinese, Japanese, and Korean cultures since they are all part of her mixed-heritage.  

How You Can Help

Participate in our Princess Ten Ten launch campaign from 10/10 to 11/20 and receive a great package of merchandise, perfect for holiday gifts! To donate, click on any of the perk boxes on the right side of the page. All perk packages will be shipped in time for the holiday season!

Please help us spread the word by forwarding this link to your friends, family, relatives, teachers, and local libraries. Use the links at the top of the page for easy ways to get the word out. The more people that know about the Guardian Princesses, the better!

The First 3 Stories

The first 3 Guardian Princess stories are already available in individual softcover books as well as together in a trilogy.  

The Inaugural Trilogy is a beautiful hardcover edition that includes the first three Guardian Princess stories: Princess Terra and King Abaddon is a parable about peaceful solutions to conflict; Princess Vinnea and the Gulavores promotes the importance of healthy eating; Princess Mariana and Lixo Island teaches readers about marine pollution. These stories feature a diversity of princesses representing European, African, Latina, South Asian, and East Asian cultures. 

Each princess is a guardian of one element of the environment. These heroines work together modeling cross-racial cooperation and the power of collective action. Guardian Princess books offer beautifully illustrated stories that emphasize the development of children’s talents, knowledge about the world, and each story includes educational supplements, like a glossary and discussion questions. 

"My Heart is True" 

Check out the first GP music video, featuring Princesses Terra, Vinnea, and Mariana. Be sure to sing along!

How It All Began

The Guardian Princess Alliance is a movement that started with a mother… 

Setsu Shigematsu, Associate Professor in the Media and Cultural Studies Department of University of California, Riverside, became concerned with today’s overwhelming princess culture because of its primary focus on external beauty and the way this is marketed to children. She witnessed its appeal to her own young daughter, a fascination that only seemed to grow when Setsu refused to purchase any princess products.

Rather than reject this powerful culture altogether, Setsu decided to write a story to positively transform the cultural meaning of the princess. The first story of the Guardian Princess series, Princess Terra and King Abaddon was written for her daughter’s fifth birthday. Since then, the movement has grown into a diverse group of parents, educators, students, artists, and professionals who are committed to creating better role models for children, thusly forming the Guardian Princess Alliance. 

Connect With Us

Learn more about about the Guardian Princesses by visiting our website www.guardianprincesses.com and checking out our social media links below. The first 3 stories, as well as the Inaugural Trilogy are available for purchase now on our web store and on Amazon.com.

For any questions or more info, feel free to email us at gpa@guardianprincesses.com or leave us a comment!

story:
Update

Pell grant achieved!
$425 needed by Dec 12th to enroll! (Indiegogo has a $500 minimum to use the site. My apologies!)

My name is Jon, and I like going places. Since I was a child, I was trapped in a small scene within my city. Only with me going to college back in '05 over at IADT Chicago, was I able to make progress in life; from being a fashion designer and model, to becoming more focused on acting and film.

I need some funds to return to ACC this spring semester for my core classes

 With a Music Production degree, I will receive more advanced and higher paying work contracts with different fields specific, thus a higher yearly income. I am going in with my partner and we will be studying together for all 4 years!

If you only can afford advice, please share!

Classes I'm taking this semester Biol 1408
English Comp 1
College Algebra
Spanish 1

Thank you all!

story:
Hi Everyone!

Thank you so much for visiting. on Jan. 8th 2015, I am scheduled to graduate with my MFA in Creative Writing from Lesley University in Cambridge, MA. Up until now, I have been trying to cover the fees on my own, however this time I really need your help and support.

Expenses include:

700.00 - last credit hour for graduation

125.00 - graduation fee.

*A wonderful friend has offered me a place to stay and I have paid for a bus ticket from New York to Boston, MA.

Your donation would be greatly greatly appreciated in this time of hardship and reason to celebrate!

Thank you so much and Happy New Year!

Love,

Hope

Your donation would be greatly greatly appreciated in this time of hardship and reason to celebrate! Thank you so much and Happy New Year! Love, Hope

story:
Due to the generous help of our wonderful friends, fans, and family, we have met our original goal - we still need your help however! Please help us get to our new goal of $2,500! 


Short Summary

The University of Minnesota Alpine Ski Team has just qualified for the United States College Ski Association National Competition. This feat, having not been accomplished in several years, marks the accumulation of this team's hard work and progress.

We need your help in making this dream a reality because Nationals are in Bend, OR, this year, over 1,500 miles from the University - causing several financial hurdles to overcome. 

What We Need & What You Get

The University of Minnesota Alpine Ski Team needs $1,000 to help cover the USCSA National Competition dues, hotel and lodging expenses, and travel expenditures.

  • Competitor dues are $465 per person. When you account for a 12 person team, that number adds up very quickly!
  • Lodging is going to be over $1,500, and travel will be about the same (+1,700 miles, there and back). We need a place to stay for the week, and we're trying to minimize these costs for our athletes.

The Impact

The University of Minnesota Alpine Ski Team provides an outlet for University of Minnesota students who were searching for a network of friends centered around the lifelong pastime of alpine skiing. With the help of people like you, the Alpine Ski Team can provide several internal benefits to a student's life, as well as external services to the community.

The Alpine Ski Team implicitly benefits the University of Minnesota through the team representing the school, portraying the University as the prestigious institution it is, and how it supports the wonderful sport of alpine skiing. This year, we have the ultimate chance to represent the Gophers through our qualification to the USCSA Nationals.

In addition, the Alpine Ski Team at the University is also a philanthropic entity, serving the community in multiple ways. On April 4th, 2014, the University of Minnesota Alpine Ski Team participated in Relay for Life, an affair bound to the fight against cancer. For a few weeks, the team worked on raising funds for this cause, and by the early morning of April 5th, the Alpine Ski Team had garnered over $1,000 for the occasion.

The Impact on the team, in raising funds for this National drive, would promote the existence of our program. In doing so, your donation would help foster the education, growth, and experience of several University of Minnesota students - many of which, this team means the world to.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like us on facebook - https://www.facebook.com/UMNAlpine?ref=br_tf, stay tuned, and watch us rip it out at Nationals!

story:
Our Story

Hi. My name is Talicia and I am raising money to fund my daughter's trip to NYC for the Finale National Show Choir competition. She is part of the JBHS Tech Crew which does lights and sound for all high school productions including our award winning Powerhouse show choir concerts and competitions.

Recently, I went on unpaid medical leave due to an injury and loss my job the day I returned to work. Because of this and the holiday, we are having a hard time funding her trip on our own.  I have already paid for more than half the trip personally and would appreciate any help you could give to pay the remaining balance. Even dollars add up.

The Impact

My daughter loves being part of something bigger than herself. Since joining tech crew, she is learning skills that she will use the rest of her life. My daughter would be devastated if she suddenly could not participate in this incredible opportunity with her school because of this series of unfortunate events. To see her not be able to attend this trip with her class will break my heart.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $600 by February 29th, 2012, for her to attend.

The total cost for the trip is $1500. This cost covers: Round trip Airfare, Transportation to & from airport to hotel and venues, a weekly subway pass, Entrance to Competition with Dinner included, A Boadway Show, Entrance to Ground Zero Memorial Tour, 4 night room (shared with 4-5 students), Lunch provided on rehearsal day, Food allowance for student 3 meals a day for 5 days.

 

You get the satisfaction of knowing you help a teenage girl follow her dreams of going to the city she plans on attending college in and competing in National Show Choir Competition and a thank you letter from Raima for any contribution. For contributions of $20 or more, she will use her fabulous photography skills and send you a signed print to hang on the wall of your home or office. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot donate, please spread the word to friends and family. Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alex Paige and for the 2013 spring semester I was accepted to embark on the Ocean Classroom Discovery High school program. The 17 week long voyage begins in St. Thomas, USVI and concludes in Bar Harbor. During the trip students learn how to maintain and eventually become deck hands on the 131 foot Harvey Gamage while also studying five rigorous academic courses: Navigation/Seamanship, Marine Science, Marine Applied Mathematics, Maritime History, and Maritime Literature. As a result of having courses that are relevant and integrated with the voyage, what is learned in academic studies can be easily applied to life aboard the ship.

I want to take the spring semester to do the Ocean Classroom Discovery High School trip because the voyage is an incredibly unique opportunity to study subjects that I am interested in, while at the same time having a fantastic and a potentially life-changing experience.

Video talking about the Ocean Classroom Foundation and the restoration of the Harvey Gamage.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xq822scyCZ8

Where Contributions Go:

Contributions will help off-set the cost of tuition. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Pass the link on

story:
My name is Justyce…I am a 17 yr old junior attending a non-traditional college prep school in Santa Monica, Ca.

I am honored to be a member of a wonderful organization called National Society of High School Scholars. Throughout the year they offer various programs from conventions, seminars, educational cruises and attendance at colleges around the world.

For many of us, the only way we can participate in many of these programs is by applying for and obtaining a scholarship. I was lucky enough to be selected to attend the prestigious University of Cambridge, UK. for summer classes.

 I am speechless, overwhelmed and just plain silly with happiness. This is the year of the Queen’s Jubilee as well as the Olympics….(which I’ve never seen up close)

I just have to get there…We all know that airline fares are “sky high” (yes, pun intended) and I must add to the $500.00 awarded by NSHSS to cover my tuition and extras.

This is where you come in….Any amount that you can donate will make me extremely grateful and a bit smarter too.

You may read all about:

 New Roads HS :    www.newroads.org

The NSHSS:            www.nshss.org

The University of Cambridge, UK:    http://www.cam.ac.uk/

Donations can be made through Paypal, Your credit card or check/Money Order payable to:  

Justyce Martirosian Account #....2792 

Navy Federal Credit Union   P.O. Box 3100 Merrifield Va.  22119-3100

 

If you are unable to donate...there is still a way for you to help...PLEASE...get the word out to any and everyone you know...You and they can be a part of helping me achieve a learning experience that I can share with some who may not get this great opportunity, while bolstering my chances of getting a desired and much needed college education.....

Thanks....I sincerely look forward to hearing from you...

story:
Hi there,

My name is Niall Johnson. I'm a senior at Stissing Mountain High School and my dream is to go on a road trip across this beautiful country. If you have read this far let me tell you a little about who you're funding. I grew up in a small little farm town called Stanfordville NY where everyone has known each other since they were in elementary school. My closest friends: Robert Schuyler, Katherine Gale and Brandan Maisonet and I became close after the loss of our friends Gian Stagnaro and Zach Pruner to a fatal car accident back in 2013. Ever since then we have believed in the saying "Live Life to the Fullest" Rob's a complete genius, a huge Beatles fan, and is a wiz with computers. Katherine is an environmentalist, a photographer and a fantastic self taught piano player and Brandan is the handy man, cook and mechanic. You can give him anything and he'll find a way to fix it. And then there's me. I'm a 6'4 history nerd who aspires to be a history teacher and loves theatre. A pretty unorthodox group right?

One thing we all share in common is our love for travel. We've driven to different historical monuments in Pennsylvania and Virginia, Niagara Falls and up to see our elderly friends near the tip of Lake Champlain. But nothing even close to as far as California.

One day while chatting on Facebook in late December, we decided that after graduation we needed to do one last final trip together before we go off and have to become adults. So Rob and I began mapping out our plan which he named "The Trans- Continental Magical Summer Adventure" The name sums up how monumental this trip is to us.  We plan on driving from New York to Idaho stopping at Mt Rushmore, Yellowstone and any other famous landmark that we pass. We'll be taking my 6 Speed 2006 Toyota Tacoma out as far as Idaho on July 19 then we'll rest at some family's house then back on the road to San Francisco and to see the Redwoods and the Pacific Ocean. Then on the way back access how much money we have left and forge our own way home.

We're going because as of September the only times I'll ever see these guys is when were home on break together and I plan on going to college far away so that will be very rare. On top of that, America has an amazing beauty that we all want to witness firsthand. Because of this we're working hard to put this plan which seemed farfetched at the time into reality. A final road trip. Since January, we've been fundraising religiously. We're all working and donating what we can to the cause. But to fund a road trip across the country costs a lot of money. We have raised over 300 dollars in the last month and currently I'm selling my Xbox One (and I love that thing) on EBay to do all I can to help fund this trip. If we can raise 500$ that will cover most of our gas and make our dream achievable.

Now, you may ask yourself, why should I give money to a bunch of kids so they can travel across the country? What good can come out of this? All four of us were born and raised in New York, and we are about to dive into the next chapter of our lives. Each of us is heading into a different field. Brandan plans to enlist in the U.S. Army. Rob is going on to study linguistics. Katherine plans to major in forest biology and eventually earn a PhD in Environmental Sciences. And I plan to study History and become a teacher . We are a just a handful of our nation's youth, each of us, has an influence on other members of our generation, and as we divert into our future fields, it expands our horizon of influence. This trip across the country, is not just to have a fun experience, it is to learn. Our goal in traveling across the north, is to learn about people, culture, and fiscal responsibility. We want to have experiences outside of our state borders, that will inspire us to make changes to this world. We want to see things we've never seen before. We also want to escape the social limits of being a teenager in today's world, where social media is increasing social anxiety. We want to experience independence, and experience what it truly means to live in America. Donating to us does not mean you are funding four young adults to go on vacation, it means you are giving members of a younger generation, the oportunity to experience something to inspire them for the rest of their lives, and hopefully encourage them to change the world.

Thank you for taking time out of your day to listen to my plea. May all of your own dreams come true. I cannot express how much I appreciate the help.

Sincerely,

Niall Johnson

story:
Our Story

Living Media International is an organization that provides educational opportunities through art, music, and creativity to young adults and children in rural Haiti. Sometimes, however, in the process of encouraging our young adults to be strong, innovative, leaders for their community, we are presented with unexpected opportunities to support education in our community in other ways. That's what happened in early 2011 when some of the students in our community classes came to us to tell us about a school which had become the victim of poor organizational planning and good intentions gone bad. The then, St. Jude School was established by another organization shortly after the 2010 earthquake for the many children in the community that were unable to go to other schools due to finances. That other organization, however, abandoned the school only a few months after starting, leaving the school of more than 150 children and a staff of 12 without support or direction. At that time, Living Media decided to help the school complete the year and have since fully adopted the school and renamed it New Life Primary.

The Project

Now we are undertaking the commitment to build them a brand new school building. The place where they are now is a small, damaged building which makes teaching and learning difficult. It is also a borrowed location and for the future of this school to adequately sustain the hopes of the children, we must build our own building that's made for each student to find success. The children need a place where thier imaginations can grow, and they are excited to come to school every morning. The teachers need a place where they have all of the space and materials to sufficiently instruct their students with a necessary level of structure and professionalism. Our community needs a place where they can feel proud to send their children even if they don't all have the financial means to send them to the other schools in the area.

By supporting our campaign you will be making a difference in the lives of these children and countless children in the future by giving them a place to belong and a place where they can believe in their own talents and dreams. Thank you for choosing to walk alongside the teachers and children at New Life Primary!

The entire project is estimated to cost $84,000 but we have been working on it since last summer.  We have started construction and only need about $20,000 more to finish all of the classrooms so that they can begin school by this coming fall.  If we surpass our goal, however, that's great because we will still need to buy supplies for teachers, cover their salaries for the coming year, buy textbooks for the children, and provide them with hot lunches. 

You Can Help!

Please donate today and you can receive one of our unique perks, many coming straight from Haiti, others being provided by volunteers of ours from the US.

Even if you are unable to donate at this time, there's still ways that you can get involved.  The number one thing you can do for us is share this campaign with everyone you know and encourage others to give.  Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Your blog, Email it out, do what you can to get more people to check out this page and learn about New Life Primary.  Simply for sharing this page somewhere, we will send you a friendship bracelet made by the children at one of our weekend clubs. You can also go like our Facebook page to stay up to date on our progress and be the first to know about future projects.

Interested in coming down to Haiti to visit New Life Primary? Email us for more info at newlifelmi@gmail.com.
