story:
Short Summary

     I've been going on mission trips to Costa Rica for about 5 years.  Last year I went on my first mission trip to Colombia, South America, and I absolutely loved it.  I fell in love with the country and its people.  God has called me back, so I am returning this summer for two different missions. 

     For the first mission, I am going with a group to an island near Cartegena.  While there, we will teach the kids English.  They will also be involved in Vacation Bible School type activities while we are there spending time with them at the church.

     For the second mission, I will meet another group of people from my area (Augusta/North Augusta) to travel to the Barranquilla and Bogota areas.  While there, we will do ministry in churches for adults,  children's ministry, youth ministry, and outreach on the streets of Bogota to homeless kids.

What We Need & What You Get  

     I will need at least $1,800 for these two missions.  I will go down to teach ESL (English as a second language) and continue in Colombia for the second mission.  The money you donate will go towards my airfare, lodging, food, and transporation.  Your contribution, whether it is prayer or financial assistance, is a blessing to me and an investment in His kingdom.  May God bless you for the seed you sow, and may it be multiplied back to you!

The Impact

     As with the other mission trips I have been on to Costa Rica and Colombia, our presence there before has made a huge impact on the people we have come in contact with.  Our goal is to be an instrument of His love to those we encounter during these mission endeavors, and I believe that God has used us as such.  We have built lasting relationships with those we have spent time with and ministered to on these trips and been used by God to impact the kingdom of God in a positive way by spreading the Good News.  We have seen God deliver and heal on these trips and also been inspired by the hearts of our fellow beleivers in other countries.  This time, I will also be able to teach English to children on an island near Cartegena, which will help them to be better equipped to make money in the future, thereby improving their quality of life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

     If you can't give financially, your prayers would be greatly appreciated!  Also, passing the word along to others is highly encouraged and appreciated as well. Thanks!!!

Short Summary
     I've been going on mission trips to Costa Rica for about 5 years.  Last year I went on my first mission trip to Colombia, South America, and I absolutely loved it.  I fell in love with the country and its people.  God has called me back, so I am returning this summer for two different missions. 
     For the first mission, I am going with a group to an island near Cartegena.  While there, we will teach the kids English.  They will also be involved in Vacation Bible School type activities while we are there spending time with them at the church.
     For the second mission, I will meet another group of people from my area (Augusta/North Augusta) to travel to the Barranquilla and Bogota areas.  While there, we will do ministry in churches for adults,  children's ministry, youth ministry, and outreach on the streets of Bogota to homeless kids.


What We Need & What You Get  
     I will need at least $1,800 for these two missions.  I will go down to teach ESL (English as a second language) and continue in Colombia for the second mission.  The money you donate will go towards my airfare, lodging, food, and transporation.  Your contribution, whether it is prayer or financial assistance, is a blessing to me and an investment in His kingdom.  May God bless you for the seed you sow, and may it be multiplied back to you!


The Impact
     As with the other mission trips I have been on to Costa Rica and Colombia, our presence there before has made a huge impact on the people we have come in contact with.  Our goal is to be an instrument of His love to those we encounter during these mission endeavors, and I believe that God has used us as such.  We have built lasting relationships with those we have spent time with and ministered to on these trips and been used by God to impact the kingdom of God in a positive way by spreading the Good News.  We have seen God deliver and heal on these trips and also been inspired by the hearts of our fellow beleivers in other countries.  This time, I will also be able to teach English to children on an island near Cartegena, which will help them to be better equipped to make money in the future, thereby improving their quality of life. 

Other Ways You Can Help
     If you can't give financially, your prayers would be greatly appreciated!  Also, passing the word along to others is highly encouraged and appreciated as well. Thanks!!!

story:
Translations for the ACIM Original Edition®

This historic document contains the message of ´A Course In Miracles´ prepared for the public by the author with Helen Schucman and Bill Thetford in 1972. This TRANSLATION PROJECT is a dream come true for CIMS (Course In Miracles Society) and is the realization of a desire by many people to read this material in their native language. However, the project needs your immediate help.

http://www.jcim.net/Pages/OrEd-Translations.html

What the project needs

The German translation and a complete audio-book is nearly finished, the Dutch in progress and Russian finished shortly from now. More than a thousand hours in the digital studio were invested in order to also provide students with the audible Course. Many experience the listening to ACIM as a great study help.

For supporting our cause in the spirit of the Atonement being "a lesson in sharing" (text) we are happy to share with you parts of the finished audio-book in German:

- The Manual for Teachers, as e-book and audio CD.

- Original Course inspired HappyDream-Music CD

The Impact so far...

The translations- and audio-book project has been designed as an interactive endeavor. On this website we have collected some inspiring feedback of readers and listeners. http://cimsmiracles.wordpress.com/category/translations-of-ored/

We are truly helpful to be able to make a contribution to the reception of the Course in the world!

http://jcim.mycafecommerce.com/product/all-tran...

www.acimradio.net

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is able to contribute some financial energy to the project, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • You might be enjyoing to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU in Christ for our friendship and shared effort to bring the Original Course In Miracles to a worldwide readership!

story:
About me

     Hi! My name is Dace and in this body I have lived 21 years. I grow up in a small country called Latvia besides the Baltic sea. Being the youngest child from five children made my childhood very connected to human relationships and trying to find my place in a very big spectrum of people. And because I was surrounded by people all the time I created the strong love for human beings and any human creature as well as the passion towards making people around me feel full of joy. For the past years I have been closely working with volunteer work, non-formal education and youth organizations to bring opportunities for young people to develop themselves and find their vocation, experience how by working together the joy of life arises. 

                               

                            

I am currently participating in social leadership training in Sweden called the Youth Initiative Program (YIP). This program consists of weekly courses on subjects that brings awareness of the world we are living in and how I as an individual can participate in it towards a better tomorrow. And the afternoon activities gives us possibility to put our initiatives to life. Living in close and strongly bonded community have brought a whole new look at the way to treat each other and cooperate towards positive change. 


One of the most important parts during this year is our internship that takes place in January and start of February, 2014 for 5-6 weeks. Since the start of the YIP year and researching the possibilities the network offers towards internship places my dream became to go to USA, L.A. and work with Orland Bishop (yip.se/orland-bishop) and Kiara Nagel (yip.se/kiara-nagel).
The work will involve working with people that have gone through crucial circumstances and need support and space to find their light and path towards the future. By mentoring and supporting individual and collective vocation the personal and community development is reached. The other big side of the internship will be focused on how we can find ways to collaborate together. The internship touches subjects as immigration, environmental justice, restorative justice, racism, sexism, war and conflict, culture and media, agreements, common principles, intentions and human rights. How can I as an individual create space for everybody around me to be fully themselves? When we are fully ourselves marvelous changes can be seen.

It is important to point out that because of the heavy job and unpredictable circumstances a lot of the time the work asks for flexibility and creativity towards what is happening around. I would describe my internship as opportunity for me to learn methods and approaches towards different people as well as provide the ability to learn from the people that I will meet giving a big impact on me, my world views and give insight on my contribution to this world.  

And of course growing up in small and sweet country as Latvia it always brought up in me the dream to see and experience that enormous space that such big country as USA can offer. So for years I have dreamed of going to USA. Dreams, dreams, dreams.. so many dreams in one trip. :)

Contribute to my dream 

Currently the biggest part of my budget that was provided from the YIP program have been spend on ticket for the long travel from Sweden to L.A. which have left me with no financial support for getting by in L.A. Your contributions will be spend on local travel coasts, VISA and food expanses and providing a little compensation for the people that is going to host me in L.A. 

As my campaign goal I set up the least of amount that would be necessary for me to go by in L.A. I would also appreciate every contribution even when the goal is reached already. I still have the calling to record my experience in a format of photography project and recording interviews with the people I meet. To meet this dream I would need more than the amount that is set as my goal so any contribution after my goal is reached goes towards the dream of creating an art work (buying camera, films, developing photos etc.) that could bring awareness of our ability to impact each other by just speaking, paying attention and encouraging each other. 

The Impact of your support

Your support will help me to experience events that could totally shape my life and give bigger meaning to my inner ideas of supporting people around me. I believe in the strong ability for us to do good if good is been done to me, to be human if others been human to me, to love if love have been brought up in me. My calling is to arise these capacities in myself and towards the people around me and to be able to learn how to provide space so it arises in all of us.

This experience would be a big learning point for me. I believe I can learn more than anything from the people I will have the pleasure to meet and by their impact on me I will be able to transform my passions into creation for the greater good. For me it is important to seek experiences that could broaden my world view and help me contribute to bigger level of developing a better future for my own country, community and as well bring love for people world wide. 

I want to point out that in this internship it is not my dream to go and save people but to go and learn from them and their stories. I believe it will create an awareness of how big as an impact it is when we stand on common ground and work from their on. It is a capacity that I feel needs to be developed more between human interactions when we try to collaborate together. It would create a whole different life if we would create space for each other to be ourselves, to do what we love and not to be judged by our past but to focus on what we are today. 

"Our work is based in common principals, intentions and agreements that take different forms and directions with different people at different times!"
(The Shade Tree Organization)

To achieve happiness in every house on this planet we have to start by bringing joy to the first house called "the inner me". 


                


Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate so much any kind of support. So if you feel inspired please share my campaign to spread the word and make my dream possible.

I am more than happy to answer any of your question (use the comment box below). 

From all of my heart I thank every one of you that took the time to read what are my inner calling towards my future possibilities.

Lots of love,

Dace

story:
Deutsche Version weiter unten. German version below.

____________________________________________________________________


Ruby Cup: A life changer.

Hello! We are the team behind Ruby Cup, a social business working in Berlin and Nairobi. Ruby Cup is improving menstrual hygiene for girls and women worldwide. 

Did you know that millions of girls living in poverty miss school because of their periods? Because they can’t afford pads and are afraid of staining their clothes, many girls end up staying home from school (UNDP, 2008). This amounts to missing 1 week per month or 20% of schooling and as a result, many girls drop out entirely. We want to change that.

Ruby Cup is a menstrual cup that lasts for 10 years. It is a hygienic, healthy and long-term solution for your period.

For every Ruby Cup that you buy for yourself through this campaign, we give one to a girl in Kenya. You can also choose only to donate, in case you already have one. For $8 you finance a Ruby Cup and, very importantly, education about reproductive help and menstrual hygiene.

This campaign

During the campaign, Maxie will be wearing a #brainpower HAT in public 24/7. It won't come off - not even for one second, until we have reached our goal.
Why? Because in Kenya, a Ruby Cup is #brainpower.  Maxie is wearing it for all the girls in Kenya. Below you can see how she wears the #brainpower hat in public, everywhere and anywhere.

How We Work

In 2011, we moved to Kenya to start working on the design and production of Ruby Cup in collaboration with our Kenyan team. One year later, we had designed the right packaging, product and educational materials to make Ruby Cup attractive to Kenyan girls. They wanted something cool, modern and pink. And here we are!

We began to sell Ruby Cups through local women in various slums. But that did not work. Why? Ruby Cups were simply unaffordable to the girls who needed them most. We had to find a way to cross-subsidize the product. So we started to sell Ruby Cup over the Internet. Today, every time we sell a Ruby Cup online, we donate one to a girl in Kenya. 

As part of our work, we educate girls about menstrual hygiene and reproductive health. Girls often don’t know what’s happening with their bodies – many don’t know that it’s normal to get a period, and some even think they’re sick. Menstruation is still a taboo. Help us break it!

We are very proud to have equipped 1,500 girls with Ruby Cups and education about reproductive health and menstrual hygiene in collaboration with our local partners.

Our team in Kenya educating girls about female anatomy.

Feedback

The program so far has been highly successful and girls' feedback has been overwhelmingly positive. Some wrote us letters about how much Ruby Cup has helped to improve their lives.

“Before I start using ruby cup I was using rags. Sometimes I was using pads I usually stay home until my menstruation stop because I become shy. But by now I am using Ruby cup I can do anything I can jump but before I was asking money for my boyfriends sometimes I was asking my mother sometimes when my mother doesn’t have money I usually use rages (…) I like ruby cup with all my heart because it is helping me so much.“ (Letter from Valentine Otiendo, 13 years old, August 2012).

The Problem

We’ve done a lot, but we want to do much more – and that’s where we need your help! Right now we are receiving numerous requests from organizations that would like to introduce Ruby Cups to girls in Kenya, and girls are asking us directly how they can get Ruby Cups themselves. We want to meet the demand but we have only a few Ruby Cups left and no means to finance a new round of production, and minimum order quantities mean we have to order a lot at once. So we need your help.

What We Need

We need $40,000 to finance a new batch of Ruby Cups and make a positive impact for 5,000 girls in Kenya.

  • We need $40,000 in order to finance a new batch of Ruby Cups. This will equip 5,000 girls with a long-lasting solution for managing their menstruation and allow them to attend school worry-free.
  • You get a chance to make a life-changing impact for a girl in Kenya.

What You Get

  • You get fantastic rewards in exchange for your support. They range signed marathon jerseys by Kenyna marathon runner Vincent Ochieng to Ruby Cups, a personal video message from a Kenyan girl to fair trade organic t-shirts with our Ruby message, “Consume less, Live more.” We also offer Ruby Cup t-shirts with our logo. Our most exclusive reward entails a field trip to Kenya to meet the team and be part of our work in the field. See your rewards below!

Our newest perk: Actress Ursula Karven has signed and donated her newly released book "Loslassen" (let go) in support of our campaign. See cover and signature below.

Vincent Ochieng, marathon runner form Kenya was so kind to donate his running jerseys.

Of course you can buy a Ruby Cup for yourself and one for a girl in Kenya. We also offer t-shirts and bags made from organic fair trade cotton.

Above: Examples of your perks: Ruby Cups, Ruby Cup with sterilizers, and our "Consume less, live more." fairtrade fashion organic cotton t-shirt and bag. And below our team wearing the exclusive Ruby T-shirt. You can get that, too.

Our Team


This is our team in Nairobi responsible for the education of girls and distribution of Ruby Cups: Maximilla, Amaia, Vanessa, Veronica, Shamim, Julie, and Rachael. 

Maxie, Eva, and Anka make up our team in Berlin. You can read more about our roles and who we are here.

Your Impact

  • For $8 you can give one Ruby Cup to a girl and Kenya. This includes not only the product itself but also educations about usage and menstrual hygiene and reproductive health in general.
  • You will help 5,000 girls receive a long-lasting solution to dealing with their periods. You’ll be helping them attend school without worries and you'll empower them and make their lives so much easier.  
  • You will help girls learn about reproductive health and help us to break the taboo surrounding menstruation. Girls will learn why they get their periods and that it is absolutely nothing to be ashamed of.
  • You will save our environment 60,000,000 tampons’ worth of waste, which would otherwise be created without the use of the Ruby Cup. 

Our partners


Additional Information

Who is behind Ruby Cup?

Ruby Cup was founded by Veronica D'Souza, Julie Weigaard Kjær and Maxie Matthiessen in 2011. They met in university and are all menstrual cup users. At some point they learned that menstruation is one of the main reasons why girls drop out of school. So they founded Ruby Cup because they believed that no girl or woman should face disadvantages because of her period. Since then, the Ruby Cup team has won several awards for their social mission and business model including The Global Social Entrepreneurship Competition (US) and Venture Cup (Denmark). Ruby Cup is a Sustainia100 Solution, finalist in Ben & Jerry's Join Our Core (EU), recipient of the Future Impact Award 2nd prize (Switzerland) and has been nominated for the German Engagement Prize.


Ruby Cup founders Veronica D'Souza, Julie Weigaard Kjær and Maxie Matthiessen.

What is Ruby Cup?

Ruby Cup is a healthy, high quality and eco-friendly menstrual cup made out of 100% medical grade silicone, reusable for up to 10 years. Its large capacity means that you can go up to 12 hours without emptying it. This makes it especially good for school girls, since they can go a whole school day without emptying it. Ruby Cup comes in one size that fits comfortably before or after childbirth.


What if you like our work but don't have money to give?

No money? No problem. There are other ways you can help. Please spread the word and share this with you friends via email, Facebook, and Twitter. We understand that not everyone has the financial means to contribute. By spreading this in your network, you can do a little to make a big impact.

Acknowledgements

This campaign would not have been possible without the following people: Producers Ömer Mutlu and Allesandro Rovere from Namugrafie; Scriptwriter Natalie Krane; Make up: Mica Frisch; Campaign photographer: Jochen Tan; Connector: Jan Stassen.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Deutsche Version. German version below:

Ruby Cup: Unterstütze mit uns Mädchen in Kenia!

Hallo,

Wir sind das Team hinter Ruby Cup, einem sozialen Unternehmen aus Berlin und Nairobi. Ruby Cup verbessert die Menstruationshygiene von Frauen und Mädchen weltweit.

Wusstest Du, dass Millionen von Mädchen in armen Regionen wegen ihrer Periode nicht in die Schule gehen? Sie können sich Binden und Tampons einfach nicht leisten und bleiben zu Hause, um sich nicht mit Blutflecken auf der Kleidung zu blamieren. Als Folge brechen viele Mädchen die Schule ganz ab, denn 1 Woche pro Monat der Schule zu verpassen ist eindeutig zu viel.

Ruby Cup ist eine Menstruationstasse, die für 10 Jahre hält. Es ist eine hygienische und langlebige Lösung, mit der Mädchen ihre komplette Ausbildung von der Grundschule zur Universität abschließen können ohne sich über ihre Periode Gedanken machen zu müssen.

Wie wir arbeiten

Im Jahr 2011 sind wir nach Kenia gezogen, um gemeinsam mit unserem kenianischen Team das Design zu gestalten und die Produktion von Ruby Cup zu beginnen. Ein Jahr später hatten wir das perfekte Produkt, inklusive Verpackung und Bildungsmaterial, sodass Ruby Cup für Kenianerinnen ansprechend ist. Sie wollten etwas Cooles, Modernes und Pinkes. Und hier sind wir angelangt.

Wir begannen Ruby Cup durch lokale Frauen in verschiedenen Slums zu verkaufen. Das hat jedoch nicht geklappt. Warum? Ruby Cup war einfach nicht erschwinglich für die Mädchen, die es am Dringendsten brauchen. Wir mussten Wege finden, mit denen wir den Preis querfinanzieren konnten. Also begannen wir Ruby Cup über das Internet zu verkaufen – nach dem Prinzip „Buy One, Give One“. Heute wird immer wenn wir einen Ruby Cup verkaufen, einer an ein Mädchen in Kenia gespendet.

Als Teil unserer Arbeit bilden wir Mädchen zu Menstruationshygiene und reproduktiver Gesundheit. Sie wissen häufig nicht, was mit ihren Körpern passiert, dass die Periode völlig normal ist und manche glauben sogar krank zu sein. Menstruation ist immer noch ein starkes Tabu. Hilf uns, es zu brechen!

Wir sind stolz, schon 1500 Mädchen mit Ruby Cup geholfen zu haben und sie in Zusammenarbeit mit lokalen Partnern über ihre Körper und Menstruation aufgeklärt zu haben.

Feedback

Bisher war unsere Arbeit ein großer Erfolg und das Feedback der Mädchen überragend positiv. Manche schrieben uns Briefe, um uns zu sagen, wie sehr Ruby Cup ihr Leben verbessert hat.

„Bevor ich Ruby Cup benutzt habe, habe ich Stofflappen benutzt oder manchmal auch Binden. (…) Vorher musste ich meine Freunde oder meine Mama fragen, ob sie Geld (für Binden) haben. Wenn meine Mama kein Geld hatte, habe ich meist Lumpen genommen und bin zuhause geblieben, weil ich mich schämte zur Schule zu gehen. (...) Ich liebe Ruby Cup von ganzem Herzen, weil er mir so sehr hilft. Ich bin ja nicht einmal mehr zur Schule gegangen, weil ich fürchtete, dass meine Freunde merken, dass ich meine Periode habe und mich geniert habe.“ (aus einem Brief von Valentina Otiendo, 13 Jahre alt, August 2012)

Das Problem

Wir wollen noch viel mehr machen und brauchen deshalb Deine Hilfe! Im Moment stehen wir vor dem Dilemma, dass wir zahllose Anfragen von Organisationen bekommen, die gerne Ruby Cups an Mädchen in Kenia bringen würden. Oder Mädchen fragen uns direkt, wo sie Ruby Cup herkriegen können. Wir haben jedoch nicht die Mittel um eine neue Ladung Ruby Cups zu finanzieren und nur noch wenige Cups übrig. Wir müssen aufgrund der Mindestbestellmenge immer viele auf einmal bestellen. Deshalb brauchen wir Eure Hilfe.

Was wir brauchen & Was Du bekommst

Wir brauchen 40 000 Dollar um unsere zweite Ladung Ruby Cups zu finanzieren und eine positive Veränderung für 5 000 Mädchen in Kenia zu schaffen!

  • Wir brauchen 40 000 Dollar um neue Ruby Cups zu produzieren. Das wird 5 000 Mädchen eine zehnjährige, nachhaltige Lösung für den Umgang mit ihrer Menstruation bieten und sie sorgenfrei die Schule besuchen lassen.
  • Wir bieten tolle Belohnungen für Deine Unterstützung, etwa eine persönliche Videobotschaft oder ökologische Fairtrade-T-Shirts mit der Ruby-Botschaft „Consume less, live more“. Außerdem bieten wir Ruby Cup T-Shirts mit unserem Logo. Unsere exklusivste Belohnung ist ein Besuch in Kenia, um das Team kennenzulernen und Teil unserer Arbeit vor Ort zu sein.

Unser Team

Unser Team in Nairobi, verantwortlich für die Ausbildung der Mädchen und das Verteilen der Ruby Cups, besteht aus: Maximilla, Amaia, Vanessa, Veronica, Shamim, Julie und Rachael. Unser Team in Berlin besteht aus Maxie, Eva und Anka. Mehr über uns gibt es hier

Dein Einfluss

  • Du wirst 5 000 Mädchen eine langlebige Lösung bieten, um mit ihrer Periode umzugehen. Das wird ihnen helfen, die Schule sorgenfrei zu besuchen, sie zu stärken und ihr Leben so viel einfacher machen.
  • Du wirst dazu helfen, dass Mädchen über reproduktive Gesundheit lernen! Uns wirst Du helfen, das Tabu rund um das Thema Menstruation zu brechen! Mädchen werden lernen, warum sie ihre Periode bekommen und das es nichts ist, wofür sie sich schämen sollten.
  • Du wirst der Umwelt den Müll von 60 000 000 Tampons ersparen, der ohne Ruby Cup anfallen würde.

Zusätzliche Information

Wer gehört zu Ruby Cup?

Ruby Cup wurde 2011 von Veronica D'Souza, Julie Weigaard Kjær und Maxie Matthiessen gegründet. Sie kennen sich aus der Universität und nutzten selbst schon Menstruationstassen. Dann erfuhren sie, dass Menstruation einer der Hauptgründe dafür ist, dass Mädchen die Schule abbrechen. Also wurde Ruby Cup gegründet, denn sie glaubten daran, dass keine Frau und kein Mädchen aufgrund ihrer Periode benachteiligt sein sollte. Seitdem hat das Ruby Cup Team mehrere Preise für die soziale Mission und das Businessmodell gewonnen: The Global Social Entrepreneurship Competition (US) und den Venture Cup (Denmark). Ruby Cup ist eine Sustainia100 Solution, Finalistin in Ben & Jerry's Join Our Core (EU), erhielt denFuture Impact Award 2nd prize (Switzerland) und wurde für den Deutschen Engagementpreis nominiert.

Was ist Ruby Cup?

Ruby Cup ist eine gesunde, hochqualitative und ökologische Menstruationstasse aus 100 Prozent medizinischem Silikon und bis zu 10 Jahre wiederverwendbar. Die große Kapazität macht es möglich, dass der Menstruations-Cup bis zu 12 Stunden im Körper bleiben kann. Das ist besonders gut für Schülerinnen, die es den ganzen Schultag über nicht leeren müssen. Ruby Cup hat eine Einheitsgröße, die sich für alle Frauen eignet, egal ob sie schon geboren haben.

Was passiert, wenn wir unser Spendenziel nicht erreichen?

Unser Team ist bekannt dafür Dinge anzustoßen. Sollten wir das Spendenziel nicht erreichen, könnten wir vorerst keine Cups mehr produzieren; unsere Aufklärungsarbeit zu Menstruationshygiene in Kenia würden wir weiter fortsetzen. Also: Jeder Cent zählt.

Was kannst Du tun, wenn Du kein Geld hast, um uns zu unterstützen?

Kein Geld? Kein Problem. Es gibt andere Wege, uns zu unterstützen. Bitte erzähle Deinen FreundInnen via Email, Facebook, Twitter.... von uns. Wir verstehen, dass nicht alle die finanziellen Mittel haben, um uns zu unterstützen. Wenn Du hilfst, unsere Kampagne bekannt zu machen, kannst Du mit einem kleinen Aufwand Großes bewirken!

Danksagung

Diese Kampagne wäre ohne die folgenden Personen nicht möglich gewesen: Produzenten Ömer Mutlu und Allesandro Rovero von Namugrafie, Drehbuchautorin Natalie Krane, Make-Up Mica Frisch, Fotograf Jochen Tan und dem, der uns einander vorgestellt hat: Jan Stassen
story_txt:
Deutsche Version weiter unten. German version below.____________________________________________________________________Ruby Cup: A life changer.




Hello! We are the team behind Ruby Cup, a social
business working in Berlin and Nairobi. Ruby Cup is improving menstrual hygiene
for girls and women worldwide. Did you know that millions of girls living in
poverty miss school because of their periods? Because they can’t afford pads
and are afraid of staining their clothes, many girls end up staying home from
school (UNDP, 2008). This amounts to missing 1 week
per month or 20% of schooling and as a result, many girls drop out entirely. We want to change that.
Ruby Cup is a menstrual cup that lasts for 10
years. It is a hygienic, healthy and long-term solution for your period.For every Ruby Cup that you buy for yourself through this campaign, we give one to a girl in Kenya. You can also choose only to donate, in case you already have one. For $8 you finance a Ruby Cup and, very importantly, education about reproductive help and menstrual hygiene.This campaignDuring the campaign, Maxie will be wearing a #brainpower HAT in public  24/7. It won't come off - not even for one second, until we have reached our goal.  Why? Because in Kenya, a Ruby Cup is #brainpower.  Maxie is wearing it for all the girls in Kenya. Below you can see how she wears the #brainpower hat in public, everywhere and anywhere.How We WorkIn 2011, we moved to Kenya to start working on
the design and production of Ruby Cup in collaboration with our Kenyan team.
One year later, we had designed the right packaging, product and educational
materials to make Ruby Cup attractive to Kenyan girls. They wanted something
cool, modern and pink. And here we are! 
We began to sell Ruby Cups through local women in
various slums. But that did not work. Why? Ruby Cups were simply unaffordable
to the girls who needed them most. We had to find a way to cross-subsidize the product.
So we started to sell Ruby Cup over the Internet. Today, every time we sell a
Ruby Cup online, we
donate one to a girl in Kenya. 
As part of our work, we educate girls about
menstrual hygiene and reproductive health. Girls often don’t know what’s
happening with their bodies – many don’t know that it’s normal to get a period,
and some even think they’re sick. Menstruation is still a taboo. Help us break
it!
We are
very proud to have equipped 1,500 girls with Ruby Cups and education about
reproductive health and menstrual hygiene in collaboration with our local
partners.
Our team in Kenya educating girls about female
anatomy.Feedback
The program so far has been highly successful and girls' feedback has been overwhelmingly positive. Some wrote us letters about how much Ruby Cup has helped to improve their lives.
“Before
I start using ruby cup I was using rags. Sometimes I was using pads I usually
stay home until my menstruation stop because I become shy. But by now I am
using Ruby cup I can do anything I can jump but before I was asking money for
my boyfriends sometimes I was asking my mother sometimes when my mother doesn’t
have money I usually use rages (…) I like ruby cup with all my heart because it
is helping me so much.“ (Letter from Valentine Otiendo, 13 years old, August 2012). The Problem
We’ve done a lot, but we want to do much more –
and that’s where we need your help! Right now we are receiving numerous requests
from organizations that would like to introduce Ruby Cups to girls in Kenya,
and girls are asking us directly how they can get Ruby Cups themselves. We want
to meet the demand but we have only a few Ruby Cups left and no means to
finance a new round of production, and minimum order quantities mean we have to
order a lot at once. So we need your help.
What We Need 
We need $40,000 to finance a new batch of
Ruby Cups and make a positive impact for 5,000 girls in Kenya.

We need $40,000 in order to finance a new batch of Ruby Cups. This will equip 5,000 girls with a long-lasting solution for managing their menstruation and allow them to attend school worry-free.You get a chance to make a life-changing impact for a girl in Kenya.What You GetYou get fantastic rewards in exchange for your support. They range
signed marathon jerseys by Kenyna marathon runner Vincent Ochieng to Ruby Cups, a personal video message from a Kenyan girl to fair trade organic t-shirts
with our Ruby message, “Consume less, Live more.” We also offer Ruby Cup t-shirts
with our logo. Our most exclusive reward entails a field trip to Kenya to meet
the team and be part of our work in the field. See your rewards below!Our newest perk: Actress Ursula Karven has signed and donated her newly released book "Loslassen" (let go) in support of our campaign. See cover and signature below.Vincent Ochieng, marathon runner form Kenya was so kind to donate his running jerseys.Of course you can buy a Ruby Cup for yourself and one for a girl in Kenya. We also offer t-shirts and bags made from organic fair trade cotton.Above: Examples of your perks: Ruby Cups, Ruby Cup with sterilizers, and our "Consume less, live more." fairtrade fashion organic cotton t-shirt and bag. And below our team wearing the exclusive Ruby T-shirt. You can get that, too.Our TeamThis is our team in Nairobi responsible for the education of girls and distribution of Ruby Cups: Maximilla, Amaia, Vanessa, Veronica, Shamim, Julie, and Rachael. Maxie, Eva, and Anka make up our team in Berlin. You
can read more about our roles and who we are here.Your Impact

For $8 you can give one Ruby Cup to a girl and Kenya. This includes not only the product itself but also educations about usage and menstrual hygiene and reproductive health in general.

You will help 5,000 girls receive a long-lasting solution to dealing with their periods. You’ll be helping them attend school without worries and you'll empower them and make their lives so much easier.  
You will help girls learn about reproductive health and help us to break the taboo surrounding menstruation. Girls will learn why they get their periods and that it is absolutely nothing to be ashamed of. 
You will save our environment 60,000,000 tampons’ worth of waste, which would otherwise be created without the use of the Ruby Cup. 
Our partnersAdditional InformationWho is behind Ruby Cup?Ruby Cup was founded by Veronica D'Souza, Julie
Weigaard Kjær and Maxie Matthiessen in 2011. They met in university and are all
menstrual cup users. At some point they learned that menstruation is one of the
main reasons why girls drop out of school. So they founded Ruby Cup because
they believed that no girl or woman should face disadvantages because of her
period. Since then, the Ruby Cup team has won several awards for their social
mission and business model including The Global Social Entrepreneurship
Competition (US) and Venture Cup (Denmark). Ruby Cup is a Sustainia100
Solution, finalist in Ben & Jerry's Join Our Core (EU), recipient of the
Future Impact Award 2nd prize (Switzerland) and has been nominated for the
German Engagement Prize.Ruby Cup founders Veronica D'Souza, Julie Weigaard Kjær and Maxie Matthiessen.What is Ruby Cup?Ruby Cup is a healthy, high quality and
eco-friendly menstrual cup made out of 100% medical grade silicone, reusable
for up to 10 years. Its large capacity means that you can go up to 12 hours
without emptying it. This makes it especially good for school girls, since they
can go a whole school day without emptying it. Ruby Cup comes in one size that
fits comfortably before or after childbirth.What if you like our work but don't have money to give?No money? No problem. There are other ways you
can help. Please spread the word and share this with you friends via email,
Facebook, and Twitter. We understand that not everyone has the financial means
to contribute. By spreading this in your network, you can do a little to make a
big impact.Acknowledgements This campaign would not have been 
possible without the following people: Producers Ömer Mutlu and Allesandro Rovere from Namugrafie; Scriptwriter Natalie Krane; Make up: Mica Frisch; Campaign photographer: Jochen Tan; Connector: Jan Stassen.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Deutsche Version. German version below:Ruby
Cup: Unterstütze mit uns Mädchen in Kenia!
Hallo, Wir sind das Team hinter Ruby Cup, einem sozialen Unternehmen aus
Berlin und Nairobi. Ruby Cup verbessert die Menstruationshygiene von
Frauen und Mädchen weltweit.
Wusstest
Du, dass Millionen von Mädchen in armen Regionen wegen ihrer Periode
nicht in die Schule gehen? Sie können sich Binden und Tampons
einfach nicht leisten und bleiben zu Hause, um sich nicht mit
Blutflecken auf der Kleidung zu blamieren. Als Folge brechen viele
Mädchen die Schule ganz ab, denn 1 Woche pro Monat der Schule zu
verpassen ist eindeutig zu viel.
Ruby
Cup ist eine Menstruationstasse, die für 10 Jahre hält. Es ist eine
hygienische und langlebige Lösung, mit der Mädchen ihre komplette
Ausbildung von der Grundschule zur Universität abschließen können ohne
sich über ihre Periode Gedanken machen zu müssen.Wie
wir arbeiten
Im
Jahr 2011 sind wir nach Kenia gezogen, um gemeinsam mit unserem
kenianischen Team das Design zu gestalten und die Produktion von Ruby
Cup zu beginnen. Ein Jahr später hatten wir das perfekte Produkt,
inklusive Verpackung und Bildungsmaterial, sodass Ruby Cup für
Kenianerinnen ansprechend ist. Sie wollten etwas Cooles, Modernes und Pinkes. Und hier sind wir angelangt.
Wir
begannen Ruby Cup durch lokale Frauen in verschiedenen Slums zu
verkaufen. Das hat jedoch nicht geklappt. Warum? Ruby Cup war einfach
nicht erschwinglich für die Mädchen, die es am Dringendsten
brauchen. Wir mussten Wege finden, mit denen wir den Preis
querfinanzieren konnten. Also begannen wir Ruby Cup über das
Internet zu verkaufen – nach dem Prinzip „Buy One, Give One“.
Heute wird immer wenn wir einen Ruby Cup verkaufen, einer an ein
Mädchen in Kenia gespendet.
Als
Teil unserer Arbeit bilden wir Mädchen zu Menstruationshygiene und
reproduktiver Gesundheit. Sie wissen häufig nicht, was mit ihren
Körpern passiert, dass die Periode völlig normal ist und manche
glauben sogar krank zu sein. Menstruation ist immer noch ein
starkes Tabu. Hilf uns, es zu brechen!
Wir
sind stolz, schon 1500 Mädchen mit Ruby Cup geholfen zu haben und
sie in Zusammenarbeit mit lokalen Partnern über ihre Körper und
Menstruation aufgeklärt zu haben.Feedback
Bisher
war unsere Arbeit ein großer Erfolg und das Feedback der Mädchen
überragend positiv. Manche schrieben uns Briefe, um uns zu sagen,
wie sehr Ruby Cup ihr Leben verbessert hat. 

„Bevor
ich Ruby Cup benutzt habe, habe ich Stofflappen benutzt oder manchmal
auch Binden. (…) Vorher musste ich meine Freunde oder meine Mama
fragen, ob sie Geld (für Binden) haben. Wenn meine Mama kein Geld
hatte, habe ich meist Lumpen genommen und bin zuhause geblieben, weil
ich mich schämte zur Schule zu gehen. (...) Ich liebe Ruby Cup von
ganzem Herzen, weil er mir so sehr hilft. Ich bin ja nicht einmal
mehr zur Schule gegangen, weil ich fürchtete, dass meine Freunde
merken, dass ich meine Periode habe und mich geniert habe.“ (aus
einem Brief von Valentina Otiendo, 13 Jahre alt, August 2012)Das
Problem
Wir
wollen noch viel mehr machen und brauchen deshalb Deine Hilfe! Im
Moment stehen wir vor dem Dilemma, dass wir zahllose Anfragen
von Organisationen bekommen, die gerne Ruby Cups an Mädchen in Kenia
bringen würden. Oder Mädchen fragen uns direkt, wo sie Ruby Cup
herkriegen können. Wir haben jedoch nicht die Mittel um eine neue
Ladung Ruby Cups zu finanzieren und nur noch wenige Cups übrig. Wir
müssen aufgrund der
Mindestbestellmenge immer viele auf einmal bestellen. Deshalb brauchen wir Eure Hilfe. 
Was
wir brauchen & Was Du bekommst
Wir
brauchen 40 000 Dollar um unsere zweite Ladung Ruby Cups zu finanzieren
und eine positive Veränderung für 5 000 Mädchen in Kenia zu
schaffen!

Wir brauchen 40 000 Dollar um neue Ruby Cups zu produzieren. Das wird
5 000 Mädchen eine zehnjährige, nachhaltige Lösung für den Umgang
mit ihrer Menstruation bieten und sie sorgenfrei die Schule besuchen
lassen.
Wir bieten tolle Belohnungen für Deine Unterstützung, etwa eine
persönliche Videobotschaft oder ökologische Fairtrade-T-Shirts mit
der Ruby-Botschaft „Consume less, live more“. Außerdem bieten
wir Ruby Cup T-Shirts mit unserem Logo. Unsere exklusivste Belohnung ist ein Besuch in Kenia, um das Team kennenzulernen und Teil
unserer Arbeit vor Ort zu sein.

Unser
Team
Unser Team in Nairobi, verantwortlich für die Ausbildung der
Mädchen und das Verteilen der Ruby Cups, besteht aus: Maximilla, Amaia, Vanessa,
Veronica, Shamim, Julie und Rachael. Unser Team in Berlin besteht aus
Maxie, Eva und Anka. Mehr über uns gibt es hierDein
Einfluss

Du wirst 5 000 Mädchen eine langlebige Lösung bieten, um mit ihrer
Periode umzugehen. Das wird ihnen helfen, die Schule sorgenfrei zu
besuchen, sie zu stärken und ihr Leben so viel einfacher machen.
Du wirst dazu helfen, dass Mädchen über reproduktive Gesundheit
lernen! Uns wirst Du helfen, das Tabu rund um das Thema Menstruation
zu brechen! Mädchen werden lernen, warum sie ihre Periode bekommen
und das es nichts ist, wofür sie sich schämen sollten.
Du wirst der Umwelt den Müll von 60 000 000 Tampons ersparen, der
ohne Ruby Cup anfallen würde.

Zusätzliche
Information

gehört zu Ruby Cup?
Ruby

Matthiessen gegründet. Sie kennen sich aus der Universität und

benachteiligt sein sollte. Seitdem hat das Ruby Cup Team mehrere

(Denmark). Ruby Cup ist eine Sustainia100 Solution, Finalistin in Ben

prize (Switzerland) und wurde für den Deutschen Engagementpreis
nominiert.Was
ist Ruby Cup?

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Sophie Gunn (John Gunn is my father) and I am the treasurer this year of the Model United Nations Club at Bard High School Early College. We need financial support to be able to offer all students participation in the club, regardless of their financial situation. Model UN offers students of all grade levels a unique opportunity to learn outside of the classroom. Please help us in offering this experience to all students.

What We Need

  • As a Model United Nations club based in a public high school we are already at a disadvantage in conferences. We receive little funding from the PTA, and because the school does not subsidize our trips, each participant often must pay up to $400 per trip to participate in a conference. 
  • We would like to use any and all funds we receive for scholarships for students to come with us to conferences. 

The Impact

  • Model UN allows for students to learn outside of the classroom. In preparing for conferences, students learn how to do research on modern current events topics, analyzing various resources such as foreign newspapers, government websites, and historical records. They then must consolidate this information into a position paper, as they clarify and report their position to their chairman. In conferences, students learn to collaborate with others, as well as compete with strangers, preparing students for real-world situations. 
  • Our club is one of the largest and most successful clubs at Bard High School Early College with participation in all four grade levels from more than forty students.
  • With your support we can help students build their own potential through the unique learning experience that is Model United Nations.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word about our campaign!

story:
Basketballs for St. Kitts!

Who we are

BJ Mumford

I am an aspiring basketball coach, currently living in St. Kitts while my wife attends veterinary school. We have been living here for 2 years, and have about 10 months left until graduation. I have been spending 4-6 hours every day at different basketball courts around the island, coaching players from ages 6 -40 years old at levels ranging from beginner to Senior National Team. I am leading the national team development and youth basketball development programs, and working on training and developing potential athletes to play collegiate basketball.In my spare time, I am pursuing a Bachelor of Sport Science major in Coaching from the United States Sports Academy, planning to graduate in 2016.

 

Brian Spugnardi

While our wives are chasing their dreams, BJ and I are taking the oppportunity to chase ours.  I have always taken an interest in photography.  Last summer I started intently studying composition, lighting, and anything photography, spending many evenings driving down every road I had never been down to see what I could capture.  Now that I am in St. Kitts, I have a great amount of time to devote to one thing I have always searched for: my passion, photography.  This campaign is my first attempt at a fully produced video and is creating new opportunities and new ideas.  My goal is to be an established landscape photographer.  

www.facebook.com/BrianSpugnardiPhotography

 

What we want to do

We want to get 20 new basketballs shipped to St. Kitts by the end of the summer to use in upcoming summer camps, as well as youth development leagues that will begin in the fall. With shipping and import costs, one new basketball will cost about $25US. 20 balls X $25=$500.  Unlike the public equipment basketballs, these will be donated as a personal basketball to each player that completes a summer training program, allowing them to continue to improve their skills long after we have left the island. The amount of basketball courts on the island is amazing, but there are very few basketballs, and combined with a lack of youth development organization, most players don't start learning any basketball until age 16.

 

Why we want to do it

Most young players in St. Kitts have very few toys, and even less sports equipment, it is very common for a majority of kids to play basketball either barefoot or in flip-flops. With minimum wage at $3US per hour, and new basketball costs at over $40US, most families cannot afford to buy a ball for their child. We want to raise awareness to the international community, as well as the local sports community, of the potential athletes that are waiting to learn the skills required to pursue their dreams of playing basketball. By putting a ball in their hands and giving them the mindset that they can accomplish anything, we hope to empower a generation of kids to pursue self improvement, personal responsibility, and care for personal property.

 

What you get in return

Besides a warm fuzzy feeling inside, we will be sending you a link to a video of the basketballs in use, as well as a picture of the child that received the ball you donated!

Even if you can't afford a donation, sharing this project and video will greatly help our cause! Spread the word!

story:
The OpenCoNY Festival

The best way to experience and learn about the innovation economy isn't in a stuffy ballroom - it is up close and personal and in its native habitat. Experienced marketers and conference organizers Brian Monahan and John Battelle would like your support for a new type of business conference called OpenCo, which we like to think of as a mix between a business conference and artist's open studio with the vibe of a music festival. With your help, more than 100 of the most innovative businesses in NY will open their doors to the public on May 23rd.

This festival of innovation will celebrate companies that embrace a set of values surrounding the concept of openness: open collaboration, open communication, open community, open company and open doors to you. Attendees will meet these innovators in their native habitat and hear from the founders and executives about how they are trying to change the world and why. They will inspire you and help you make new connections, whether you are a job seeker, investor or simply a curious neighbor.

We already have a growing list of host companies ("HostCos"), who have signed on to open up their doors and share their vision including: AOL, AppNexus, Betaworks,  Business Insider, Buzzfeed, Estee Lauder Online, Etsy, Fab.com, Foursquare, General Assembly, Kickstarter, Lerer Ventures, Local Response, Pave, PolicyMic, Rap Genius, Rebelmouse, Thrillist, Warby Parker, ZocDoc and many more coming soon!

We ran a "beta test" of OpenCo in San Francisco last Fall and the one day event was a huge success. We had over 80 participating companies and 2,000 registered festival goers. Here is a video that gives you a taste of that event: 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ka00j0S93Pc

We hope that you will help us launch the first-ever, three-day OpenCo in New York City. We're expanding everything - the technology platform, the video coverage, the staffing, and the services we provide to HostCos and partners. We are increasing onsite video coverage so that these exciting stories remain told throughout the year and to audiences far and wide.

Please help us support some of NYC's most exciting and dynamic companies...

John Battelle and Brian Monahan

Co-founders, OpenCo

For more info on OpenCo including the companies and individuals participating, please visit: http://openco.us
story_txt:
The OpenCoNY Festival
The best way to experience and learn about the innovation economy isn't in a stuffy ballroom - it is up close and personal and in its native habitat. Experienced marketers and conference organizers Brian Monahan and John Battelle would like your support for a new type of business conference called OpenCo, which we like to think of as a mix between a business conference and artist's open studio with the vibe of a music festival. With your help, more than 100 of the most innovative businesses in NY will open their doors to the public on May 23rd.

This festival of innovation will celebrate companies that embrace a set of values surrounding the concept of openness: open collaboration, open communication, open community, open company and open doors to you. Attendees will meet these innovators in their native habitat and hear from the founders and executives about how they are trying to change the world and why. They will inspire you and help you make new connections, whether you are a job seeker, investor or simply a curious neighbor.
We already have a growing list of host companies ("HostCos"), who have signed on to open up their doors and share their vision including: AOL, AppNexus, Betaworks,  Business Insider, Buzzfeed, Estee Lauder Online, Etsy, Fab.com, Foursquare, General Assembly, Kickstarter, Lerer Ventures, Local Response, Pave, PolicyMic, Rap Genius, Rebelmouse, Thrillist, Warby Parker, ZocDoc and many more coming soon!

story:
Short Summary

  My name is Mariah Brown and I am 12 years old. Two years ago, (2011) my family and I took a trip to Ghana, Africa. It was the first time I had gone to Africa. We visited many places including a school in the village of Ayase, where my father grew up. There were about 25 children in each classroom, but I noticed that they had to share one textbook and pass it around the classroom to review the information. This meant that none of the children could take the book home to study.

   When we returned home, I asked my Mom and Dad if we could build a library to help the children. The library could be filled with books they needed to help them get ahead and study and we could also put in computers. My parents agreed, so in 2012 we went back to Ghana to start planning the future library. The Ayase Library in Ghana, Africa is now almost complete, but we need your help to put books, furniture, and computers in the library to give the children a chance to thrive and do something extraordinary.  

The library will be run by the school headmaster and school volunteers.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal right now is to raise $6,000.00 to be used towards buying books, computers and furnishing the library. After we finish this library and it's up and running, we would like to start building other libraries in other villages. What's in it for you? Well, you get to help children in poor villages have a brighter future and by donating even a little bit you are giving them a chance for a better life.

The Impact

The impact your donations will give the entire village and the surrounding areas the opportunity to bring the world to their small villages via books and computers. The library will also help develop learning skills, interest in reading and good study habits.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't doante please make sure to spread the word and like us on facebook at: The Ayase Library Project https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Ayase-Library-Project/569925549737098 . Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks! :)

Mariah Brown and family

story:
About The Becoming Dad Project

Darren Mattock is the founder of Becoming Dad and leading The Becoming Dad Project.

In 2008, Darren became dad to his son, Charlie. It changed his life in the most awesome and amazing ways, and set him on a path that he continues to follow with passion and purpose to make a positive difference for dads, mums, babies, families and communities globally.

For the past five years, Darren has engaged, educated and supported expectant and new dads as they prepare for birth and the role of fatherhood. During this time, as a rare masculine presence working in this privileged role, he has gained unique insights into the experiences and insights of men as they are 'becoming dad'.

Over time, the stories, sharing, educating, supporting and witnessing of men on their birth preparation and fatherhood preparation journeys have taken shape. Darren's vision is now clear; it is The Becoming Dad Project.

Please take a few minutes to watch the video to hear and learn more about The Becoming Dad Project.

We need your help to take The Becoming Dad Project to the next level!

The 'Next Steps' for Becoming Dad

By funding this project, you can support Becoming Dad to:

Develop a new Becoming Dad Website

The Becoming Dad Project will launch a new website in January 2014. The website will be a portal to the stories of expectant and new dads, shared as individual blog posts. Stories will be shared with video, images, words and art as an initiative to further illuminate the expectant and new fatherhood experience for us all to learn from - especially other expectant and new dads! They will be archived so they can be accessible as a free community resource.

Develop Online Programs for Expectant and New Dads

The Becoming Dad Project will create, develop and deliver programs for expectant and new dads focused on birth preparation, fatherhood preparation and managing the changes in their lives as men, partners and fathers.

Our 'perks' give you a few options to support The Becoming Dad Project.

This is a unique opportunity to contribute directly to our work behind the scenes. You can make a real difference, helping us to shine light on the expectant and new fatherhood spaces and create these invaluable resources and opportunities for dads.

Additionally, this limited campaign offers opportunities for dads and birth professionals to engage directly with me personally.

All funds raised will be directed to The Becoming Dad Project to create a high-quality website and purchase the digital tools we need to create our online programs.

The Impact

A message from our founder, Darren Mattock....

For the past five years, I have had the privilege of sharing the becoming dad journeys of hundreds of men in my community. I have witnessed firsthand the difference it has made for dads having opportunities to receive father-focused and male-friendly engagement, education and support during pregnancy, as they prepare to be present for the birth of their child, as they prepare for the role of fatherhood, and as the navigate the most transformational passage in their lives - as men, partners and fathers.

The vision and intention of Becoming Dad is to create and provide these opportunities for expectant and new dads globally. To reach into the expectant and new fatherhood spaces to fill the profound gaps that exist for men on this path and meaningfully meet their needs. At the heart of this vision is the belief that this change will make a positive difference in the lives of the dads, mums, babies, families and communities that this work touches.

I passionately want more men to know the true gifts of fatherhood and how fully embracing their becoming dad journey can enrich their lives in ways they had never imagined.

I passionately want more children to have conscious and connected dads who will love, nurture, protect and guide them with purpose and presence.

I passionately want more families to stay together as they make the challenging transition from being a couple to becoming a family.

I passionately want our communities to benefit from having happier and healthier men, partners and fathers who are living rich and fulfilling lives with love, purpose and presence.

I believe, with all of my heart, that Becoming Dad can play a role in facilitating the changes that we want and need to see in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help support The Becoming Dad Project by sharing this fundraising campaign with your family, friends and communities. We would be incredibly grateful if you could do that for us, our project and our cause.

The easiest and most effective way to share this is by using the Indiegogo share tools on this page.

If you have another creative way that you feel that you could contribute to The Becoming Dad Project, we'd love to hear from you! Please reach out to Darren personally by email: darren@becomingdad.com.au - every offer, small or big, makes a difference.

Humble and hopeful thanks to you for taking the time to watch and read this. Your support means the world to me.

Darren Mattock
Founder, Becoming Dad

story:
Hi, it's Darby! Most of you know me, but maybe you don't know that I recently spent 3 amazing months in Uganda.  I went there without an agenda and without an organization; I wanted to experience the culture and determine if my skills and passions could be of use there.

The Problem

If you saw the video, you heard the story of Eddy's reunification.  I met him while volunteering with kids who live on the street, and I helped get him back to his family.  Getting Eddy home was so simple, and yet there are still thousands of children like him on the streets and in orphanages for no good reason.

Enter Mark and Keren Riley, who are among the first to stand up for this violation of children's rights. They have started to reunite Uganda. reuniteuganda.blogspot.com

Keren began resettling children with their families a few years ago. As I started tagging along in her work, I realized what a need there is for more of us to join this effort to get children out of institutions.  "But don't orphans need orphanages?" many people ask.  Actually, no.  Did you know that around 80% of the children in Ugandan orphanages are not actually orphans? Check out these stats on children's institutions in Uganda: http://www.alternative-care-uganda.org/problem.html

In the mid-1990s there were approx 35 orphanages in Uganda, and now there are over 600!  [Only 40 of these homes are actually licensed by the government.]  These "orphanages" receive 95% of their funding from the West...money that could, in turn, be spent on keeping families together instead of splitting them apart.

What we've accomplished so far

I was so excited when Keren invited me to start an American branch of Reunite Uganda.  I couldn't believe how perfectly the opportunity dovetailed with my background in education, non-profits, and working with disadvantaged children and families. Because the majority of orphanage funding comes from the West, the need to raise awareness here in the US is great.  Children belong in families, not orphanages.

In setting up the American chapter of Reunite Uganda, it’s taking a full-time employee (me) to set up the 501c3 (just waiting to hear back from the IRS!), create awareness, approach funders, speak with the media, etc.  We have a strong board of directors here in the US, and we have people on the ground in Uganda. We continue to need funding.

We already ran one successful fundraiser—the money raised went towards lawyer fees, state and federal registration fees, a Postal Annex box, office supplies like a printer, ink, binders and files, and some salary for me to keep going. We are now registered as a non-profit with the State of Texas, and have filed for our 501c3 status with the IRS.  We held our first cellphone board meeting (we live in 4 different states!) a few weeks ago.  I just purchased our domain name and now need to work on an actual website host and setup.  I'll be attending theideacamp.com next month and hope to get the word out about Reunite while I'm there.  We're about to finalize a mission statement, and we just opened a small business bank account...an intern or two would be nice :)

Current Funding Needs

This second fundraiser will be split: 50% of the money will cover more of our startup costs here in the US (i.e. website purchasing and designing, making pamphlets, hosting events, etc), and the other 50% will go directly to the work in Uganda (money to hire investigators, economic empowerment officers, and social workers; money to help families start small businesses so that they can consistently provide for their children). I ask for your support because this is something I fully believe in and something I continue to support and fund myself.

You can be a part of the beginning stages of work that no one else is doing. By donating, you will share in stories like Eddy's.

Thank you so much!

The Work

Reunite is a direct intervention to reunite children back with their Ugandan families.  These children have been lost in the orphanage system, trafficked for international adoption or kidnapped.  Reunite also works with these families to make sure that the resettlement is sustainable and has every chance of being successful.  To do this, we provide social work services, economic empowerment and in some cases, emergency support (food, medical services, etc). 

Reunite uses qualified Ugandan investigators, social workers and economic empowerment officers. We are totally committed to supporting the Ugandan Government Alternative Care Framework. 

More Info

http://reuniteuganda.blogspot.com/2013/01/america-here-we-come.html

http://reuniteuganda.blogspot.com/2013/02/darbys-first-resettlement.html

http://reuniteuganda.blogspot.com/2013/02/update-from-darby-american-reunite.html

http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=89-6lPA0u84

http://www.alternative-care-uganda.org/alternat...

http://www.foreignpolicy.com/articles/2008/10/15/the_lie_we_love

http://www.brandeis.edu/investigate/adoption/orphanmanufacturingchain.html

http://reuniteuganda.blogspot.com/2013/04/guest-post-internationally-adopted.html

Other Ways You Can Help

Like us on Facebook, and then share the link to this campaign! https://www.facebook.com/pages/Reunite-Uganda/228095100667407

Invite me to speak: I'd love to share more about this issue with your group of friends, sports team, high schoolers, church, or college campus.

Get the word out!  This problem and its solutions are counter-intuitive to what mainstream media is telling us. Help your friends and family understand the need to get children out of orphanages and back in their families.

story:
Hello there! :)

We are 2 university students from Slovak Republic participating in a global competition called SENStation and our project made it to the TOP 5 in the world!! We are very excited for this and as well for the fact that Transparency International & McKinsey are helping our project to put it into reality!!

                                            

Our aim is to create a crowdfunding platfform for students, schools, and universities in emerging countries of Eastern Europe which are in financial need. Let us explain more about our project further down. But first, a small introduction. :)

THE PROBLEM

Annually, around 10,000 Slovak people with higher education degrees go abroad in order to find better opportunities. This is more than a quarter of those who every year obtain a diploma from universities in Slovakia. Also, according to Academic Ranking of World Universities 2012, Slovakia has no presence in the top 500 of world universities. Another issue is the lack of interaction between private sector and academia in Slovakia. The research coming from academia is at an extremely low number compared to other EU countries.

We believe that there is a strong connection between these facts. Slovak talented students often take their ideas to places where they are able to capitalize them. We feel that Slovak education system does not sufficiently provide students with necessary resources for such ideas or projects.

We would like to stop this brain drain from Slovakia and offer the students a place and means through which they would be able to put their ideas and projects to reality. Also to create more interaction between private sector and academia along with motivating the private sector to fund projects from universities. 

THE SOLUTION

We would like to create a crowdfunding platform for students from universities and high schools in Slovakia and, later on, other Eastern European countries. This platform would provide them with an ultimate place for presenting, funding or developing their interesting projects. We want to give them a chance to use their potential the best they can. 

Moreover, this platform would connect schools with people that could be interested in funding projects such as students, alumni, parents and on the other side companies. The platform would also provide a solution for companies how to promote their brand name to the society as being socially responsible corporations by funding the projects.

Also, thanks to this platform students would be able to find financial resources for facilities (tools and items for educational purposes) that are needed for modern education of the 21st century. Students and schools could find funds for anything related to education, innovation, creativity and social cause.

By improving the educational facilities in Slovakia and connecting the private sector with academia (hence, more possible research for universities), we believe that it could improve the overall standings as well in the future.

SOCIAL IMPACT WE WILL CREATE

We believe that our project would create social impact in the education system and would also create the opportunity for creating jobs. Namely, the social impact would be:

  • Improving educational environment
  • Connecting private sector with academia
  • Creating jobs for students and unemployed people
  • Letting the students to be ‘free’, giving them the opportunity to rely on their own skills and abilities.
  • A place for communication between public, academia, and private sector

The whole amount of 5000 euros will go towards our website development. The cost is estimated between 6000-8000 euros.

Below you can find our rewards for your contribution. It may not be the fanciest stuff but please understand that we are only students and our badget is tight :)

Annually, around 10,000 Slovak people with higher education degrees go abroad in order to find better opportunities. This is more than a quarter of those who every year obtain a diploma from universities in Slovakia. Also, according to Academic Ranking of World Universities 2012, Slovakia has no presence in the top 500 of world universities. Another issue is the lack of interaction between private sector and academia in Slovakia. The research coming from academia is at an extremely low number compared to other EU countries.
We believe that there is a strong connection between these facts. Slovak talented students often take their ideas to places where they are able to capitalize them. We feel that Slovak education system does not sufficiently provide students with necessary resources for such ideas or projects.
We would like to stop this brain drain from Slovakia and offer the students a place and means through which they would be able to put their ideas and projects to reality. Also to create more interaction between private sector and academia along with motivating the private sector to fund projects from universities. 
THE SOLUTION
We would like to create a crowdfunding platform for students from universities and high schools in Slovakia and, later on, other Eastern European countries. This platform would provide them with an ultimate place for presenting, funding or developing their interesting projects. We want to give them a chance to use their potential the best they can. 
Moreover, this platform would connect schools with people that could be interested in funding projects such as students, alumni, parents and on the other side companies. The platform would also provide a solution for companies how to promote their brand name to the society as being socially responsible corporations by funding the projects.
Also, thanks to this platform students would be able to find financial resources for facilities (tools and items for educational purposes) that are needed for modern education of the 21st century. Students and schools could find funds for anything related to education, innovation, creativity and social cause.
By improving the educational facilities in Slovakia and connecting the private sector with academia (hence, more possible research for universities), we believe that it could improve the overall standings as well in the future.
SOCIAL IMPACT WE WILL CREATE
We believe that our project would create social impact in the education system and would also create the opportunity for creating jobs. Namely, the social impact would be:

Improving educational environment
Connecting private sector with academia
Creating jobs for students and unemployed people
Letting the students to be ‘free’, giving them the opportunity to rely on their own skills and abilities.
A place for communication between public, academia, and private sector

The whole amount of 5000 euros will go towards our website development. The cost is estimated between 6000-8000 euros.
Below you can find our rewards for your contribution. It may not be the fanciest stuff but please understand that we are only students and our badget is tight :)

story:
StudiesLab is Education That Matters

StudiesLab is a cooperative based educational community. At its heart are experienced, caring and well-read teachers who see their roles not as professional information distributors but as facilitators for learning. Our teachers work with students to both govern individual curriculums as well as the nature of StudiesLab down to even its business model.

Here are a few benefits of StudiesLab:

* challenging, engaging and personalized learning environments aimed at stimulating curiosity and producing thoughtfulness

* truly individualized student-centered learning that isn’t confined to four walls or forty minute periods

* college prep curriculum in a small and non-traditional setting

* classes, meetings and interactions based on conversations rather than lectures

* focus is on student strengths, gifts and contributions to the community and the world

* chances to meet and network with other individuals and families outside conventional education settings who share similar passions for knowledge and exploration

* results in a mindset based on curiosity that is able to apply critical thinking skills to demanding problems in an unpredictable world

Primarily, StudiesLab functions as a credible alternative to the schooling movement and prepares a person for either a traditional four year college track or for an educational experience that makes use of the tremendous tools available in the 21st century to accomplish even more personalized learning than available in colleges and universities.

What We Need:

StudiesLab shouldn't just exist for families who can afford an extra $5,000, $10,000 or $15,000 in private school education. Instead, StudiesLab will have its greatest impact if we can work with young people across the socio-economic spectrum and spur real change in WNC and SC. 

* funds we're seeking go straight into the operations of StudiesLab and our work with young people.

* help us expand beyond those who can afford this type of authentic education to those who also can most benefit (and benefit their communities in the long term) from real 21st century learning

* when we reach our entire goal, we'll be able to reach dozens of young people in WNC and SC who would not have had this possibility 

The Impact

StudiesLab exists to allow amazing young people to accomplish things that will set them apart from others in their future paths and help them to realize the joy and excitement of authentic learning in every moment.

If you believe that real learning can and should shape our region and our country and that the current educational system needs mending, we hope you'll participate and give.
