story:
“When you’re mindful it creates a chain reaction where all of a sudden you become compassionate and kind and loving. Then that affects the people around you.”

—Marley, 12, Camper

The 8th Annual Tools for Peace Summer Teen Camp is an extension of our ongoing in-school program, and offers youth ages 12-16 a transformative weeklong experience rooted in practicing mindfulness, learning meditation, and cultivating compassion in the beautiful mountains of Tehachapi, California. Over the past thirteen years, more than 2,500 youth throughout Northern and Southern California have benefited from all that Tools for Peace has to offer. With your contribution, youth will immerse themselves in a camp community that fosters life-changing experiences through cultivating compassion. Help us raise $25,000 by August 3rd to fulfill over 35 scholarship requests that we have received for this year's camp.

What makes our camp truly special is the Stop, Breathe & Think Workshop, where teens learn and practice mindfulness meditation, work together in dynamic small group discussions, and participate in engaging activities that enable teens to connect with each other in a safe and supportive environment. Afternoons at camp are full of fun activities: art, sports, yoga, music, crafts, horseback riding, swimming, and the creation of a Community Sand Mandala. Evenings at camp are always a highlight for campers—with campfires, movie nights, and karaoke, and teens return home with a positive and memorable experience.

 

“In the short period of time I spent at camp, my parents and my entire family said I came back a totally different person.”

—James, 16, Alumni/Peer Mentor 

Who We Are

“Honestly, Tools for Peace has changed my life in a way that I couldn’t have done alone...The greatest thing I have learned is to just be compassionate and filled with joy for the life I’ve been given.”

—Carlos, 15, Camper

Tools for Peace, founded in 2000 in Pasadena, CA, currently serves communities in the San Francisco Bay and the greater Los Angeles areas. We support teens in middle and high school with in-school, afterschool, and summer camp programs that teach practical methods for cultivating compassion, peace and wellbeing through training in mindfulness and meditation. Our Stop, Breathe & Think Workshop, in particular, helps students learn to settle their minds and work with difficult emotions and thoughts in order to relate to peers and adults more productively.

 

What We Need

"In my everyday life, those little tools that I’ve learned here—the meditation, the mindfulness exercises—have helped me so much to get through stressful situations and to calm myself down."

—James, 16, Alumni/Peer Mentor

Summer Teen Camp provides teens with invaluable support from an incredible 1:3 counselor to camper ratio. While we usually only accept 30 applicants, this year we received over 35 applications with scholarship requests, and we would like to accommodate each and every one! Our deserving students from in-school programs in the Greater Bay and Los Angeles areas need your help, and you have the power to make a real difference by helping us send all of our students to Summer Teen Camp!

By donating, you provide scholarships to youth from low-income, disadvantaged backgrounds, many whose families may not otherwise be able to afford camp for their teen, but wish to attend. 

Please join our “Compassion-in-Action Chain Reaction” Campaign and donate today. You can give our teens a summer experience to remember by making a gift or by sparking a “Compassion-in-Action Chain Reaction” by spreading the word via Facebook and Twitter. Gifts of all levels ensure our youth can benefit from Summer Teen Camp regardless of ability to pay.

 

Impact

Summer Teen Camp scholarships help children from low-income and minority communities to benefit from all that Tools for Peace Summer Teen Camp has to offer, including learning mindfulness and meditation, building lasting friendships and essential mentor relationships, connecting with nature, and having fun.

Vivianne, 18, Taylor, 18, and Ray, 19, three of our most dedicated alumni/peer mentors, are now pursuing successful academic ventures in college and university.  Vivianne graduated with honors from Saint George's School in Rhode Island, and received a full scholarship to study at Barnard College. Taylor graduated from Robert Louis Stevenson School, and received a full scholarship to study at Wellesley College. Ray has used his mindfulness and meditation training to overcome the challenges that he faces living with autism. He completed his first year at California State University East Bay, and is looking forward to a career in the National Guard—but first he will serve as a Junior Counselor at this year's Eighth Annual Summer Teen Camp in August.

"It helps me put my life into perspective... how to live my life in the most thoughtful way possible, and to help others do the same."

— Ray, 16, Alumni/Peer Mentor

All three of these remarkable individuals attribute much of their success and ability to succeed, in spite of the significant challenges they have had to overcome, to their many years participating in Tools for Peace programs. We are honored to be a part of their lives and to know that we have contributed to their achievements.

Your donation will provide campers like Vivianne, Taylor, Ray, James, Marley, and Carlos a chance to develop the skills that will support them in all aspects of life.

“What does a world with compassion look like? The entire world would be like this camp. People would help each other all the time, people probably wouldn’t be homeless, there would be true happiness all throughout the world...knowing that everyone had that would make me feel safer."

—Marley, 12, Camper

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Spark the Compassion-in-Action Chain Reaction by sharing this campaign with family, friends, Facebook, and Twitter. We need your help to spread the word.

Gift Levels and Opportunities

Kind Giver: $10

Partner of Peace: Provide a day of meals for one camper: $20

Compassionate Camper: Provide a two and a half days of meals for one camper: $50

Fun Facilitator: Provide approximately a week of meals for one camper: $150

Patron of Recreation: Provide a week of Art, Sports, Yoga, Music, or Crafts Activities: $500

Life Changer: Provide one campership for Summer Teen Camp: $675

Beneficent Big Wig: Provide almost two camperships for Summer Teen Camp: $1000

Contemplative Kahuna: Provide approximately seven and a half camperships for Summer Teen Camp: $5000

Or, you can always provide a gift of any amount of your choice! 100% of every donation goes towards helping our teens benefit from the 8th Annual Tools for Peace Summer Teen Camp experience!

story:
This marks the second fundraiser to raise the remainder funds for the cost of the dome, the fabric covering, aerial silks, and last bit of taxes taken out by this website.

 

"Inspire - Dream - Build"

WHAT IS THE N.EV.LO. PROJECT (NP)?

A grassroots positive psychology project, NP stands for Neo Evolutionary Logic Project, which represents the concept of evolving logic in the digital age, connecting the best positive ideas from cultures worldwide through the Internet and on the ground. NP is devoted to improving the lives of people by teaching valuable skills and through psychology, art, and acrobatics at festivals and fairs around the globe.


"Positive Psychology is the scientific study of the strengths and virtues that enable individuals and communities to thrive. The field is founded on the belief that people want to lead meaningful and fulfilling lives, to cultivate what is best within themselves, and to enhance their experiences of love, work, and play" (University of Pennsylvania, 2007).

THE GOAL

To raise enough money to finish building this geodesic dome and provide people of all ages with workshops on how to sew and stretch. When the dome is not in use it becomes a junglegym playground for all to use!

 Blueprint of geodesic dome provided by Atomic Domes

WHO?

My name is Niko "Joylight" Sol and I am a Fusionist. As part of the FAM (Fusion Art Movement) founded in 2012 in Sydney, Australia, Fusionists combine two or more professional modalities from any industry, such as the likes of Psychology, Tailoring, Performance Art, Creative Writing, Biology & Kinesiology.

Having studied all of the above for the last 9 years across four continents - North America, South America, Europe, & Australia - I feel confident in taking on the role as a humanitarian for our global community. By fusing all of my education and hobbies together, I wish to help those around me achieve a state of positive joy and self-confidence. We humans are all equal; we all deserve a chance to be heard, felt, and understood, for that unconditional kindness and compassion for each other breeds high self-esteem and connects us with virtues that teach us to honor one another.

WHERE?

For the premiere launch of NP I have chosen this year's Burning Man Festival held at Black Rock City, NV from August 26th to September 2nd. Burning Man's Placement Department has already awarded NP with a prime location for our "theme camp" at the very center of the city on Rod's Road next to Center Camp.

[see our theme camp location highlighted in yellow]

WHAT?

For exactly one week out of the year, Center Camp is one of the busiest cafes and live venues in the world. Over 50,000 people will pass through the area surrounding Center Camp and be able to use the services that NP plans to provide: a pancake breakfast from 8:00-11:00am; workshops on meditation, yoga, performance art, aerial acrobatics, and talisman building; seminars on positive psychology; and sewing tutorials.

3D Image of NP Theme Camp @ Burning Man

-Created by Magnetic Video Productions.


THE IMPACT

By providing a safe space for creative expression, NP hopes to teach new skills while empowering individuals and promoting social harmony. Those who participate in NP's theme camp can stretch their bodies and minds to new heights by taking part in the various activites offered such as laughing yoga classes, hand-sewing tutorials, or aerial suspension exercises.

NP has already begun to unite a community of compassionate people who wish to  enhance their experiences of love, work and play. We hope to extend the web of positivity by teaching, sharing, and connecting with others all over the world.

In order to fund this operation, I need your help.


BUDGET


$3600 - 36ft Geodesic Dome

$557 - Interior (parachutes; hammocks; aerial silks & harness)

Due to the last campaign not making its mark, NP lost out on hundreds of dollars deducted from the percentage cut that this website takes out. In understanding the shortcomings of our first fundraiser, we have added the tax and percentage cut into this second campaign to help raise the total budget amount. All of this money will be put back into the company to pay for the costs that were donated on loan.

$3600 (raised and received)

$1965 (needed to reach goal)

Total = $5565 (inclusive of all costs and taxes to run this campaign)



To contribute, click the "CONTRIBUTE NOW" button at the top right of the page. When you are re-directed to the paypal page, click "Pay with a credit or debit card" and uncheck "Save this information with a PayPal account". This will allow you to use paypal as a one time user with your credit/debit card.


THE PERKS


 When you participate by contributing, you help make this dream possible. You're coming with me on my journey to help bring positive psychology to people all around the world. I will be documenting my journey every step of the way and will be posting to my blog regularly after every event, so you can see what I have accomplished with so many.

Also, in exchange for your contribution to my campaign, you will receive perks specifically related to my skills as a tailor and artist. The range of perks includes poems, hand-painted calligraphy, talismans, bandanas, t-shirts, custom garments, and so on.


All garments and tailoring services will be donated by my clothing line SIRE

For more details on individual perks, check out the right-hand side of this page.


[below is an example of my abilities: From design to finished product]


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone you know about my campaign: share using the Indiegogo share tools located below my video, click the "like" button for my campaign, post on social networks such as Facebook and Twitter, email people, tell by word-of-mouth, jot my campaign url on napkins—whatever it takes!

Keep contributing! Any excess funds I raise will go directly to building next year's NP Village so even more people can be reached. This means that once I’ve met my goal, you can still contribute and make a difference!

Linked-In -  To learn more about me and what I do, click here.

story:
Three years ago, one of my then almost four-year old sons fell from his second-story bedroom window during nap time. He landed on his head on the concrete below and suffered a severe traumatic brain injury. He was in a medically-induced coma for a week and paralyzed on the left side for weeks after that. We spent 5 weeks in the hospital and then a year doing out-patient and in-home therapy. This was the most trying and traumatic experience I've ever had. My husband and I are now involved in window safety work and are are active members of the Stop at 4” Window Fall Prevention campaign in Portland, Oregon.

Around 5,000 children fall out of windows in the U.S. every year.  Some die and many, like my son, end up with traumatic brain injuries as a result of their fall.  This is an easily preventable childhood injury.  Most parents of young children are aware of and have installed baby gates near their stairs and cabinet locks in their bathrooms and kitchens but few know about window stops and window guards.  I'd like window guards and window stops to be as commonplace as outlet covers and car seats. It's difficult to describe the agony of the unknown when you're sitting in the PICU waiting to find out the outcome for your child.  I could go on and on about the torture that experience was for my husband and me and our other two kids but I decided to address it a different way - by writing this children's book.  My hope is to reach children under 7 years old and their parents so that they won't have to endure what we did.  In my search of children's safety books on Amazon, I did not find one book about window safety, yet falls are a leading cause of death and injury amongst children under 5 years old.  

My hope is that all the parents of children under seven years old will read this book and then immediately buy a Guardian Angel window guard, KidCo window stop or mesh window guard for each of the windows that pose a risk in their homes. 

The primary places I plan to distribute the book to are pediatrician's offices, public libraries, local baby supply stores, local toy and book stores, birth centers in hospitals, day cares, moms clubs and preschools.

We've already paid the illustrator and had 20 copies printed but we need financial help to be able to print more copies so they can reach the hands of parents. It would cost $4,314 to print 1,000.  Any money we receive will go towards printing and distributing this book.

I hope you see the importance of getting this information to as many parents of young children as possible. Thank you for helping me publish and distribute this book.
story_txt:
Three
years ago, one of my then almost four-year old sons fell from his
second-story bedroom window during nap time. He landed on his head on
the concrete below and suffered a severe traumatic brain injury. He
was in a medically-induced coma for a week and paralyzed on the left
side for weeks after that. We spent 5 weeks in the hospital and then
a year doing out-patient and in-home therapy. This was the most
trying and traumatic experience I've ever had. My husband and I are
now involved in window safety work and are are active members of the
Stop at 4” Window Fall Prevention campaign in Portland, Oregon.
Around 5,000
children fall out of windows in the U.S. every year.  Some die
and many, like my son, end up with traumatic brain injuries as a
result of their fall.  This is an easily preventable childhood
injury.  Most parents of young children are aware of and have
installed baby gates near their stairs and cabinet locks in their
bathrooms and kitchens but few know about window stops and window
guards.  I'd like window guards and window stops to be as
commonplace as outlet covers and car seats. It's difficult to
describe the agony of the unknown when you're sitting in the PICU
waiting to find out the outcome for your child.  I could go on
and on about the torture that experience was for my husband
and me and our other two kids but I decided to address it a different way - by writing this children's book. 
My hope is to reach children under 7 years old and their parents so that
they won't have to endure what we did.  In my search of
children's safety books on Amazon, I did not find one book about
window safety, yet falls are a leading cause of death and injury
amongst children under 5 years old.   

My hope is that
all the parents of children under seven years old will read this book
and then immediately buy a Guardian Angel window guard, KidCo window
stop or mesh window guard for each of the windows that pose a risk in
their homes.  
The primary places I plan to distribute the book to are pediatrician's offices, public libraries, local
baby supply stores, local toy and book stores, birth centers in
hospitals, day cares, moms clubs and preschools.

We've already paid the
illustrator and had 20 copies printed but we need financial help to
be able to print more copies so they can reach the hands of parents. It would cost $4,314 to print 1,000. 
Any money we receive will go towards printing and distributing this
book.
I hope you see the
importance of getting this information to as many parents of young
children as possible. Thank you for helping me publish and
distribute this book.

story:
UPDATE!  render of Prototype no. 1


INTRODUCING DITS

The DITS project is concerned with the development of therapeutic medical devices in the field of regenerative medicine. The core idea is the application of the traditional Chinese medicine theory into the modern technology solutions. The aim of the project is the development of dynamic stimulation footwear that would actively affect the solution of certain health issues. DITS operates according to user needs through the deliberate local stimulation of acupressure points on human feet. For example a person with high blood pressure can set DITS to stimulate the particular acupoint and that way positively affect his health conditions. Also, in similar way problems with impotence, musculoskeletal system, kidneys, etc. can be treated.


DITS – doctor in the shoes. The treatment of various health issues can be invasive – surgical, medicamentous – through the use of drugs, or nonin-vasive. Our aim is to provide an opportunity of a therapy that would in a noninvasive way positively affect the human body as a whole. Our feet are full of acupressure points. Using the traditional Chinese medicine theory for stimulating these acupoints can significantly affect our health and improve the functioning of certain human organs. The appropriate way of stimulating these acupressure points can lead to enhancement of the functioning of our body organs and can act as a treatment for many health issues. DITS is capable of assisting not only individuals in their personal treatment of their health issues but also medical clinics, retirement homes and centers for physically disabled people. In the cases where the traditional Chinese medicine is not available, the DITS is the solution.

MERIDIANS EXPLAINED

feet meridians explained in detail 

Human body contains 14 principle meridians – they are pathways invisible to the naked eye through which the energy flows. They consist of acupressure points that enable various parts of the body. Every crucial organ is affected by its particular meridian. By applying pressure on the endings of the meridians we can have an impact on the functioning of specific organs and the operation of our body as a whole. The use of acupoints in a treatment can regulate the functioning of metabolism, male and female reproductive system, digestion, the operation of intestines, lungs and other internal body organs and many other aspects for the harmonious operation of the whole body.

meridians in human body

WHAT WILL HAPPEN NEXT?

The resources that will be acquired are going to be used as a further investment for the research and development of DITS. Our research has significantly progressed; therefore, we possess the knowledge about the exact location of particular acupressure points. That way we are capable to affect the relevant body organs. Nowadays, we are testing the optimal length of stimulation, its appropriate frequency, and other adjustments to make the use if DITS not only effective, but also pleasant. We still need to undergo a lot of work on miniaturization of the device which we are hoping to fully integrate into the heels and soles of shoes. It should look as casual beach footwear, with optimal weight for casual use. There are still few tasks that need to be resolved, such as the charging of the accumulator, functioning of safety circuits when immersing the device into water, or mechanically damaged... There are many issues that need to be answered but we believe that with your support we will manage to reach our goal and create a fully functioning prototype. For now, the picture of socks that would stimulate both points and surfaces that are spaced on other parts of legs and not just feet is only in our imagination. However, these socks would also fulfil the requirement for DITS to be used on bare feet. But this question is looking far into the future. Now we are here to deal with the questions we have currently in front of us and, therefore, we would like to ask you for your support.


The pictures above capture our facilities with which we have started our research. Our control unit remained the same for the whole time because we were only exchanging certain components and this way we were adjusting the performance, functioning and control. We move forward in our research every day and we are searching for the optimal solutions.

COMPATIBILITY OF DITS

DITS will be compatible with any existing operation system via Bluetooth

DITS is going to be capable of being controlled and programed through wireless connectivity, using Bluetooth interface. The software is going to be available both for personal computers as well as mobile devices mac and Androids. The software will enable one device to control and set a certain type of therapy. Also one of our own devices which will help easily program and control DITS is going to be available. This device is going to be suitable especially for seniors and people that are not interested in modern computer technologies.

Perks:

1USD - Personal 'Thank you' email from CEO


50USD - Original DITS poster


100USD - Original DITS coffee mug

500USD - Original DITS T-shirt (two types)

1000USD - Original DITS Certificate of Sponsorship + Original DITS T-Shirt


Do you have any question ?

Do not hestitate and ask anything on: 

email: acupressuredynamicsolutions@gmail.com

story:
Who We Are

Hi were Adrianne and Rick, Co founders of Kids International Development Society (KIDS). In March 2000 our only child and dearest daughter Danielle was killed by a drunk driver, she was 21. Our search to find healing and meaning in our lives led us to the formation of KIDS and today we are a registered Canadian Charity. Each year we volunteer for three to four months mostly in S.E. Asia and primarily Cambodia. Our focus is on education, clean drinking water and health care. We work with local people and organizations and oversee the projects ourselves making sure that the funds donated are wisely spent and directly assist children, families and communities in need. Over the past thirteen years we have successfully funded and supported: schools, clinics, solar water systems for schools, classrooms, children’s hospitals, a girl’s home, women’s weaving cooperative and other family and educational supplies.

Our Campaign

Education is a priority for KIDS and we see first hand how developing minds changes lives. We are presently working with a rural school where 1500 children attend and heard of their desire to learn computer skills. Computer skills can assist young people to attend University as well as give them an opportunity to find employment and help support their families.  They have the classroom, the teacher, electricity and hundreds of kids have the passion all they need is Your Support to buy the computers and create a computer lab for these dedicated young people.

What We Need

We are hoping to raise $7,000.00 The funds will renovate a classroom and purchase 25 computers where classes will run regularly for high schools students.

The Costs

·  25 computers @ 183.00 each  $4575.00

·  Renovations (tile, ceiling, paint, wiring)  $1700.00

·  Printers, electrical work, computer maintenance    $725.00

Total  $7000.00

The Impact

We have witnessed first hand how education has changed children and youth’s lives. We have known young people, who thanks to educational support, have finished University and now have good paying jobs and can help support their families. We have seen children learn and grow and be able to escape the difficult life of working in a brick factory as a child labourer.  We work with many Cambodian people who have faced unthinkable tragedy and now dedicate their lives to helping their own people. These changes are made possible through education and hard work. Who knows where one computer will lead!

Other Ways You Can Help

Pass this on to friends and family

Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools

Please donate through Indiegogo or or the Canada Helps Button on our website.

www.kidsdevelopmentsociety.org.

We Thank You for your time and interest and wish you and yours Samnang Laor! (Good Luck In Cambodian) 


Sincerely

Adrianne Dartnall and Rick Lennert

story:
OUR FOUNDATION!


The Panther Sport Foundation is a non profit organization that gives opportunities that encourages and stimulates young Africans to be healthy, sociable and happy, through sport.

We are a team of three young individuals who want to give opportunities to the children of Mbandaka, something they may never have. We are all passionate about the foundation and cannot wait to get it started!
FOOTBALL IS FUN! and we are all involved in a team in Swansea called Swansea Panthers. Swansea Panthers are in division four, with young adults all from different backgrounds and nationalities. The team first started to bring the African communities in Swansea together, in result 2 years later the team is thriving, and we see each other as a family.
Our goal is to make a similar team in Africa, to bring them all together and learn skills and knowledge they wouldn't normally learn.

WHAT WE NEED!

When we arrive at Mbanaka, We will travel to schools, to run our program and give training sessions to the children. In result, forming school football teams and giving them something to look forward to.

However we need equipment! We would be so grateful if you could help us out and donate a little something towards the equipment! Your donation will be appreciated so much, not just by us, but by the children of Mbandaka (Republic Democratic of Congo) In return we want to give you a little something back! When donating a certain amount you could either get in return;

A Calender filled with pictures and thank yous from our trip

A P.S.F. T-shirt

A P.S.F. Hoody!

The money you donate will go towards football equipment such as;

Bibs, Cones, Balls, GoalPosts and A Team Kit!

Outcome!

We want this foundation to work and because Swansea Panthers has been such a success, we believe we can do better! By going to Africa and setting up the foundation ourselves and with your help, in a few years we hope to be traveling all over Africa to help more and more small villages and towns!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Please Please Spread the word! We really believe this foundation can be a success and by helping you will always be apart of it!

story:
"I want people to come to me with little to no strength or focus, and leave with a mind-blowing sense of what their body can do and what they are capable of achieving in this life"


Friends, Family, and Followers,


Thank you for taking the time to look at my campaign!

By day, I am a physical therapy aide at a sports performance clinic.  I build relationships with people all day long.  Sure, I correct their faulty movement patterns.  But something deeper happens when I go to "work".  I laugh with people. I listen to their struggles. I celebrate their victories.  I help them break through walls and change.

Through these exchanges, I've also discovered a wealth about myself.  I've discovered that I'm actually a very good teacher.  I've learned that I'm a great leader and listener.  I've discovered that I'm very intuitive about the human body.  I'm passionate about people and about challenging and encouraging them to change.

Obtaining this certificate in BASI pilates will provide the platform that will enable me help others positively change themselves from the inside out.  BASI Pilates provides top-tier, professional pilates education that will equip me to inspire and motivate everyone from the cubicle dweller to the pro-athelete.  

Details About Funding:
On August 17, 2014, I will be walking in the doors of the BASI Pilates headquarters to begin my intense 6-month pilates certification program.  Beginning November 1st, I will begin student teaching as an instructor at ABC Pilates in Orange County, CA.  With your help, I will be a certified pilates instructor by January 2015.

Tuition for the BASI pilates certification program is $3,995.  I've requested an additional $1,000 to cover the cost of fulfilling the required 100 hours of personal practice classes beneath expert level BASI Pilates instructors.  Having the ability to be mentored by and network with the geniuses at the BASI Pilates headquarters will build my personal branding and provide a foundation that is focused on the innovative BASI theory.


I appreciate all of my supporters (both financially and relationally!).  With gratitude, I have carefully crafted some perks to demonstrate my maximum appreciation for you.  In the perks section, you'll find everything from postural analysis sessions, to pilates classes taught by me.   


    Creating Impact:

    People have injuries.  People recover.  People have challenges.  People have victories.  Our resilience as humans is colossal.  Everything should be considered a win if we use our experiences to expand and grow.  This pilates certification, coupled with my personality and strong character will help people realize their potential.

    I know that crowd funding is an unconventional approach to funding education.  But, that 's precisely why I wanted to do it.  Innovative thinking and bold action are the things that bring about true change and maximize potential.  It creates ideas that spread.  Ideas that are effective.  

    And, I'm building momentum for this next step in my life.  What better way to do that than giving others a chance to join me in this adventure?

    I'm passionate about pilates, and I hope that you will see and hear it in this campaign.  I believe in other people for a living.  My hope is that you will believe in me, and that you will resonate with my passion, purpose, and dedication.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    How You Can Help

    • Donate money!
    • Share this campaign with anyone and everyone you know. On Twitter. On Facebook. On Instagram. On YouTube.  On Snapchat.  By email.  By phone.
    • Write words or letters of support – If you think this is a good idea and/or campaign, tell me why!   I absolutely love feedback (especially constructive criticism)!

Donate money!
Share this campaign with anyone and everyone you know. On Twitter. On Facebook. On Instagram. On YouTube.  On Snapchat.  By email.  By phone.
Write words or letters of support – If you think this is a good idea and/or campaign, tell me why!   I absolutely love feedback (especially constructive criticism)!

story:
A gentle spirit...a beautiful soul...a heart full of joy...when I think of Kellie...that's what I think.
 
I have gotten to know Kellie over the past couple of years while my son attended Nature's Way Montessori School.  When Kellie first approached me about joining our Educator's group in Guatemala this summer, I was over the moon..and I still am.  Now it's time to help her get there.
 
Guatemalans have the second highest rate of chronic malnutrition in the world.  70% of indigenous women are illiterate.  Only 25% of children can afford to go to school.  90% of the indigenous Mayans live in extreme poverty...living on less than $1.25 a day.
 
During Kellie's week in Guatemala she will have the opportunity to visit schools that serve children living in extreme poverty.  She will be teaching lessons and bringing joy into the classrooms.  She will be sharing her knowledge and resources with teachers who also live in poverty, yet each day they teach these children in hopes that they'll have a better future. 

What She Needs & What You Get

The amount needed to cover the flight and all trip fees is $1800.  She will be traveling to Guatemala with non-profit A Heart for Guatemala, from June 30 - July 7th.  Anything raised above that amount will be used to improve the quality of life of the people she will be working with. 

We have some really great perks to thank her supporters for their contributions.  Check them out on the right!  All perks will be delivered upon her return to the U.S. in July.


Check out the perks:

 

Guatemalan Woven Bracelets:

Handwoven Guatemalan Change Purse

 

Handwoven Guatemalan Headbands

 

Handbeaded Guatemalan Bracelets

 

Handwoven Guatemalan Purses

 

Men's Guatemalan Shirt

 

Woven Scarves

 

 

 

Why She's Going

When I asked Kellie why she wanted to join us, this is what she said:

  • I have only read about and seen on film, the poverty. This will change my life. I will see how some, if not most of the human race lives. I have always felt the need to help and spread messages but I don't want to feel like I am giving a hand out (or trying to endorse a specific religion) but a lift up...together, because I will be enriched too. I enjoy teamwork to reach a common goal. I'd like to do some manual labor, build something, give chickens, use my hands, and obviously, work as a group.
  • I want to be a minority, watching, listening to, being with, people of another culture. I want to see and learn more about Mayan heritage. I want to eat the foods, listen to the flow of another language, embrace varied lifestyles, notice the commonalities, and be influenced by folks who know how to live simply.
  • Doing something like this, going out of the country, with people I want to learn from, know, trust, want to be, work and bond with, I couldn't ask for a better situation.
  • I have fallen in love with Montessori methods and tools. It has changed my whole idea of what being a teacher really means. I want to share this with as many children as I can. I want to see how children from other cultures/countries/lands show their joys, curiosities, personalities, wonderment and interests in learning. I appreciate that the materials and tools we use in Montessori are simple and very effective. Something that I think these folks will really appreciate too. I can't wait to see the teachers and students learn together. I know I will learn more myself than what I will teach.
  • Of course I can't help but to think of the chance I'll have to explore a new land. I am so excited to see the flora and fauna of Guatemala. My gosh, the mountains, volcanoes, animlals and plants!  I love our world and want to see as much of it as I can.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help!  Spread the word and let others know about my campaign.  Your support means the world to me!
 
 
Campaign created by Bethany Davidson-Widby, Executive Director, A Heart for Guatemala
story_txt:
A gentle spirit...a beautiful soul...a heart full of joy...when I think of Kellie...that's what I think.

 

I have gotten to know Kellie over the past couple of years while my son attended Nature's Way Montessori School.  When Kellie first approached me about joining our Educator's group in Guatemala this summer, I was over the moon..and I still am.  Now it's time to help her get there.

 
Guatemalans have the second highest rate of chronic malnutrition in the world.  70% of indigenous women are illiterate.  Only 25% of children can afford to go to school.  90% of the indigenous Mayans live in extreme poverty...living on less than $1.25 a day. 
 
During Kellie's week in Guatemala she will have the opportunity to visit schools that serve children living in extreme poverty.  She will be teaching lessons and bringing joy into the classrooms.  She will be sharing her knowledge and resources with teachers who also live in poverty, yet each day they teach these children in hopes that they'll have a better future. 

What She Needs & What You Get
The amount needed to cover the flight and all trip fees is $1800.  She will be traveling to Guatemala with non-profit A Heart for Guatemala, from June 30 - July 7th.  Anything raised above that amount will be used to improve the quality of life of the people she will be working with. 
We have some really great perks to thank her supporters for their contributions.  Check them out on the right!  All perks will be delivered upon her return to the U.S. in July.
Check out the perks:
 
Guatemalan Woven Bracelets:

Handwoven Guatemalan Change Purse

 
Handwoven Guatemalan Headbands


 
Handbeaded Guatemalan Bracelets

 
Handwoven Guatemalan Purses

 
Men's Guatemalan Shirt
 

Woven Scarves

 

 
 


Why She's Going
When I asked Kellie why she wanted to join us, this is what she said:

I have only read about and seen on film, the poverty. This will change my life. I will see how some, if not most of the human race lives. I have always felt the need to help and spread messages but I don't want to feel like I am giving a hand out (or trying to endorse a specific religion) but a lift up...together, because I will be enriched too. I enjoy teamwork to reach a common goal. I'd like to do some manual labor, build something, give chickens, use my hands, and obviously, work as a group.


I want to be a minority, watching, listening to, being with, people of another culture. I want to see and learn more about Mayan heritage. I want to eat the foods, listen to the flow of another language, embrace varied lifestyles, notice the commonalities, and be influenced by folks who know how to live simply.


Doing something like this, going out of the country, with people I want to learn from, know, trust, want to be, work and bond with, I couldn't ask for a better situation.


I have fallen in love with Montessori methods and tools. It has changed my whole idea of what being a teacher really means. I want to share this with as many children as I can. I want to see how children from other cultures/countries/lands show their joys, curiosities, personalities, wonderment and interests in learning. I appreciate that the materials and tools we use in Montessori are simple and very effective. Something that I think these folks will really appreciate too. I can't wait to see the teachers and students learn together. I know I will learn more myself than what I will teach.


Of course I can't help but to think of the chance I'll have to explore a new land. I am so excited to see the flora and fauna of Guatemala. My gosh, the mountains, volcanoes, animlals and plants!  I love our world and want to see as much of it as I can.

 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially, you can still help!  Spread the word and let others know about my campaign.  Your support means the world to me!

 
 
Campaign created by Bethany Davidson-Widby, Executive Director, A Heart for Guatemala

story:
Hello:

 

My name is Adrian Stephens.  I am here to ask for your help on behalf of my son Jason.

 

Jason is a highly motivated young man totally focused on his goal of a college education. During his time at Spring Valley High School in Las Vegas, Nevada, he chose Advanced Placement classes at every opportunity.  He graduated with a GPA of 3.25, which, with his AP classes, is a weighted average of 4.03.

 

Jason was active in school activities.  He was part of the Student/Peer mentorship program helping others to achieve their goals.  He was also a member of AVID, Advancement Via Individual Determination, which prepares students for college.  In addition, he participated in the Model UN where he was highly scored in their debating competition.  He was a chair for the Relay for Life, raising funds for cancer research, and was involved with the Las Vegas Police Athletic League, introducing others to the sport of Lacrosse.

 

Jason is  an accomplished athlete.  He has a real love for lacrosse, which he has played since the 7th grade.  When Jason picked up his first lacrosse stick he was hooked.  He has played for the local Grizzles team since 2009, and his hard work and dedication helped the team win a state championship in 2011.  In 2012 he was named to the All City and All State teams for his position and received an honorable mention in 2013.  His coaches selected him as Senior Captain in 2013 and his fellow players named him MVP.  When not playing for the Grizzlies he was on several all-star traveling teams, participating in tournaments all over the West Coast.  In addition, in 2012 he was invited to try out for the Brine All American team.

 

Even though involved in all this, Jason understands that he must help to “pay his way”.  In both his Junior and Senior years of High School he was employed at the bowling center in South Point Casino.  During summer break he worked a full five day a week schedule.  Even during the school year he worked a reduced schedule of Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.   Yes, there was a lot of juggling of time to accommodate work, his lacrosse activities, and his school responsibilities, but Jason did what was necessary.

So, now high school is done and it’s time to move on.  Jason applied to and was accepted by a number of colleges and universities around the country.   He decided on Arcadia University in Glenside, Pennsylvania after looking at all his options.  Arcadia has awarded Jason a four-year, 50% scholarship.  He has also been recruited to play for the Scarlet Knights, Arcadia’s new NCAA D3 lacrosse team.  It’s a match made in heaven and he is determined to go.

 

Arcadia has worked hard to help Jason, and he has worked hard to help himself.  But with all his accomplishments, we are still having difficulties making his college dream a reality.  Even with the generous scholarship money provided by Arcadia and a small amount of federal student aid we are still $10,000.00 short.

 

Our biggest problem has been that my husband was involved in a devastating accident in 2010 which resulted in a broken back, shattered foot and ankle and a number of other complications.  After multiple surgeries and other medical interventions, he remains unable to work and is on medical disability.

 

Jason has also been caught in the new changes in student loan requirements, which has made it difficult for students to qualify.  My salary has made him ineligible for higher student loans in his first year.  In addition, because of the formula used, Jason is not eligible for Pell grant.  Without a Pell grant he is disqualified for other sources of funding as well.

 

So why am I posting this information?  I love my son, and want to see him succeed in life.  He is not a young man who expects life to be handed to him on a silver platter.  He is willing to work and wants to work hard.  He is worthy of an investment.  He needs it this year, and once he is through his freshman year will be able to take over and raise the funds for the future.  I am asking anyone who can help Jason over this one hump, to please do so.

 

Jason doesn’t believe that this will work.  He doesn’t believe that people who don’t know him, have never met him, and don’t necessarily understand him might be willing to contribute to help him achieve his goal.  On the other hand, I believe that all of us who are part of this human experience understand that what goes around comes around and what you give you will receive tenfold.

 

Yes, I am his Mother, and am prejudiced, but I know my son and his capabilities.  If you can, I am asking you to PLEASE help Jason become a disease pathologist.  Jason is a young man that wants to make a difference.  Please help him do so.

story:
Synopsis

Home, it’s where we feel safe.  Our home is our fortress, our Castle.  Or, it’s supposed to be.  In the end, however, the safety of your family is your own responsibility.

The large majority of brutal, violent home invasions end badly, sometimes with death, many times with rape, assault, and untold emotional and physical damage.

Knowing how to prevent and stop a home invasion in the first place, and then how to survive a brutal encounter can be the difference between life and death.

In the U.S., according to the FBI, there is a home invasion occurring almost 5 times each minute of every day.  Quite alarming is that 38% of all assaults occur during a home invasion, and that 60% of all rapes occur during a home invasion.

The genesis of this project came from numerous conversations we have had with customers of our company about the subject of Home Invasions.  It seems nearly everyone knows of or has some connection to a Home Invasion occurring, whether personally, or through a family member or close friend.

Our research shows there is simply not a good enough source of education on Home Invasion, and our mission with this project is to solve that problem.  We want to produce the best and most comprehensive video program that will do 3 things:

1.  Research and interview real home invasion victims and perpetrators to gather qualified data;

2.  Create an instructional program on preventing and stopping a Home Invasion from ever occurring;

3.  Create an instructional program with an intuitive action plan on exactly how to survive a home invasion when you become a victim.  This program will include the re-enactment of an actual home invasion to demonstrate all components.

This program will be distributed FREE to millions of people in a grass roots manner via two key channels that will help us create mass awareness of the availability of the program:  1. Directly to parents of school children through the school districts across the U.S.; and 2. Through awareness campaigns with the aid of police departments across the U.S.

We see the rise of home invasions as a very serious public matter, and our real desire is to accomplish the following with this program:  create awareness, inform, educate and empower.

Who are we and why are we qualified to take this issue on?  Our company, Vegas Tactical Adventures, is the “fun” side of a very serious educational company known as CRI Counter Terrorism Training School. 

CRI is a highly respected 12 year old company, licensed and operating as a post-secondary educational and vocational school in the State of Nevada.  CRI provides the highest level of combat training available in the world to Special Forces teams within the Armed Forces, CIA, DEA and police and SWAT units in the U.S. and abroad.  CRI also provides multiple courses for returning veterans of war to re-train them for employment and provides vocational rehabilitation for disabled veterans.  CRI will devote it's considerable expertise in the area of terrorism and crime prevention and bring real-world solutions to this project.

We need your help to fund this project and bring it to everyone.  Through awareness, education and empowerment, we can all help save many lives each year that are lost to the criminals who carry out these invasions of our homes, the most sacred space we all have.  It is as simple as that for us.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $100,000 to accomplish our goal of producing and distributing the best and most comprehensive tool to inspire and empower everyone to prevent or survive a home invasion.  This is not a project we will profit from.  We will not be selling it, and the program will be distributed for free as discussed above...easily accessible by everyone.

The funding will cover every aspect of production, interviews, research, post production, videography, editing, soundtrack, animations, graphics, mastering, and final distribution to the public through respected and trusted sources.

.We are offering some of the coolest rewards you can imagine!  CRI will provide perks for your donation that include the following educational programs developed by CRI.  These programs are created by Doron Benbenisty, founder of CRI, and are normally sold online at CRI's company store:

1.  The 360 degree Personal Protection E-book

2.  The Tactical Folding Knife instructional video program

3.  The Active Shooter Massacre Survival System

4.  The High Risk Business Owner Protection System

These educational video programs will teach you very valuable things about protecting yourself, your loved ones, your employees, and your customers if you are a business owner.  They are all yours free, depending on the amount of your donation!


The Impact

Your contribution will have a great impact on the reduction and possible elimination of a crime that affects so many innocent people in the one place they should be able to feel and be safe--HOME.  By creating an easy-to-use plan to prevent, stop and/or survive one of the worst criminal acts, many people will be empowered to protect themselves and their loved ones. Keep in mind that CRI has an extensive record of producing educational materials, methods and solutions against terrorism  The full impact of that training will be brought to this project and to the masses.  CRI has received many awards from various military divisions worldwide as an expression of their gratitude in having received training from CRI.  Now, with your help, we would like to help train the general population on this subject matter.

Please Spread the Word!

Help us spread the word quickly so we can bring this project to completion and distribution in a very timely manner!  Email your friends, talk about it on Facebook and Twitter and direct others to our campaign!

story:
Photography has been called the most democratic art form 
—but not everyone has access to the medium.

Gallery 44’s OUTREACH program breaks down existing barriers to the arts, offering black & white photography workshops to up to 50 youth every year.


Our darkroom is the last publicly accessible wet darkroom in Toronto. Listening to youth participants describe the magic of witnessing their first photograph appear in the developing trays is a testament to the power of analogue photography in a digitally saturated world. Gallery 44 has offered accessible facilities to artists since 1979, and sees a renewed growth and interest in traditional photographic techniques among a new generation of artists.

Outreach presented me with the opportunity to explore photography on a deeper level. Since my experience with Gallery 44, I walked out searching for similar outreach programs in the city. I am now a walking testament of a photographer that has learned the skills and techniques of photography through Outreach initiatives. I went from being a student to a mentor. I recently had my work exhibited in the Scotiabank Contact Photography Festival, and I am looking forward to showing more work at the Cultural Hotspot exhibit this June titled "From Scarborough With Love."

Outreach is the start of discovering your potential, and is committed to seeing you succeed. —Ebti Nabag, artist and 2011 OUTREACH participant 

Read Ebti's Story here: gallery44.org/blog/ENabag

Help us reach out to youth through OUTREACH—a vital program that brings photography to youth in our community.


Our needs and how you can help

In order to offer 40 workshops (5 groups, 8 workshops each), we need to raise
$5,000 for materials. Material fees are $125-$150 per workshop which covers the costs of photographic paper, film, processing, chemistry, snacks and transit tokens.  We actively fundraise and receive support from foundations and corporations in order to cover other costs of the program, including instructor fees, facilities and classroom space rental. But we still need your help—individual contributions are essential to this program. 

This is our fourth year of the Reach out for OUTREACH giving campaign, and this year, we are moving from Canada Helps to indiegogo in order to activate our strong social networks, and connect as many individuals as possible to spread the word about what Gallery 44 does.


Help us reach our goal by contributing to Reach out for OUTREACH!

In exchange for your support—take a piece of OUTREACH artwork home with you. 

Our exciting Art Perks include:

  • 2014 Zine "Connect," handmade by the 2014 OUTREACH participants
  • A digital print from the exhibition, 5 x 7 or 8 x 10, you choose the image.
  • A unique archival silver gelatin print, printed by an artist in our darkroom, framed and ready for your home gallery.

    Please note: we will issue charitable tax receipts for any donation above $50, minus the cost of your selected perk.
    Our Charitable Registration #119247310RR0001

    If we don’t reach our entire funding goal, the program will be scaled back, with a smaller number of participants and fewer workshops. But we don't want to have to do that, so please give generously, share generously, and help truly democratize this democratic form!
    Remember,     Indiegogo charges a 5% higher fee if we don't reach our funding goal -- so please please help us reach our goal!


Community + Connection

Our 2014 Community Partners 
Nia Centre for the Arts
Eva’s Phoenix
Toronto Council Fire Native Community Centre
PEACH
UrbanArts

With a long history of supporting education in the arts, Gallery 44 has hosted an expanding public education program targeted to serve specific audiences in the community and to reach out beyond the art community.

Gallery 44’s OUTREACH program embodies our commitment to engaging Toronto youth in the arts, by democratizing photography and supporting a new generation of image makers and visual thinkers.
We hope you will join us, and reach out for OUTREACH!

Can't contribute? There are lots of ways to help!

  • Share this campaign! This helps us reach a wider audience and helps spread the word about this vital program.
    igg.me/at/reachout2014
  • Change your profile picture on social media and include the hashtag #reachoutreach
  • Analogue film fan? Tag photos of you and your friends shooting film and working in the darkroom  #reachoutreach and we will share them.

Community + ConnectionOur 2014 Community Partners Nia Centre for the ArtsEva’s PhoenixToronto Council Fire Native Community CentrePEACHUrbanArtsWith a long history of supporting education in the arts, Gallery 44 has hosted an expanding public education program targeted to serve specific audiences in the community and to reach out beyond the art community.
Gallery 44’s OUTREACH program embodies our commitment to engaging Toronto youth in the arts, by democratizing photography and supporting a new generation of image makers and visual thinkers. We hope you will join us, and reach out for OUTREACH!Can't contribute? There are lots of ways to help!
Share this campaign! This helps us reach a wider audience and helps spread the word about this vital program.igg.me/at/reachout2014

Change your profile picture on social media and include the hashtag #reachoutreach

Analogue film fan? Tag photos of you and your friends shooting film and working in the darkroom  #reachoutreach and we will share them.

story:
Emanuel Dickson grew up in Marangu village, outside the town of Arusha, Tanzania. He comes from the people known as Chaga who live around Africa’s tallest mountain. We met Emanuel during a Kilimanjaro trek in January 2014, where he was our assistant guide. In the first few hours of our trip, even before getting out of the car that brought us to the Kilimanjaro gates, we were very impressed by Emanuel. He showed deep knowledge of world politics, African history, and religion. While hiking we spoke with him about synaptic transmission, philosophy of mind, and the biology of the brain -- certainly not topics we envisioned talking about while on the mountain! It was clear that Emanuel was extremely intelligent and well-read. 

We learned that Emanuel had finished 7 out of 8 semesters at St. Joseph’s University in Dar Es Salaam, where he’s majoring in computer science and engineering. But he hasn’t been able to finish his final semester, because his aunt, who had been paying for his schooling, recently passed away. (He has lost several close family members to AIDS.) According to university regulations, if he does not finish his final semester this year, he will not obtain his degree. We communicated directly with the head of his department to verify his story and academic standing, and we decided to create this campaign to support his education. We are raising money to pay for Emanuel’s last semester, which would enable him to get a degree in computer science, and open up the door to greater opportunities in his future.

What Emanuel needs 

For just $2,700 Emanuel will be able to get his degree. Here's the budget breakdown:

$1,400 will go to tuition

$1,100 will cover rent and food during the semester

$200 will go to miscellaneous fees (such as bank transfer fees, Indiegogo fees, etc).

The semester begins on May 26, 2014, so we need to raise the funds by May 22, 2014.

*We are also looking for someone to donate or purchase a laptop computer for Emanuel, as he currently has to borrow one from a friend to complete assignments.*

Make your tax-deductible donation today

All donations will be fully tax deductible, as they will go through the World Health and Organization Network (WHEN), a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to improving access to quality healthcare and education for underserved populations. When you contribute to this campaign, you will receive an email from Firstgiving, Indiegogo's nonprofit payments processor, confirming the tax-deductible status of your contribution. 

Tuition money will be sent directly to the university bank account. If we exceed our goal, additional funds will be used to purchase a laptop computer for Emanuel.

The impact

We believe that we can change Emanuel’s life for the better through this campaign. This is his one opportunity to finish his higher education, which will increase his opportunities in life dramatically, and allow him to better support his family.

Who we are

We are a couple based in Cambridge, Massachusetts. Anna is a writer and documentary filmmaker who is currently completing a Ph.D. at MIT in the Department of Science, Technology and Society. Jon is a physician who is finishing up his last year of residency in internal medicine and pediatrics at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH). He is involved with many global health projects and is the President of WHEN.

How we verified Emanuel's story

We asked Emanuel to send over a copy of his official transcript as well as a recommendation letter from the head of his department. We then called the university directly (using a phone number listed online, which matched the phone number on the letterhead that Emanuel had sent us) and spoke directly to the principal, who confirmed Emanuel's status. We have also been in touch with Emanuel's current employer, Ahsante Tours (an excellent company that we used for our Mt. Kilimanjaro climb), about all the details, and we are working to set up a perk whereby Emanuel will guide one up Mt. Kilimanjaro in exchange for a high-level donation. We have been in touch with Emanuel since January and have talked with him about many details; the internal consistency of his story had held up over the course of these months. Finally, we would also like to note that Emanuel has never explicitly asked us for money at any point: we were struck by his intelligence, and over the course of our trip we inquired further about his educational background. When we learned that he could complete his degree for just a few thousand dollars, we decided to help. We have been working on this campaign since January, and the current two-week deadline is due to the time it took to put the materials together (Emanuel had been working non-stop on the mountain during high season; he had to travel to Dar Es Salaam to meet the head of department in-person for a recommendation letter; and he has no computer or Internet at his home, so putting together the video took a long time).

Other ways you can help 

Please help us spread the word (Facebook, Twitter, email, mailing lists) to make this a successful campaign!

story:
Hello everyone!

My name is Daphne, and I am an undergraduate student at the University of New Hampshire at Manchester. I am enrolled in two majors; 1) Communications Arts with a focus of interpersonal communications, and 2) Politics & Society with a focus of international affairs.

Although I was born in the USA into a Greek family, I was raised in Greece since I was about five years old and lived there for about ten years. I moved back to the US just in time to start high school, and now I am in college. I have been back a few times, but as many of you know life gets very expensive once you start college.

For the past two years I have been wanting to do research on the Greek government, looking at all of their political parties, and seeing how each of them  play a role in what it going on today in the country. This research will be for my final capstone seminar in my Politics major, and I will be presenting my research at the Undergraduate Research Conference, which takes place mid April every year. It is open to the public for those who wish to come check out the various projects, and I will be posting updates on here throughout the course of my research!

The current situation in Greece has political parties heated up, and all the Greek citizens are looking to get the best party in the house who will have a great economic impact on the nation. They were about to be declared a failed state just a couple years ago, sadly due to the chaotic mess that started occurring in 2008. The political parties that are running for the top now have so many promises, and outlooks as to where Greece fits in the European Union, and that to me is a fascinating subject. The question "Should Greece be part of the E.U.?" is one that has been buzzing around, or "Should Greece's currency be the euro , or should they go back to the drachma"? These are questions I seek to create arguments about, along with looking at the economic impact on the citizens themselves.

I am planning on traveling to Greece in mid November when there tends to be a lot of political movements within the youth groups. I will be documenting the events with camera equipment and sound recording devices. Once I return to the States I will start putting pieces together, and creating a short film, along with writing a 50 page paper on Greek politics.

My total expenses are estimated to be a little over $2,000. However, I am only asking assistance for the plane ticket which that alone, during that time frame, can cost anywhere between 1,000-1,300 USD. This is not a vacation I am asking people to fund(if it were I would be asking for summer time so that I could go to the beaches). People who might wish to donate, will be donating towards an academic goal of mine.

Thank you for your time!
Daphne

story:
Our Story

The Ecology Connection is an outdoor-based educational organization aimed at getting New York City youth out into nature to explore our ecosystem as well as our relationship to it. We are running a summer ecology camp in Van Cortlandt Park, and need your support to make it affordable for kids in the Bronx and northern Manhattan to attend.

My name is Erica Bruskin, and I am the founder of The Ecology Connection. I have been an environmental educator for almost a decade, working at a farm, zoo, botanical garden, outdoor education centers, as well as classrooms. I have had the opportunity to witness the innate curiosity and joy of youth exploring nature. I believe that every young person should get the chance to learn about themselves as well as their ecosystem through their five senses rather than through a textbook. I am really excited about exploring Van Cortlandt Park this summer with the campers!

Many kids from New York City are not able to go to a summer camp outside of the city to experience nature. We would like to make sure no one gets left out. Our goals at The Ecology Connection are:

  1. To facilitate positive experiences in nature, encourage curiosity, and explore the park through hands-on student driven games and activities.
  2. To explore how our culture interacts with and relies on nature, and find our personal connection to the natural world.
  3. To build community around healthy children, healthy families, and healthy ecosystems.

To learn more about The Ecology Connection and our summer camp, please go to http://www.ecologyconnection.org




Where you come in

  • With your support, we can make sure every child who wants to attend this camp, and experience their connection to nature will have the opportunity to do so.
  • Our goal is $2,600, but the more we raise, the more scholarships we can provide to those who need financial assistance to attend camp this summer.



What You Get in Return

  • We sincerely appreciate anything you are able to contribute. Everyone who donates at $15 or higher will get a shout-out on FB, and those who give $35 or more will get a hand-written thank you card once camp starts, and for you big spenders at $65 or more that thank you card will include seeds to plant in your garden (or to seed bomb the nearest abandoned lot).



Thank you!

  • Even if you are not in a position to donate financially, you can still contribute. Please share this with your network if you agree that this hands-on, outdoor ecology program will benefit our children as well as our community.
  • No matter how you are able to contribute, we are deeply grateful for your support! Thank you, thank you, thank you.

story:
Save our School 

Our program is shutting down. After 14 years of providing education and skills to Aboriginal youth in Winnipeg, our existing school is closing. This puts the future of dozens of at-risk Winnipeg youth in limbo. Our goal is to ensure these youth have a program to return to in September. This is why we are launching this campaign. Northern Stars Eduation Program will be located in Winnipeg, Manitoba and would cater to Aboriginal youth who want to work, earn their Mature Grade 12 and transition towards a meaningful career.

Aboriginals are the fastest growing demographic in Canada. Manitoba boasts the youngest population of any 10 Canadian provinces thanks to the Aboriginal population. Yet 50% of Aboriginal Youth in Winnipeg do not have their Grade 12 because of a number of barriers.

Northern Stars Education Program

We've incorporated the name "Northern Stars Education Program" as a not-for-profit organization that will serve as our foundation for the new school. We already have teachers and staff from the old school who are ready and willing to start new - and we have many organizations and First Nations interested in helping out. But we need to raise seed money to get our program going.

They know that we have the experience and credibility to keep our program running. But we need to save our school before September, so our students can return!

This program is completely non-profit. The Northern Stars Education Program Inc. board is comprised of seven Aboriginal and Non-Aboriginal members and three advisors with formidable experience in education, program development, cultural programming, business management, finance, construction, green technology and advocacy.

With your help we can make our new school a reality.

Our New School

In order to make our new school a reality we need to raise seed money to get our program going. Your donation will go towards the bricks and mortar of our new facility including things like tables, chairs, computers and new tools.

Making a Difference

For the past fourteen years our program has made a real impact with over 150 graduates in the last six years alone. Our successes also go well beyond the classroom with our graduates strengthening the fabric of their families and of their communities. With many of our students traveling to Winnipeg from their northern communities, our program becomes their home away from home. Without our program our students may not find the supports they need in order to succeed.

Real Challenges

Moving to Winnipeg to go to school is a reality for thousands of Aboriginal Youth across Canada. Manitoba is home to 63 First Nation communities yet 42 of them do not have a high school. This means that many Aboriginal Youth must leave their families behind to go to school during a critical time in their life. Fitting in, finding the right school, making new friends, loneliness and racism are some of the barriers Aboriginal Youth have to face in the big city.

Our school offers the supports our students need so they can deal with the stresses of life in the big city including counselling, peer supports, cultural teachings and life skills classes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please "like" our Facebook page, share our website or use the Indiegogo share tools:

  • https://www.facebook.com/SaveOurSchoolWinnipeg/
  • http://saveourschoolwinnipeg.wordpress.com/

story:
Can you help to bridge the digital divide in the outback and support the training of 100 Tutors of students in Western Queensland in 2016?

The long running drought affecting over 80% of the state of Queensland is having catastrophic impacts on the students who attend the Longreach School of Distance Education and their families. Covering an area twice the size of Victoria the school currently caters for 173 children whose educational program is supported by a Home Tutor.

As a former teacher of the school I understand the social isolation experienced by many families, and the importance of equipping Home Tutors with the skills to support their students.

As a result of numerous fundraising campaigns to help support children from drought affected Queensland, in 2016 the school will be providing each student with an iPad. This is great news! However, there is an urgent need for professional learning to improve the digital literacy of Home Tutors, and to bridge the digital divide experienced  as a result of both technical and financial barriers.

My goal is to raise $5000 (AUD) to fund sending three experienced teachers from Brisbane and Northern New South Wales to Longreach to facilitate a highly interactive three day workshop in February 2016, aimed at equipping Home Tutors with the IT skills needed to implement the Longreach School of Education's 1:1 iPad program.

story:
Short Summary

United Vision, o.s. sends well-trained volunteers to Mexico who teach English using highly effective methods. Our programs are aimed at rural areas with potential for tourism. The main objective is to educate LOCAL PEOPLE WHO COULD MAKE USE OF THE KNOWLEDGE OF ENGLISH TO ADVANCE THEIR BUSINESSES or to start off their own business activities connected with ecotourism.

In the next stage of our mission we plan to expand our efforts by starting needed programs to complement the successful local developing support. These include: microfinancing services, fair-trade agreements, e-shop platforms for local products, eco-tourism development, and sponsoring of children's educational programs, all in English.

The pilot project, which lasted from September 2011 to March 2012, HAS PROVED THAT THE CONCEPT BENEFITS MEXICAN PEOPLE in rural areas with a strong desire to access high quality education and improve living conditions for themselves and their families. Since then, more volunteers have been working in Mexico.

Current Situation

United Vision will send TWO OTHER VOLUNTEERS to Mexico soon. They will be teaching English in the communities of Michoacán and Veracruz respectively. In each community there are around FIFTY STUDENTS, both children and adults, already expecting them and ready to continue studying. Current capacities of the organization, however, are limited and ensuring the CONTINUOUS SUPPLY OF VOLUNTEERS IN PARTNER COMMUNITIES still remains a main challenge.

What will be covered

  • $450 cover the costs of ACCOMMODATION AND MEALS for one volunteer per month
  • $500 cover OPERATIONAL AND LEGAL EXPENSES of United Vision for one year (tax and accounting obligations, bank account fees, domain registration, website hosting fees)
  • Contributions also facilitate covering costs of organization of conferences and special events, hard copies of marketing campaigns, ground transportation of volunteers in Mexico (airport-community), and miscellaneous expenses

What You Get

  • For any amount you donate, you will receive a CERTIFICATE that demonstrates to your colleagues, friends and family your support of educational programs aimed to fight poverty in rural Mexico. The certificate is signed by the representative of United Vision o.s. and contains PICTURES OF BENEFICIERY COMMUNITIES AND SUPPORTED PEOPLE AND VOLUNTEERS.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • BECOME A VOLUNTEER!!! We offer you full training, accommodation and meals free of charge. Write us at info@united-vision.org
  • SPREAD THE WORD!! Tell your friends, family and co-workers about this project; post it in the social media, websites, and other information channels. Visit our Facebook page or our website
  • SHARE YOUR IDEAS! Contact us at info@united-vision.org

THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!!

Current capacities of the organization, however, are limited and ensuring the CONTINUOUS SUPPLY OF VOLUNTEERS IN PARTNER COMMUNITIES still remains a main challenge.
What will be covered



$450 cover the costs of ACCOMMODATION AND MEALS for one volunteer per month
$500 cover OPERATIONAL AND LEGAL EXPENSES of United Vision for one year (tax and accounting obligations, bank account fees, domain registration, website hosting fees)
Contributions also facilitate covering costs of organization of conferences and special events, hard copies of marketing campaigns, ground transportation of volunteers in Mexico (airport-community), and miscellaneous expenses



What You Get

For any amount you donate, you will receive a CERTIFICATE that demonstrates to your colleagues, friends and family your support of educational programs aimed to fight poverty in rural Mexico. The certificate is signed by the representative of United Vision o.s. and contains PICTURES OF BENEFICIERY COMMUNITIES AND SUPPORTED PEOPLE AND VOLUNTEERS.



Other Ways You Can Help

BECOME A VOLUNTEER!!! We offer you full training, accommodation and meals free of charge. Write us at info@united-vision.org

SPREAD THE WORD!! Tell your friends, family and co-workers about this project; post it in the social media, websites, and other information channels. Visit our Facebook page or our website

SHARE YOUR IDEAS! Contact us at info@united-vision.org


THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!!

story:
Who are we?

We are students, teachers, and volunteers from the Union Settlement Adult Education program.  Over the past four months we have met to find solutions to the challenges the Adult Education program faces, including a growing demand for classes and a need for more effective teaching tools.

Why are we asking?

In 2009 Union Settlement offered 47 courses reaching 1,250 adult learners. Students came from across New York City to take courses in English for Speakers of Other Languages, Adult Basic Education and to study for the GED in English, Spanish and French. Unfortunately the recession resulted in budget cuts that have greatly reduced the number of classes Union Settlement, and Adult Education providers across New York City, can provide. Currently the agency can only offer 17 classes. During the last registration period more then 600 individuals came to sign up for the 300 spaces we have available.

Union Settlement has dedicated every penny of current funding to meeting the rising need for services. Many of our teachers are here as volunteers, and finding funding for even basic supplies like dry erase markers is a struggle. 

Many of our students have been forced, or pushed, out of school by unavoidable circumstances. Despite the obstacles that confront them daily our students are determined to pursue their education.  Becoming a student again as an adult is challenging, and we want to mirror their commitment by giving them the opportunity to improve the school for themselves and future students to come.

We are asking for your help.  If you believe that adults deserve a second chance at quality education, please consider making a donation.

Where is the money going?

All of the money raised will go directly towards improving our classrooms. To bring our classrooms into the 21st century we’d spend the money on the following:

  • Google Chromebook ($250)
  • Screen ($116)
  • Projector ($300)
  • Classroom Accessories ($600)

Other Ways You Can Help.

We understand that some people just can't make a financial contribution, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please help us tell our story by sharing our campaign with your friends and family via Twitter, Facebook and Youtube!
  • Volunteer at Union Settlement! We have opportunities throughout our programs, from youth through senior services. Vist http://www.unionsettlement.org/volunteer for more information.

 

Thank you for your help.
