story:
Education For Children, (Senegal) registered as an non-profit organization in 2010.  To date we have sponsoring 152 children. We supply these children with the necessary school resources through the generous donations of friends and family. In Senegal many children don’t go to school or leave school early because they can't afford to attend. Many children are seen as more valuable to their parents at home, doing domestic chores and caring for younger siblings.  

We believe that the benefits of sending a child to school, especially girls are very important but this is not always obvious to Senegalese parents. Many children are forced to work by their parents, trading crafts.

As a child in Senegal, there are barriers to learning, especially for those who have no light at night nor a quiet place to study. Children are often too hungry to study and we believe that we need to find a solution to their lack of proper nutrition and give them every opportunity to have a good education so they will become leaders and maybe even teachers in future. We believe that by providing a place for the children to learn to grow their own food, save their own seeds and plant food for the future is vital for our nation to grow independent of foreign aid and begging.

We aim to:

  • set up community gardens based on permaculture principles
  • teach kids how to create organic fertilizers, compost and worm farms
  • encourage families to grow and involve them in the education process
  • teach skills in waste management and sanitation
  • improve the school environment
  • encourage children to enjoy nutritious foods

There are estimated to be about 150,000 Talibé children in Senegal aged 4 to 18 years, who spend each day begging. Many of them are beaten by their elders and run away from home. The trauma of their childhood leaves them in a state of loss and they often end up on the streets, homeless and commiting crimes and trafficking drugs.

What we need:

  • Land - $12,000
  • Building materials (for security) - $3000
  • Gardening tools - $2000
  • Books and educational resources - $2500
  • School supplies - $5000
  • Bore hole and well - $2500
  • Permaculture training course assistance - $3000
  • Animal stock, (12 chickens & 2 sheep) - $600
  • Aquaponics equipment - $3000

Total cost needed = $33,600

If it so happens that we don't raise this amount we will focus on supporting the children with what we have and meanwhile we will develop a strategy for income streams such as the sale of produce and arts and craft production and marketing. 

CHECK OUT our gallery and see the difference we have made already to the beautiful children of Senegal.

Please MAKE SOME NOISE and help us to continue improving the lives of the children of Dakar and their families. 

Mame will be releasing a NEW TUNE soon... STAND BY for his new VIDEO coming out soon and FREE DOWNLOAD of his latest Tune entitled - "EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN".

story:
The Skinny...

As a 33 year old who has had lots of ups and downs in the past few years (health issues, divorce, job loss) I felt it was time to put my life on a better path and go back to school. I have tons of experience and many skills but it's been impossible for me to find a job that will pay me what I'm worth without any degree.

Unfortunately, I can't afford to because of some major financial durress.

What I Need & What You Get

I applied and got accepted to NJCU and have enrolled there, but there was an issue with my financial aid: I GOT NONE. I took out some student loans and was told that I had $7k coming to me and was all set.

Unfortunately, that $7k in loans is for the whole year and each semester is about $6.5k. That means I need over 2k a semester to go to school, and I am currently collecting partial unemployment because I'm only working part-time for minimum wage. In other words.... I NEED SOME SERIOUS HELP!

For your money you could wind up getting an entire album recorded for you by me, or just one song, or some amazing photo shoot packages from my dear friend Ruth Arnold.

You can also get every piece of music I ever will record for the rest of my life. If you just want to give a buck, you'll get my undying gratitude!

The Impact

Any money collected will go straight to my tuition, books etc. I'm trying to turn my life around and this hurdle is huge for me. If I can get into school I'm certain I can perform well enough in my grades to get assistance from grants and scholarships that are not available to me yet because of how long it's been since I graduated high school.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about it!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Share on twitter and facebook and I'll be in your debt forever!

story:
I'm one of the lead members of YES East Ayrshire, a group working for a YES vote in the Independence referendum in September 2014. We've been working as a group for almost 2 years now to bring the positive message of the YES campaign to the people of East Ayrshire.

In order to fundraise I have abstained from drinking any sugary/caffeinated/alcoholic drinks from the 100 days to go mark until the vote on 18th September. I will be giving up any unhealthy snack foods, chips, cakes or takeaway from 70 days to go and when we reach 40 days to go I will be giving up meat. Saying No to fundraise for a YES vote.

This fundraiser is to raise money to fund the local YES campaign in the last few months in the lead up to the vote on the 18th September. We need campaign materials and lots of them as we go door to door canvassing.

This is the most important part of the campaign as we actively talk to people to outline that Scotland can be, should be and must be an Independent country to realise our own potential and make our country a better, fairer and more equal society.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to supply our stall, shop and canvassing sessions with the tools and accessories required to do a professional and important job as part of the Indy ref.

Talk to me - Donate £25 and get a 'Talk to me' pack to help spread the visibility of the campaign.

Convince me - Donate £50 and get 5 'Talk to me' packs to give to other supporters and multiply the effect of visibility by 5 or give to people who you have convinced about the benefits of YES yourself.

Sign me up - Donate £120 and get 10 'Talk to me' packs and help out the YES campaign by helping to convince 10 others, a YES mug and become an honorary member of the team with your own original YES East Ayrshire t-shirt.

The Impact

It goes without saying that if we are successful in helping convince people to vote YES we are convinced that this will change our country for the better. It must be obvious to everyone that those that have the most to gain from Scotland being a success are the people who live and work here. We should have the power to decide for ourselves how are country is run, it is after all normal and how the vast majority of countries are run.

This will be the biggest thing to happen in Scotland in its history and also important on a worldwide perspective as well, it shows others that peaceful democratic change can happen through the ballot box rather than through violent means.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can help by liking & sharing our Facebook page Yes East Ayrshire, follow us on Twitter @YesEastAyrshire and more importantly coming to help out campaigning, just email us on yeseastayrshire@gmail.com

    Talking to people about the referendum is important, please engage with the people closest to you and convince them that this will make a huge difference for the better. We are all part of the campaign, as the great late Margo MacDonald said, all we need to win our Independence is for everyone who is convinced of the case for YES to convince just one other person.

story:
HELLO!! My name is Patricia (Malkie) Raythe and I am a 2nd semester (1st year) veterinary student, at St. George's University School of Veterinary Medicine. 

Next summer (2015), I will have the opportunity to go on a once-in-a-lifetime adventure; joining only 80 fellow veterinary students from around the world in South Africa to enhance our careers in veterinary medicine.

I will be finishing up my 3rd semester @ St. George's University's College of Veterinary Medicine next spring, Just before my journey to South Africa begins.

SYMCO (The organization that organizes and runs the symposium) offers a rare chance to get hands on experience in one of the most diverse wildlife populations on planet earth. The lessons we will learn in those 18 days will greatly enhance our veterinary skills for our entire lives!!

This is a HUGE opportunity that very few veterinary students get to take advantage of, so attending and getting the most out of the hands on experience and lectures on the trip would really give me helping hand in getting started on my career when I graduate.

Getting to South Africa

As you know, flights half way around the globe and back don't come cheap, nor does the symposium itself:

Every single cent that is raised will go towards paying for my plane tickets, travel expenses and the symposium registration fee. I am hoping to gain additional funding from the school, however their grant money is difficult to come by, when you are a college student with student loans, every cent counts!

The student who turned me on to indie go go said that I could bring back a little piece of South Africa as a gift to everyone who helps, I think that would be awesome to do so if you do donate you will get a little piece of South Africa along with my thanks and gratitude! I have set different donation levels with different presents that I could bring back!

What happens to your money if goal is not met?

If the goal is not reached, or if for some reason I am unable to attend the symposium, the money will be saved to attend the International Pathology Symposium in 2015. Even if I cannot go to SYMCO, Your money will still go towards funding me to an international veterinary symposium to help me expand my personal and professional horizons.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you cannot give $ to this cause, YOU CAN STILL HELP! Please help spread the word by sharing this campaign on your social network but using the Indiegogo share tools, or posting the URL on other social media!! Remember every bit counts, even sharing!!

    THANK YOU!!

    I want to say thank you to everyone who has supported students like me. You have given us a chance to live our dreams. Without crowd funding we would never be able to travel and gain these experiences! Your help allows us to become better veterinarians and better people, allowing us to pay-forward the kindness that you have given to us! 

    THANK YOU ALL!!

story:
What is mibuho.com?

¿Qué es mibuho.com?

mibuho.com is a online tutorial site for spanish speaking people. Our goal is to provide a massive online library to help spanish natives learn at their own pace.

Currently there are just a few tutorial sites, in spanish, available; providing just a few tutorials and on top they are very expensive.

 

mibuho.com es una página de tutoriales en línea para las personas que hablan español. Nuestro objetivo es proporcionar una biblioteca virtual para ayudar a las personas que hablan español que vayan aprendiendo a su propio ritmo.

Actualmente existen sólo unos pocos sitios de tutoriales en español disponibles; proporcionando sólo algunos tutoriales y además son muy caros.

Who is the founder of mibuho.com?

¿Quién es el fundador de mibuho.com?

Hello, my name is Uwe Kreuzahler and I’m the founder of mibuho.com!
I have worked with computers my whole life, studying system informatics back in ’78 at the Technical University in Dūsseldorf and got my degree at the ETH in Zūrich at 1982
After graduation i’ve worked for almost a decade for IBM and moved 1996 to Costa Rica, providing network security, web development and graphic design to the community.

Being a father of 3 girls i got confronted over the last years with the lack of knowledge at the schools here in Costa Rica.
After doing research i have found that this situation in Costa Rica is no exception in whole Latin America.

Teachers still teach very old materials, therefore most computer users in Latin American countries doesn’t have a chance to learn how to use todays software.

Unfortunately at this time only a few sites are available providing some basic tutorials in spanish, the majority of the good tutorial sites online are totally in focus of English speaking members, and on top they are very expensive.

The goal is to provide at least 2,500 tutorials within the first year, covering different subjects with software of all kind. Word, Excel, Photoshop, HTML, CSS and many others.

Membership will be provided on a very low rate, so we will be able to afford the basic operational expenses, which are based in the connectivity for the servers, the producers of the tutorials and office staff members who will provide additional support and keep everything running.

To make this project a reality we ask for your help, even one dollar will make a huge difference, just imagine the impact you will have in so many families who never had and never will have the chance to rich the educational tools to improve their lives.

Hola, mi nombre es Uwe Kreuzahler y soy el fundador de mibuho.com!
He trabajado con computadoras toda mi vida, empezando en el '78 estudiando Ingeniería en sistemas en la Universidad Técnica en Duesseldorf y obtuve mi licenciatura en la ETH de Zurich en 1982.
Después de graduarme trabaje durante casi una década para IBM, la cual se trasladó a Costa Rica en 1996, proporcionando seguridad de redes, desarrollo web y diseño gráfico para la comunidad.

Siendo un padre de 3 niñas por las cuales luche en los últimos años debido a la falta de conocimiento en las escuelas aquí en Costa Rica.
Después de hacer algunas investigaciones me he dado cuenta que esta situación en Costa Rica no es la excepción en toda América Latina.

Los profesores siguen enseñando materias muy antiguas, por lo tanto, la mayoría de usuarios de computadoras en los países de América Latina no tienen la oportunidad de aprender a utilizar el software de hoy en día.

Desafortunadamente en este momento sólo algunos sitios web están disponibles proporcionando algunos tutoriales básicos en español, la mayoría de los sitios web buenos de tutoriales en línea son totalmente enfocados en los miembros que hablan inglés y son muy caros.

El objetivo es proporcionar al menos 2.500 tutoriales dentro del primer año, que cubren diferentes temas con el software de todo tipo como por ejemplo: Word, Excel, Photoshop, HTML, CSS y muchos más.

La membresía será proporciona en una tasa muy baja, por lo cual será capaz de cubrir los gastos básicos de funcionamiento, que se basan en la conectividad de los servidores, los productores de los tutoriales y los miembros del personal de la oficina que proporcionará un apoyo adicional y mantener todo funcionando .

Para hacer realidad este proyecto le pedimos su ayuda, hasta un dólar hará una gran diferencia, sólo imaginar el impacto que tendrá en tantas familias que nunca tuvieron la oportunidad o las herramientas educativas para mejorar sus vidas .

What We Need

¿Qué necesitamos?

Obviously we will need a lot more then only $5,000, as we ask here, to get mibuho.com to the level we want. Currently we spent our free time and personal resources to get things together. But it's a slow progress.

As you can imagine there are a lot of things we need to buy, like studio equipment, computer hard- and software and we want to hire more teacher, to help us producing more videos at a faster pace.

Evidentemente vamos a necesitar mucho más que sólo 5.000 dólares que es lo que pedimos aquí para lograr obtener mibuho.com al nivel que queremos. Actualmente gastamos nuestros recursos de tiempo libre y personales para conseguir cosas juntos. Pero es un progreso lento.

Como se puede imaginar, hay un montón de cosas que tenemos que comprar, como por ejemplo equipos de estudio, computadoras, programas y queremos contratar a más profesores, para ayudarnos a producir más vídeos a un ritmo más rápido.

What You Get?

¿Lo que usted obtiene?

We have provided different perks with incredible discounts, as a thank you for the early helper. You can even get a lifetime membership for free by helping to spread the word as a Angel Supporter

If you are interest in being a Angel Supporter then contact us and we will you get setup. Unfortunately there is no way to have this done automatically. Each Angel Supporter campaign will be handled manually

Hemos proporcionado diferentes ventajas con descuentos increíbles, como muestra de agradecimiento por la pronta ayuda. Usted puede incluso conseguir una membresía de por vida gratis, ayudando a correr la voz como un Ángel de Apoyo

Si estás interesado en ser un Ángel de Apoyo póngase en contacto con nosotros y vamos a obtener la configuración. Desafortunadamente, no hay manera de tener esta configuración de forma automática. Así que cada campaña de Apoyo Ángel será manejado de forma manual.

Get a VERY unique mibuho t-shirt!

Obtenga una camiseta con diseño único de mibuho.com!

I don't speak spanish!

Yo no hablo español!

Certainly our focus is to provide a service to the spanish speaking natives, but you will be able to follow the steps inside the tutorials even without listening to the narration.

Another benefit would be, if you already speak a bit spanish, to use mibuho.com to get your spanish even better.

In case you don't want to learn or upgrade your spanish, you can pledge the small amount of $1, to simply help us, or you can pledge $10 which will give you one of our awesome mibuho.com t-shirts

Remember: Every cent will help to get mibuho.com off the ground

story_txt:
What is mibuho.com?
¿Qué es mibuho.com?



mibuho.com is a online tutorial site for spanish speaking people. Our goal is to provide a massive online library to help spanish natives learn at their own pace. 
Currently there are just a few tutorial sites, in spanish, available; providing just a few tutorials and on top they are very expensive.
 


mibuho.com es una página de tutoriales en línea para las personas que hablan español. Nuestro objetivo es proporcionar una biblioteca virtual  para ayudar a las personas que hablan español que vayan  aprendiendo a su propio ritmo.
Actualmente existen sólo unos pocos  sitios de tutoriales en español  disponibles; proporcionando sólo algunos tutoriales y además son muy caros.



Who is the founder of mibuho.com?
¿Quién es el fundador de mibuho.com?







Hello, my name is Uwe Kreuzahler and I’m the founder of mibuho.com!
        I have worked with computers my whole life, studying system informatics back in ’78 at the Technical University in Dūsseldorf and got my degree at the ETH in Zūrich at 1982
        After graduation i’ve worked for almost a decade for IBM and moved 1996 to Costa Rica, providing network security, web development and graphic design to the community.
Being a father of 3 girls i got confronted over the last years with the lack of knowledge at the schools here in Costa Rica.
          After doing research i have found that this situation in Costa Rica is no exception in whole Latin America. 
          Teachers still teach very old materials, therefore most computer users in Latin American countries doesn’t have a chance to learn how to use todays software.
          Unfortunately at this time only a few sites are available providing some basic tutorials in spanish, the majority of the good tutorial sites online are totally in focus of English speaking members, and on top they are very expensive.
The goal is to provide at least 2,500 tutorials within the first year, covering different subjects with software of all kind. Word, Excel, Photoshop, HTML, CSS and many others.
Membership will be provided on a very low rate, so we will be able to afford the basic operational expenses, which are based in the connectivity for the servers, the producers of the tutorials and office staff members who will provide additional support and keep everything running.
To make this project a reality we ask for your help, even one dollar will make a huge difference, just imagine the impact you will have in so many families who never had and never will have the chance to rich the educational tools to improve their lives. 


Hola, mi nombre es Uwe Kreuzahler y soy el fundador de mibuho.com! 
        He trabajado con computadoras toda mi vida, empezando en el '78 estudiando Ingeniería en sistemas en la Universidad Técnica en Duesseldorf y obtuve mi licenciatura en la ETH de Zurich en 1982.
        Después de graduarme trabaje durante casi una década para IBM, la cual se trasladó a Costa Rica en 1996, proporcionando  seguridad de redes, desarrollo web y diseño gráfico para la comunidad.
Siendo un padre de 3 niñas por las cuales luche en los últimos años debido a la falta de conocimiento en las escuelas aquí en Costa Rica.
          Después de hacer algunas investigaciones me he dado cuenta que esta situación en Costa Rica no es la excepción en toda América Latina. 
Los profesores siguen enseñando materias muy antiguas, por lo tanto, la mayoría de usuarios de computadoras en los países de América Latina no tienen la oportunidad de aprender a utilizar el software de hoy en día.
Desafortunadamente en este momento sólo algunos sitios web  están disponibles proporcionando algunos tutoriales básicos en español, la mayoría de los sitios web buenos de tutoriales en línea son totalmente enfocados en los miembros que hablan inglés y son muy caros.
El objetivo es proporcionar al menos 2.500 tutoriales dentro del primer año, que cubren diferentes temas con el software de todo tipo como por ejemplo: Word, Excel, Photoshop, HTML, CSS y muchos más. 
La membresía será proporciona en una tasa muy baja, por lo cual  será capaz de cubrir  los gastos básicos de funcionamiento, que se basan en la conectividad de los servidores, los productores de los tutoriales y los miembros del personal de la oficina que proporcionará un apoyo adicional y mantener todo funcionando .
Para hacer realidad este proyecto le pedimos su ayuda, hasta un dólar hará una gran diferencia, sólo imaginar el impacto que tendrá en tantas familias que nunca tuvieron la oportunidad o las herramientas  educativas para mejorar sus vidas .



What We Need
¿Qué necesitamos?



Obviously we will need a lot more then only $5,000, as we ask here, to get mibuho.com to the level we want. Currently we spent our free time and personal resources to get things together. But it's a slow progress. 
As you can imagine there are a lot of things we need to buy, like studio equipment, computer hard- and software and we want to hire more teacher, to help us producing more videos at a faster pace.


Evidentemente vamos a necesitar mucho más que sólo 5.000 dólares que es lo que pedimos aquí para lograr obtener mibuho.com al nivel que queremos. Actualmente gastamos nuestros recursos de tiempo libre y personales para conseguir cosas juntos. Pero es un progreso lento.
Como se puede imaginar, hay un montón de cosas que tenemos que comprar, como por ejemplo equipos de estudio, computadoras, programas y queremos contratar a más profesores, para ayudarnos a producir más vídeos a un ritmo más rápido.



What You Get?
¿Lo que usted obtiene?



We have provided different perks with incredible discounts, as a thank you for the early helper. You can even get a lifetime membership for free by helping to spread the word as a Angel Supporter
If you are interest in being a Angel Supporter then contact us and we will you get setup. Unfortunately there is no way to have this done automatically. Each Angel Supporter campaign will be handled manually

story:
Short Summary

Our children have only been in archery for a year, but they have quickly fallen in love with the sport, and they have quickly gotten pretty good at it!

We've been involved with NASP (National Archery in the Schools Program) through a local public school. Jaron (14, wearing the Captain America sweatshirt in above pic), Liberty (13), Grace (11), and Hope (9) competed all season, including the recent Minnesota State tournament, where each of their teams qualified for Nationals (and Jaron finished 11th out of over 300 middle school boys)!

We need to find a way to Louisville, Kentucky, May 9th & 10th!

What We Need & What You Get

We are a homeschooling family of 11 (yes, that means 9 children!) We love it and wouldn't have it any other way. We get by, we always have, and we have faith that we always will.

But a trip like this is an unexpected, and therefore unbudgeted, big expense!

It's big extras like this, that many (perhaps most) families wouldn't be able to do without the help of a network of loving and supportive friends.

  • We need two hotel homes, which we've reserved already (in faith) for 3 nights for just under $800.
  • We estimate around $500 for gas (we drive a 12-passenger van)
  • The archers' registration fees are $120
  • We also need to eat along the way :)

If we are able to raise some quick funds to make this trip happen (we are hoping to bring the whole family), you can follow along with our adventures on the Facebook page I'm setting up - https://www.facebook.com/sendthemtonationals

You can also follow along on my blog's Facebook page at - https://www.facebook.com/AnOrdinaryMomBlog

We're looking forward to sharing the adventure!!

The Impact

Our children have always been homeschooled, and have had chances to try several extra-curricular activities, like violin lessons, children's theater experiences, tae kwon do classes, dance lessons, homeschool co-op fun, and now archery.

They have had a taste of many things, but qualifying for Nationals is HUGE for them! For all of us!

We don't get the chance to travel much (at all). In fact, the only other time our children have been farther than Wisconsin was in the fall of 2011, when we moved the family to Bloomington, Indiana for 8 weeks while our oldest son, Ian, underwent proton radiation treatment for brain cancer.

A multi-state trip, for an exciting and good reason, will be such a great experience, for our whole family. We want to make it an adventure filled with good memories!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some of you just won't be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools on Facebook, Twitter, etc...!

story:
THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO DONATED!!!  Through this site and some other personal donations, I managed to reach my goal!!



I have been honored to be accepted as a Kiva fellow! Kiva is a micro lending platform that partners with hundreds of micro finance institutions around the world. Kiva allows people like you and me to make a small loan to someone across the world, who would otherwise have no access to money, in order to start or grow a small business. These loans allow people to succeed in some of the poorest regions of the world, and help move towards breaking dependency on handouts. Here is a quick video explaining how Kiva works!

http://vimeo.com/16991128

Click on the "Gallery" Tab to read more about Kiva and the Fellows.

 

The Fellowship

My placement will be 3.5 months in the tourist hotspot of Kigali, Rwanda ;) 

I will be placed with the Urwego Opportunity Bank of Rwanda. I'll be working every day, full time towards:

  • Strengthening the relationship between the MFI (Urwego) and Kiva
  • Interviewing local borrowers to gauge the impact these loans have had on their lives
  • Promoting the impact and reach of Kiva through training on Kiva practices
  • Increasing transparency for lenders through the better use of technology and lender updates
  • Writing entries on the Kiva Fellows blog and spreading the word about Kiva!!

I have been fortunate enough to travel and volunteer in several places around the world, and each experience brought me compassion along with a sense of responsibility to help those in it. I recently spent two months with an NGO in Cambodia where I saw the hardships of  life with little governmental aid, and almost no access to loan money. It is easy to think that anyone can make a better life for themselves, but the reality is that millions of people don't stand a chance.

I have been hearing about the pros and cons of microfinance for the last few years but I think that the overall picture is clear: give people a chance. Micro finance institutions have been established in countries with little or no access to loans to do just that. A loan can, and often will, drastically change a persons life by giving them the opportunity to start a business, and in turn, transform communities. With a 98% + payback rate, it's obvious that microfinance is a viable option to help break the cycle of poverty.

 

Here's where you come in!!

The Kiva Fellow is an unpaid, volunteer based position designed to increase Kiva's impact.

Kiva is a non-profit organization, and they rely on fellows to act as their eyes and ears in the field. Hopefully, someday Kiva can employ (and pay) full time fellows around the world. But for now... I need some help.

I have worked out a budget of necessities: airfare to San Francisco for training, airfare to Rwanda, immunizations (!) and anti malarial pills, accommodations (with guard) for 3.5 months, utilities and internet access, transportation within Kigali, translators to interview borrowers, and basic living costs. On a very conservative estimate, I will need $7,500 for the 4 months.

If you would like to help sponsor my fellowship - please donate whatever you can!! I can't tell you how much any amount will be appreciated!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please send this on to anyone you think might be interested in helping out!  Another big help - keep in touch while I'm away! I will be far from home to say the least so email me, skype me, follow the Kiva fellows blog, whatever. Anything and everything will be greatly appreciated!!

THANK YOU for your support!!!

story:
What We Do

The Vision of City of Dreams is to end the generational poverty cycle in San Francisco's most challenged neighborhoods.  This vision is articulated by our youth and powered by our mission as members of their community: to help them build brighter futures through meaningful mentorship and youth development programming that includes taking them out on experiential learning events every Saturday of the year.  

In City of Dreams, we challenge young people to reach their highest potential through Experiential Learning. The events call for youth to solve problems, overcome fears, work as a team, try new things, explore creativity, embrace support, and identify their options. We offer challenge ropes courses, camping, museum visits, poetry slams, golfing, sailing, organic farming, skiing, rock climbing, and a self-esteem building camp. We also include Community Development Days as a way for our kids to learn to give back to the community.

We nurture adolescents’ emotional and social development by providing a curriculum of “12 Life Lessons" like love, hope, trust, accountability and responsibility. We support each youth by pairing them with an experienced, trained mentor. We prepare young people to become leaders through our Junior Mentor Program. We model teamwork by partnering with key neighborhood groups.

Above all, we inspire young people to face life with courage, joy, and commitment to building a better world.

What We Need

We need your help to provide 20 Saturdays experiential learning events to these youth!  Each Saturday costs on average $1000.00 to cover a healthy lunch and light breakfast, transportation, and program/entry fees for 20 youth.  

  • $10.00 covers just the nutritional needs (lucnch and light breakfast) of one youth on our next Saturday experiential learning event.
  • $20.00 covers the transportation costs of getting a youth from their nieighborhood to a Saturday experiential learning event.
  • $20.00 covers the entry or program fees for one youth's participation in a Saturday experiential learning event with the best youth experience providers that the Bay Area has to offer. 
  • $50.00 covers an entire Saturday experiential learning event for one youth.
  • $1000.00 covers an entire Saturday experiential learning event for a group of 20 youth. 

The Impact

Supporting the roses growing from concrete and helping them to plant rose gardens in their communities.  

City of Dreams goes beyond conventional youth development programs to give kids a real chance at becoming the best they can be. We know that kids from challenged neighborhoods need an extra leg up to get their lives on track, and we provide the right mix of innovation, support, and research-backed methods to make that happen.

Young people from San Francisco’s public housing communities start out with the odds stacked against them.

  1. Only 1 in 4 graduates high school.
  2. Many become pregnant. Teen births are twice San Francisco’s average.
  3. The leading cause of premature death is homicide.
  4. Exposure to gangs, drugs and violence is the norm.

Steep challenges like these call for big, bold answers, and City of Dreams provides them. We wrap time-tested approaches of experiential learning and mentorship into our unique, two-year curriculum of “12 Life Lessons”. We reinforce kids’ learning with journaling and discussion groups, and we make sure they retain newly gained skills and knowledge by repeating the 12 lessons. We make it fun and challenging, so kids stick with us.

Our goal is to expand kids’ perspectives and build their developmental assets. As a result, youth in City of Dreams make healthy choices and stay away from risky behaviors that keep them from achieving their full potential.

In City of Dreams, young people learn and discover by doing, and along the way they acquire a toolkit for solving problems, identifying dreams, setting goals, and resolving conflicts nonviolently. They leave our program as confident, positive young people who can think for themselves and contribute to their own lives and to their communities with practical skills and inspiration.

Other Ways You Can Help

Become a mentor: http://www.cityofdreams.org/what-we-do/mentoring/

story:
*****UPDATE 7/28 *****
THANK YOU SO MUCH TO EVERYONE WHO PARTICIPATED AND/OR CONTRIBUTED TO OUR EVENT.

NYC WORLD HEPATITIS DAY 2012 WAS A GREAT SUCCESS! WE HOPE TO RETURN NEXT YEAR BIGGER, BETTER, AND MORE POWERFUL THAN EVER. #LOVEYOURLIVER

WANT A T-SHIRT? DONATE $25 or VOLUNTEER: HERE

ATTN NYC: LOVE YOUR LIVER

Hi Everyone! Vicki and Andrew here -- we're New York City natives that want to help spread a message about protecting your liver, the largest internal organ in your body. Over 5 million Americans, including as many as 232,000 fellow New Yorkers, live with chronic hepatitis B or C. These are blood-borne viral infections that mainly target the liver. If left untreated, viral hepatitis can cause severe liver damage, scarring of the liver (cirrhosis), and can even lead to liver cancer.

But viral hepatitis can be treated, and serious liver damage can be prevented if infection is detected early. So we want to do our part to help spread awareness of this disease in NYC and encourage communities to get tested for hepatitis B and C.

NYC World Hepatitis Day 2012

This July 28th is World Hepatitis Day, as recognized by the World Health Organization. Along with organizations in countries all around the world, we want to celebrate this event in NYC and use it as an opportunity to bring more attention to this silent epidemic.

We're partnering with community organizations and local liver advocates to hold events all across NYC, in six languages and in all five boroughs, reaching into the communities most affected by hepatitis B and C.

And to highlight this global event, the World Hepatitis Alliance is attempting to set a Guinness World Record for the most number of people performing the "see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil" action in 24 hours at multiple venues around the world. We want one of those venues to include Union Square Park in Manhattan, a place where fellow New Yorkers and liver lovers can make a statement against hepatitis B and C.

But We Need FUNDING, & We Need SUPPORT:

Donations will help us fund the supplies and materials needed for this ambitious project.

This includes:

  • T-Shirts
  • Posters (in SIX languages!)
  • Fliers
  • Transportation
  • and other outreach materials..
But more importantly, we also need your support!
  • If you or anyone you know want to help us celebrate NYC World Hepatitis Day and help us reach into your community, please fill out this volunteer form.
     
  • If you represent a community organization that would like to help participate in our events, please email us at NYCWorldHepatitisDay@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate money or volunteer your services, help spread the word about NYC World Hepatitis Day 2012!

    http://www.facebook.com/NYCWorldHepDay

Thanks for all the support! And Remember, Love Your Liver!
story_txt:
*****UPDATE 7/28 *****THANK YOU SO MUCH TO EVERYONE WHO PARTICIPATED AND/OR CONTRIBUTED TO OUR EVENT.NYC WORLD HEPATITIS DAY 2012 WAS A GREAT SUCCESS! WE HOPE TO RETURN NEXT YEAR BIGGER, BETTER, AND MORE POWERFUL THAN EVER. #LOVEYOURLIVER

WANT A T-SHIRT? DONATE $25 or VOLUNTEER: HERE


ATTN NYC: LOVE YOUR LIVER
Hi Everyone! Vicki and Andrew here -- we're New York City natives that want to help spread a message about protecting your liver, the largest internal organ in your body. Over 5 million Americans, including as many as 232,000 fellow New Yorkers, live with chronic hepatitis B or C. These are blood-borne viral infections that mainly target the liver. If left untreated, viral hepatitis can cause severe liver damage, scarring of the liver (cirrhosis), and can even lead to liver cancer.
But viral hepatitis can be treated, and serious liver damage can be prevented if infection is detected early. So we want to do our part to help spread awareness of this disease in NYC and encourage communities to get tested for hepatitis B and C.
NYC World Hepatitis Day 2012
This July 28th is World Hepatitis Day, as recognized by the World Health Organization. Along with organizations in countries all around the world, we want to celebrate this event in NYC and use it as an opportunity to bring more attention to this silent epidemic.
We're partnering with community organizations and local liver advocates to hold events all across NYC, in six languages and in all five boroughs, reaching into the communities most affected by hepatitis B and C.



And to highlight this global event, the World Hepatitis Alliance is attempting to set a Guinness World Record for the most number of people performing the "see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil" action in 24 hours at multiple venues around the world. We want one of those venues to include Union Square Park in Manhattan, a place where fellow New Yorkers and liver lovers can make a statement against hepatitis B and C.
But We Need FUNDING, & We Need SUPPORT:
Donations will help us fund the supplies and materials needed for this ambitious project.
This includes:

T-Shirts
Posters (in SIX languages!)
Fliers
Transportation
and other outreach materials..

But more importantly, we also need your support!

If you or anyone you know want to help us celebrate NYC World Hepatitis Day and help us reach into your community, please fill out this volunteer form. 
If you represent a community organization that would like to help participate in our events, please email us at NYCWorldHepatitisDay@gmail.com




Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't donate money or volunteer your services, help spread the word about NYC World Hepatitis Day 2012!

Like our page on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/NYCWorldHepDay

Follow our updates on Twitter:https://twitter.com/#!/NYCWorldHepDay

Share our Indiegogo campaign!http://www.indiegogo.com/NYCWorldHepDay 


Thanks for all the support! And Remember, Love Your Liver!

story:
Our Story

My vision is of a world where each individual is able to listen effectively, articulate clearly, and be open to receiving their needs and the needs of others without judgment, criticism, or blame; but with love, compassion, and kindness.  What a wonderful world it will be when we all can listen to one another, clearly articulate our need, and be open to receiving what we request.  What would happen if our world leaders came together and practiced compassionate communication?  What a different world this would be.  I’m holding the vision of World Peace in My Lifetime.  Let there be Peace on Earth and let it begin with me.  We each must do our part.  Be Peace! 

 

The Impact

My strong desire to support others in understanding the benefits of Compassionate Communication (NVC), is leading me to participate in the Power-With Leader Development Program.  PWLDP is a yearlong program designed for businesses and Non-Profit organizations to help develop a unified connection and support of Compassionate Communication on all levels.   Thank you for your generosity.

Namaste’  Rev. Yvonne McAndrew

For more information or details go to http://www.basileia.org/PLDPoverview

 

What We Need & What You Get

What the world needs now is love sweet love… is a line from an old song, and yet it still rings true.  Are you willing to be an advocate for bringing peace, harmony, and love into the world through Compassionate Communication? 

 

The funds I receive through this campaign will go to support this specialized PWLDP training.  When my training is complete, I will be offering Compassionate Communication Workshops to help further spread the message and engage those who are willing ‘to be the change’.  Each person who engages in Compassionate Communication creates a positive ripple effect upon those they interact with and the ripple expands…

Changing the world one person (ripple) at a time.  

 

12 month Power-With Leader Development Program $4500

 

Donors to my campaign will be offered a special Contributors rate to my Compassionate Communication Workshops. 

 

Thank you again for your generous support. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help me reach my goal by sharing this page with others in the NVC community, BePeace, Unity, your friends, family, or any organization that is passionate about Peace and creating better relationships across the board.  Thanks for holding the vision of World Peace with me and for sharing this message across all avenues.  Blessings and Be Peace : )   Rev. Yvonne McAndrew

story:
Asking For Support

I would like to ask your support in raising $1,600 by Nov 30th, 2012 so that I can complete the powerful Gratitude Masterful Living training. 

I am committed to making a difference with my life and would like to ask for your support so that I can finishing this amazing training and make my dreams come true!!

If you have ever considered supporting me or gifting me anything in my life, please consider this your opportunity. You will truly have a hand in changing the course of my life.

What is Gratitude All About

http://www.gratitudetraining.com/

Gratitude training is a powerful, experiential course in personal transformation. Superhero Training, giving participants the tools they need to make thier dreams come true. 

I have already completed and paid for parts 1 and 2 of the training. In Part 1, I learned a new transformational vocabulary to use in my life and had an opportunity to deeply examine my core beliefs, shift my perspective and see where I have been limiting myself in life, relationships and vision.  

In Part 2, I took that new vocabulary and vision and broke apart the box of my own limiting beliefs to get rid of the blockages that have kept me from shining in my life.  It was done together with a group of 37 connected souls who have become like my family through this transformation. 

Now my group is about to embarking on the final and most powerful part of the training called Masterful Living (ML10). In ML10 we will use all of the amazing transformative tools and self knowledge combined with the power of team to actually make my dreams a reality. Literally. This is where I will really take flight and over the course of 3 months I will articulate and actually create tangible results on the road to reaching my dreams.

Other Means of Support

I FEEL SOOO GOOD and am very EXCITED! Life is too short, life is now so I am asking my loved ones for support. If you can help, now is the time. 

Anything you can contribute will help. Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help by passing on the word to friends or family you think may be willing to support me in this. 

Love. 

Alf

story:
Important Note: following the input from several of you, we had to restart the campaign, setting it in US Dollars to make possible to people to donate even if they do NOT have a PayPal account. But what was already donated in Euros is NOT lost. For correctness and to keep things clear, the old campaign in Euros is here. For donations, please use the new campaign in USD above. Thank you for pointing this out.


Short Summary

Since 2006, the Virtual Telescope Project showed the wonders of the Universe to more than 6 millions of individuals, from more than 230 Countries. All this for free.

Without any institutional funding, our project is the leading one on the international stage as for astronomical public outreach. Our reputation and reliability are legendary, as well as our love for the Cosmos and our endless passion in bringing it, live, to the world.

After eight years of passionate work, we would love to increase both our public and scientific activities, acquiring a new imaging device, making possible for us to fully exploit the capabilities of our robotic telescopes. 

To cover the expensive costs of such a device, we need your help. As we said, our internationally, highly recognized project has NO funding so without your contribution we would never succeed reaching such a important goal.

Help the Virtual Telescope Project acquiring a very advanced CCD imaging device, this way increasing both the scientific and public outreach return. 

Our 8 years of history and facts are out there, publicly available, making the Virtual Telescope Project well worth of both your trust and support 

What We Need

To reach our goal and greatly enhance the capabilities of the Virtual Telescope we need:

  • An very high sensitivity CCD imaging camera, with a back-illuminated and large field-of-view  chip;
  • An adequate filter wheel, hosting all the filters needed to make the system complete,
  • A set of astronomical filters;
  • An auto-guiding device, to be coupled with the system to assure perfectly tracked long exposures;
  • All the hardware needed to properly use the devices above.

The Impact

With the instruments listed above, the imaging performances of the Virtual Telescope would be greatly improved. We estimate we will reach stars more than two times fainter than the ones we reach now, with an amazing scientific return.

Also, these greatly improved performance would make even more amazing the experience of our live viewers, as they would receive much better and spectacular images.

Considering the unprecedented, stunning job done so far by the Virtual Telescope, highly respected by the international community, it is easy to imagine the revolutionary impact of the improvement we would love to do with your help.

Our reputation is out there to assure that your support will really provide the promised improvements and benefits to the community. We are one of those very few cases where reputation is built above facts and results and not on mere promises. What we did for the star lovers of this planet exceeded a lot what we promised and we are ready to do the same, once again.

Risks & Challenges

We want to reach our goal, for this we need your help. We are used to challenges. The Virtual Telescope Project, because of the lack of funding, has been itself a challenge. But history says it is today one of the most important facilities of its kind in the world, Guess what we can do with your help. Make this dream real, support of campaign.


If the full amount requested here will not be fulfilled,  we will arrange a different choice of the instruments, getting the most for the money anyway. But we will do our best to convince you this project is worth your support. We heartily believe we deserve your trust and we will honor it, as done daily since 2006.

If the funds will not be enough to buy any CCD camera better than the one currently used, we will invest the donations to support our activities anyway.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help a lot:

  • Help getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
GLOBE (Global Loan Opportunities for Budding Entrepreneurs) 

is a student-managed academic program at St. John’s University that provides microloans to entrepreneurs in the developing areas of the world. Students are able to learn about microfinance while simultaneously helping people help themselves and their families out of poverty. 

Founded in Spring 2009, GLOBE is celebrating five years of success. They have provided 48 loans to 76 borrowers, some of them group loans, and are operating in on three continents in five countries that include Kenya, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Nigeria, Nicaragua and Vietnam. The Daughters of Charity act as GLOBE field partners and recommend loan candidates, distribute funds, and help collect loan repayments from the entrepreneurs in their communities. 

About 87 percent of these entrepreneurs are women whose profits allow them to support their families and educate their children. GLOBE runs strictly on donations and at least 95 cents of every dollar donated goes directly to helping one of their borrowers or supporting student field work. The program is hoping to expand its presence in the developing world and currently has 16 new loan applications awaiting approval. 

The participating students have been working diligently, and at the end of the semester, GLOBE will have graduated a total of 237 students, each of whom leaves the program more knowledgeable about the world of microfinance and social entrepreneurship.

story:
Stretch Goal!

Jhai Tribe, we have reached our first goal of $3,000! THANK YOU!

Our new 'Stretch Goal' is $4,750!

If we reach our stretch goal, Jhai can build the 6th clean water well that would be installed at Paksong Primary School! 

The cement school was built in 1994. It has no toilets, no water well, and 30% of children are getting sick throughout the year because of the hygiene crisis. 

Currently, there are 197 children and 8 teachers who wash their hands at a very dirty lake (sewage runoff) 200 meters from their school. They urinate and defecate nearby. This is the worst school sickness rate Jhai has seen in the 18 schools we've visited. Paksong Primary School has never had any hygiene education before Jhai's WASH program this year.

Also, since we hit our goal, we have added a new $50 donation perk to get your NAME ENGRAVED + PICS!

_______________________________________________________________________


Help Jhai Build a Clean Water Well in Phou Dam Kwon Village!


These 202 children, who attend primary and secondary school in Phou Dam Kwon village, do not have access to clean water to wash their hands or collect drinking water.

The Problem

During the Vietnam War, the U.S. dropped an average of one planeload of bombs on Laos every eight minutes, 24 hours a day, for nine straight years, totaling $47 billion. Due to the focus on rebuilding city infrastructure before rural areas, Laos has both a hygiene and water crisis, resulting in diarrhea being the #2 killer of Lao children under the age of five.


The Solution

Jhai Coffee House is the world’s first completely philanthropic coffee roaster and café located at the source. Jhai educates farmers on specialty growing practices, purchases coffee direct, above Fair Trade prices, and invests 100% of net profits into water and hygiene solutions at schoolhouses within the community.

In 2013-14, partnerships with the Lao Government, JCFC and private water filter company, Terra Clear, enabled Jhai to serve 18 schools, totaling 2,678 children. These schools now have water purification filters and have completed Jhai’s hygiene (WASH) program. Jhai also installed four Unicef-manufactured clean water pumps at schools that previously had no access. 

("Jhai Mural" on the cafe wall, illustrated by Sarah Steenland)


The Collaboration

(Photo taken at MisfitCon 2014 by C.C. Chapman)

Tyson Adams, Founder of Jhai, has been living between Laos and Seattle these past five years running operations and projects. Tyson built Jhai on his belief that CLEAN WATER IS A HUMAN RIGHT, not a privilege. 

In a few days, Berni Xiong will join the Jhai Team in Laos to help complete the mission of drilling a clean water well in Phou Dam Kwon village!

My name is Berni and my family fled Laos during the Vietnam War.

I was born nine months after they arrived in America. I've been curious my entire life about how different things might be had my family not made it out of Laos. Would I have even been born? And, if so, what would life look like as a Laotian citizen?

It’s no surprise, that growing up in America all my life, I’ve felt incomplete for a very long time. Disconnected from my native heritage and never truly feeling like I fit in. Since I was a very young age, I’ve yearned to make sense of my purpose in the world. Why did my family make it? How come others didn't choose to leave or couldn't? 

I vowed one day I would return to my family’s homeland and make a positive impact in the world. Only I didn't have a clear vision of how I would do that. I just knew in my heart that some day the opportunity would reveal itself to me.

Today, it has. 

By supporting this campaign, you will help me make my lifelong dream come true and, collectively, we will help change the lives of these Laotian children and families--people who could very well have been my family and me.


The Lowdown

Your donation will help us raise $3,000, which will go towards:

  • Building a clean water well in Phou Dam Kwon village ($1,750)
  • Travel and admin costs in Laos ($1,055)
  • Indiegogo fees ($195)
There are three ways you can contribute:

  • Email this page (send a personal message to 4 to 5 friends or family members who you think would be interested in this campaign)
  • Share this page (post a link to this page via Twitter, Facebook, G+, etc.)
  • Donate what you can (there is no amount too great or small)
*Use this campaign short link: http://igg.me/at/jhai2014

    The Rewards

    LIVE STREAM - ALL PERK LEVELS

    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: We decided to open up the live stream experience for every contributor who donates to the campaign regardless of perk level. We were unable to edit the perk details in the side widgets. However, we will email every contributor when we schedule the live stream. 

    We purchased a wireless internet router (The BRCK), which allows us to take a cell phone SIM card and plug it into this device to get WiFi in remote areas. This will allow us to live stream the drilling and water pump opening ceremony for you to watch back home! We hope to manage this through Ustream TV so you can ask us questions via chat.

    Contingency plan: If cell service is spotty in Phou Dam Kwon, we will do the video conference at the cafe. At that time, you will get a virtual tour of Jhai and meet some local kids benefiting from our hygiene programs.


    BERNI'S BRAVE BEAR BOOK - $11

    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: *Live Stream Included*


    JHAI COFFEE - $34 SORRY SOLD OUT!

    We will email you to ask for your roaster preference (light, medium or dark) and also your grind preference (whole bean or ground). We will mail your coffee to your specified shipping address.

    • Grind: Whole Bean or ground
    • Notes: Floral, Honey, Blackberry, Grapefruit & Brown Sugar
    • Region: Bolaven Plateau, Paksong, Laos
    • Varietal: Arabica Typica
    • Grade: SCAA (specialty) 
    • Responsible: Direct Trade (beyond fair trade)
    • Roastmaster: Jackie Thao

    *Brave Bear Book Included*

    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: *Live Stream Included*


    JHAI COFFEE - $39 *NEW*

    SORRY SOLD OUT!

    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: Added new perk for all you coffee lovers! We will email you to ask for your roaster preference (light, medium or dark) and also your grind preference (whole bean or ground). We will mail your coffee to your specified shipping address.
    • Grind: Whole Bean or ground
    • Notes: Floral, Honey, Blackberry, Grapefruit & Brown Sugar
    • Region: Bolaven Plateau, Paksong, Laos
    • Varietal: Arabica Typica
    • Grade: SCAA (specialty) 
    • Responsible: Direct Trade (beyond fair trade)
    • Roastmaster: Jackie Thao
    *Brave Bear Book Included*
    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: *Live Stream Included*


    YOUR NAME ENGRAVED + PICS - $50

    SORRY SOLD OUT!

    We will engrave your name in the cement and will email you pictures, which include a close-up of your name and the entire project from start to finish!

    *Brave Bear Book Included*
    *One Pound Of Jhai Coffee Optional*

    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: *Live Stream Included*


    YOUR NAME ENGRAVED + PICS - $50 *NEW*

    Updated Oct. 3rd 1:00pm CST: We will engrave your name in the cement and will email you pictures, which include a close-up of your name and the entire project from start to finish!

    *Brave Bear Book Included*
    *One Pound Of Jhai Coffee Optional*
    *Live Stream Included*



    NO BRAINER VIDEO CALL - $74

    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: Tyson and Berni will conduct a private video call with you from the cafe. You will get an opportunity to ask any questions and take a virtual tour of Jhai.

    *Brave Bear Book Included*
    *Name Engraved Included*
    *One Pound Of Jhai Coffee Optional*
    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: *Live Stream Included*


    PURE DONATION LOVE - $100

    This perk level is purely a donation and you can give whatever amount you want: $100, 200...500!  

    *Brave Bear Book Included*
    *Name Engraved Included*
    *No Brainer Live Stream Included*
     *Coffee NOT included*
    Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: *Live Stream Included*


      Jhai judges its success each year not by the amount of money earned but by the number of children who have access to clean water and hygiene education.

      - Tyson Adams, Founder of Jhai Coffee House

They urinate and defecate nearby. This is the worst school sickness rate Jhai has seen in the 18 schools we've visited. Paksong Primary School has never had any hygiene education before Jhai's WASH program this year.



Also, since we hit our goal, we have added a new $50 donation perk to get your NAME ENGRAVED + PICS!
_______________________________________________________________________

Help Jhai Build a Clean Water Well in Phou Dam Kwon Village!

These 202 children, who attend primary and secondary school in Phou Dam Kwon village, do not have access to clean water to wash their hands or collect drinking water.






The Problem


During the Vietnam War, the U.S. dropped an average of one planeload of bombs on Laos every eight minutes, 24 hours a day, for nine straight years, totaling $47 billion. Due to the focus on rebuilding city infrastructure before rural areas, Laos has both a hygiene and water crisis, resulting in diarrhea being the #2 killer of Lao children under the age of five.



The Solution




Jhai Coffee House is the world’s first completely philanthropic coffee roaster and café located at the source. Jhai educates farmers on specialty growing practices, purchases coffee direct, above Fair Trade prices, and invests 100% of net profits into water and hygiene solutions at schoolhouses within the community.In 2013-14, partnerships with the Lao Government, JCFC and private water filter company, Terra Clear, enabled Jhai to serve 18 schools, totaling 2,678 children. These schools now have water purification filters and have completed Jhai’s hygiene (WASH) program. Jhai also installed four Unicef-manufactured clean water pumps at schools that previously had no access. 


("Jhai Mural" on the cafe wall, illustrated by Sarah Steenland)

The Collaboration

(Photo taken at MisfitCon 2014 by C.C. Chapman)

Tyson Adams, Founder of Jhai, has been living between Laos and Seattle these past five years running operations and projects. Tyson built Jhai on his belief that CLEAN WATER IS A HUMAN RIGHT, not a privilege. In a few days, Berni Xiong will join the Jhai Team in Laos to help complete the mission of drilling a clean water well in Phou Dam Kwon village!
My name is Berni and my family fled Laos during the Vietnam War.

I was born nine months after they arrived in America. I've been curious my entire life about how different things might be had my family not made it out of Laos. Would I have even been born? And, if so, what would life look like as a Laotian citizen?




It’s no surprise, that growing up in America all my life, I’ve felt incomplete for a very long time. Disconnected from my native heritage and never truly feeling like I fit in. Since I was a very young age, I’ve yearned to make sense of my purpose in the world. Why did my family make it? How come others didn't choose to leave or couldn't? 


I vowed one day I would return to my family’s homeland and make a positive impact in the world. Only I didn't have a clear vision of how I would do that. I just knew in my heart that some day the opportunity would reveal itself to me.
Today, it has. 
By supporting this campaign, you will help me make my lifelong dream come true and, collectively, we will help change the lives of these Laotian children and families--people who could very well have been my family and me.
The Lowdown
Your donation will help us raise $3,000, which will go towards:

Building a clean water well in Phou Dam Kwon village ($1,750)

Travel and admin costs in Laos ($1,055)

Indiegogo fees ($195)
There are three ways you can contribute:



Email this page (send a personal message to 4 to 5 friends or family members who you think would be interested in this campaign)

Share this page (post a link to this page via Twitter, Facebook, G+, etc.)

Donate what you can (there is no amount too great or small)

*Use this campaign short link: http://igg.me/at/jhai2014




The Rewards

LIVE STREAM - ALL PERK LEVELS
Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: We decided to open up the live stream experience for every contributor who donates to the campaign regardless of perk level. We were unable to edit the perk details in the side widgets. However, we will email every contributor when we schedule the live stream. 
We purchased a wireless internet router (The BRCK), which allows us to take a cell phone SIM card and plug it into this device to get WiFi in remote areas. This will allow us to live stream the drilling and water pump opening ceremony for you to watch back home! We hope to manage this through Ustream TV so you can ask us questions via chat.
Contingency plan: If cell service is spotty in Phou Dam Kwon, we will do the video conference at the cafe. At that time, you will get a virtual tour of Jhai and meet some local kids benefiting from our hygiene programs.



BERNI'S BRAVE BEAR BOOK - $11

Updated Oct. 1st 7:30pm CST: *Live Stream Included*






JHAI COFFEE - $34 SORRY SOLD OUT!
We will email you to ask for your roaster preference (light, medium or dark) and also your grind preference (whole bean or ground). We will mail your coffee to your specified shipping address.

JHAI COFFEE - $39 *NEW*SORRY SOLD OUT!

Jhai judges its success each year not by the amount of money earned but by the number of children who have access to clean water and hygiene education.
- Tyson Adams, Founder of Jhai Coffee House

story:
Hello!

My name is Caty Brownstone-Stillwell and I'm a second grade teacher at Belding Elementary School in Chicago, Illinois. I have taught in Chicago Public Schools for ten years.

Every year the school year gets longer and longer causing the the kids to be in school during very hot weather. My school is well over one hundred years old and is not air conditioned or even well equipped to circulate cool air via windows and fans. The classroom temperature can soar into the high 90s during the final months of the school year. It's hard for the kids to to concentrate when they are miserable from the heat and even harder still for me to teach in the same conditions.

The goal of my project is to raise enough money to equip my classroom with two air conditioners that will cool the room and make teaching and learning so much easier during those sweltering days. Any excess funds will go towards helping other teachers in my school also outfit their classrooms with air conditioners. 

I'm asking for $1200 which is the cost of purchasing two 15,000 BTU air conditioners for my classroom. The relief this will bring to the us during those hot months will have a great impact on learning & teaching. Should I not receive full funding for the AC units I will put the money towards a fund that will hopefully grow in the future to purchase what is needed. 

Your contribution will make a great difference in our classroom! If you are not able to contribute monetarily please spread the word and help us keep our classroom cool!

story:
Why I Want To #RunSF4YSF

This July, I will have the pleasure to run the San Francisco Marathon on behalf of one of the best charities in Los Angeles / New York, which promotes and supports the arts through storytelling and visual arts. 

Here's The Scoop...

After a group of film students discovered Los Angeles schools cutting their creative arts in the curriculum, they created a volunteer-based program that's, literally, priceless. The Young Storytellers Foundation prides itself on developing literacy through the art of storytelling and visual arts by one-on-one mentoring to under-served children in Los Angeles/New York.

 With an emphasis on oral storytelling, writing, and game play, YSF pairs each student to an industry professional in their Script-to-Stage program. In Script-to-Stage students are advised as they develop their own short script. At the end of the program, each student watches their writing come to life as Hollywood actors/actresses perform their scripts at an in-school assembly, which they call, "The Big Show".  

What We Need & What You Are Providing

By donating, you'll be providing:

  • Recruitment, train, and screen an entertainment industry volunteer
  • Train a Head Mentor in the YSF innovative curriculum
  • A Scholarship to the Script-to-Stage program, where their idea will become a finished script
  • Notebooks, pens, and, we can't forget, the red carpet
  • The Big Show, which is brought to you, and by you

For More Information

Please go to http://www.youngstorytellers.com/

And to track my training and my trek to San Francisco, follow the hashtag #RunSF4YSF

story:
Short Summary

My name is Andrea and I am a proud, devoted mother of a beautiful young lady. I am here to present a fund raising campaign for my daughter Keirsten, 20 years old. Keirsten attends Paul Mitchell the School in Charlotte, NC. The purpose of the campaign is to raise funds that are needed for Keirsten's educational trip to Las Vegas in February 2015, to attend Caper. 

Keirsten has been in love with all aspects of cosmetology since she was young. Many of her dolls ended up with hair cuts and new make-up made of magic markers. She is super excited to be making her long time dream a reality in one of the best schools on the planet. 

Caper, the Paul Mitchell conference held annually in Las Vegas, is a cosmetology student's dream. There will be classes taught by world famous stylist, competitions, products to sample, and unlimited networking opportunities. All in all, it is a 3 day experience that would take her years to realize otherwise. 

As a devoted mother, I am determined to make sure that my daughter can experience many opportunities and help her accomplish her goals towards becoming a strong, independent, successful woman. In this particular case, there are funds that are required to make this happen and unfortunately, being a single parent of a college student makes that difficult. I humbly reach out to you for any assistance towards Keirsten's educational trip. I appreciate you taking the time to read and consider my daughter's campaign. 


What We Need & What You Get

The funds needed for Keirsten's trip are $2000. These funds will go towards admittance to the conference, airfare,  hotel, and meals. We also plan to pursue other avenues of raising funds such as selling candy and a bake sale. We are proud to offer some amazing perks, Paul Mitchell style (pun intended). 

Don't actions in the following increments will receive a goody bag with Paul Mitchell products, a personal note from Keirsten explaining how your donation helped, and a little bit of love. Everyone could use more love. 

$20 two products

$35 three products

$50 three products and a hairstyling tool. 

Goody bags can be for women or men.

The Impact

Where to begin? The networking opportunities alone could be life changing. Classes taught not only by knowledgeable teachers, but by gods of the styling world!  The impact this conference could have on my daughter's future career is the thing that dreams are made of. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that bot everyone has the ability to donate. Any and all support is welcome.  So spread the word! Social media is one of the most powerful tools around to get noticed.

story:
Hi there!

My name is Dianna, and I am the Director of the Chicago Urban Art Retreat Center, in Chicago. CUARC is an established Not-for-Profit that uses art to bridge and embrace cultural differences, support underserved communities with creative training and workshops, hosts art exhibits, and offer various artistic programs. But while CUARC has been a constant fixture in Chicago's North Lawndale community, unfortunately, so have many vacant lots. We think it's time to change the landscape of the North Lawndale community and other communities we love for the better, and would love your support!

The Peace Parks Project will embark on a mission to transform vacant lots in Chicago's North Lawndale community, into walk-thru art gardens and havens for peace. We'll create up to two peace sculptures and murals per park, as well as, plant foliage, create walkways, and more. Overall, the Peace Parks Project will not only beautify, revitalize and help restore North Lawndale, but will also create a place of playfulness, reflection and exposure to great art!

To make it happen, we'll have all hands on deck, and will be working with volunteers from CityYear youth from around the country, Chicago Cares, the overall community and hopefully, YOU too! Your much needed support, will be key to helping us get the supplies we need to move forward and bring this great project to fruition! Check out our Perks to see how you can help build a park and make a lasting impact!

For more information on CUARC, or other ways to get involved
visit us online at: www.urbanartretreat.com.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach $9000 which will be used to secure the supplies needed to build approximately 6-7 Peace Parks around the community. Here's a breakdown on some of the supplies we'll be using:

  • concrete and concrete mixers
  • plywood
  • two by fours of wood
  • foliage (trees, bushes, sod, plants and etc.)
  • walkway pavers and bricks
  • paint and painting supplies

By helping us get there, we'll be ditching out some pretty cool perks from shout-outs on our website and Facebook page, to walkway pavers in your or a loved one's name, to even getting a tree donated in your name or the name of someone you love!

The What Ifs?:

While we certainly hope that we'll meet our goal, if for some reason we don't, we'll maximize the use of the funds by building as many Peace Parks as we can with the funds received.

If we exceed our goal, we'll keep pushing forward to acquire more vacant lots and build more parks! We'll also use additional funding to increase some of CUARC's community programs!

The Impact

This campaign is about more than building parks. It's about building trust, community and peace. And it's also about giving children an outlet to play, to be free-spirited and to enjoy the greatest asset of all... their youth.

Is this going to be hard work? Yes. But more important, it's going to be our collective voices and efforts in investing in the community in a positive and impactful way.

One of our greatest hopes is that The Peace Parks Project will start at one block, then one neighborhood, to one city and eventually to other cities across the nation. But it all starts right here- with us and, hopefully, with you!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We could use as much help as we can. Please get the word out and make some noise about The Peace Parks Project campaign!
  • You can also share this campaign with Indiegogo's share tools!
  • Also, if you live in or plan to visit Chicago, contact us if you'd like to participate in building any of the parks. We'd love to have you join us!

story:
Who WE are:

We are a group of Hampton High school students in a grade ten technology class who were presented with an opportunity to create an online campaign to raise money to aid CHAT with the next step towards their charity. We are compassionate about this project because it is all about kids helping kids. All of our campaign work is done by us students, and every cent goes towards helping the kids in Uganda.

What CHAT is:

“CHAT” is a fully registered Canadian national charity that links over 40 schools across North America to a small orphanage in Uganda. Students from these schools work to fully fund the living and learning needs of these distant
peers. Students help to own and operate the small home of orphans in Kampala, Uganda. 100% of money raised by the schools goes directly towards supporting the cause in Uganda. They look over the annual budget, find solutions to occurring problems, fund everything from rent to school fees, and strive towards a goal of long term sustainability. The money also goes towards a certified live-in teacher to help the kids in Uganda with things such as homework, tutoring, and household tasks.

To make the kids feel more connected, at least twice a year per school, a Skype session is held between the kids here and in Uganda. They sing songs and dance, and follow up with questions for each other. The emotional Skype sessions are a huge part of the “CHAT” organization.

About 27% of all rural people in Uganda are still living below the national poverty line; less than $1.25 per day. This is almost 8 million men, women and children. The areas affected the most by rural poverty are located in the north of Uganda; poverty rates that vary above 40 per cent and exceeds 60 per cent in many districts. A lot of Uganda’s poor rural people live in fragile, dry and sub-humid regions, where the variability of rainfall and soil fertility cause problems when farming. Uganda is considered one of the world's most vulnerable and least climate-resilient countries. Droughts, floods, and variable precipitation cycles have a serious impact upon water, agricultural production, and rural livelihoods.

Our specific goal is to fully fund the logistic costs (flights) of sending the Executive and Deputy Executive Directors of CHAT over to Uganda to complete the registration process of their charity. This organization is at a standstill because of the complications with having enough money to travel to Uganda. We are striving to raise the required amount to send these extraordinary individuals over to help change the lives for more of these disadvantaged kids.

They need to get over, to one day construct a building to house kids in a safe area of Uganda, keeping children out of poverty, and aiding with their education. But first they need to get there. Your donations will help change the lives of these children.
