story:
Who We Are?

WE are the strangers, we at Blessed Be Baskets-Charity will forever reach out and put smiles on faces of people just asking for a little support, not to look down on, but be lifted up and guided to be part of working community again. Corporations and good people of the heart are the ones who are reaching out with us on this journey. If you have a child in your life? You will understand this statement-

Nothing Compares to the Smile on a Child's Face- 

At aChurch that we work in conjunction with, I met a gorgeous little girl of 11 years old, who was so excited to have toast with butter. She was amazed that there was butter at the tables, and was so anxious I could not help but say Hi to her. She told me the last time her brother and parents had bread was over seven months ago.

Alarming? we thought so too. I took special interest with the parents approval to take her and her little brother to the part of the Kitchen that had all the deserts and they both made sundaes with cakes, whipped cream, and even nuts and cherries on top. The last time, either of them had anything remotely close to something sweet; like a cookie was she said "ages ago" her mom sadly told me it was on her 11th birthday she had one cookie and a bottle of water. It took a lot for me to hold back the tears on hearing that.

Afterwards we took their information, and along with the food kitchen at the Church we are visiting them, making them feel like people, loved, and will continue efforts like all the other families to do what we can to feed them. Let a child have toast with butter all the time, not once in a time.

Why are we seeking so much?

Out Goal is to feed as many families as we possibly can every day, until we have completely exhausted 90% of all funds raised. The 10% will cover gas to deliver all these groceries directly to the families. We are also hosting a BBQ for children and families to come together in one larger family of poverty stricken families and enjoy life with no worries of being hungry. This money will cover food for a family of 5 for several months, to give you an example. No concerns for several months about out basic needs food and water. Children will receive clothes, shoes, diapers if needed. We seek to help others be proud of themselves so they can be productive members of our world communities. 

*** The Perks***

Huge Smiles, Endless Thanks You's, A deep rooted feeling knowing that your contribution fed a child and offered goodies like cookies too!
story_txt:
Who We Are?
WE are the strangers, we at Blessed Be Baskets-Charity will forever reach out and put smiles on faces of people just asking for a little support, not to look down on, but be lifted up and guided to be part of working community again. Corporations and good people of the heart are the ones who are reaching out with us on this journey. If you have a child in your life? You will understand this statement-
Nothing Compares to the Smile on a Child's Face- 


At aChurch that we work in conjunction with, I met a gorgeous little girl of 11 years old, who was so excited to have toast with butter. She was amazed that there was butter at the tables, and was so anxious I could not help but say Hi to her. She told me the last time her brother and parents had bread was over seven months ago. 
Alarming? we thought so too. I took special interest with the parents approval to take her and her little brother to the part of the Kitchen that had all the deserts and they both made sundaes with cakes, whipped cream, and even nuts and cherries on top. The last time, either of them had anything remotely close to something sweet; like a cookie was she said "ages ago" her mom sadly told me it was on her 11th birthday she had one cookie and a bottle of water. It took a lot for me to hold back the tears on hearing that.
 Afterwards we took their information, and along with the food kitchen at the Church we are visiting them, making them feel like people, loved, and will continue efforts like all the other families to do what we can to feed them. Let a child have toast with butter all the time, not once in a time.
Why are we seeking so much?
Out Goal is to feed as many families as we possibly can every day, until we have completely exhausted 90% of all funds raised. The 10% will cover gas to deliver all these groceries directly to the families. We are also hosting a BBQ for children and families to come together in one larger family of poverty stricken families and enjoy life with no worries of being hungry. This money will cover food for a family of 5 for several months, to give you an example. No concerns for several months about out basic needs food and water. Children will receive clothes, shoes, diapers if needed. We seek to help others be proud of themselves so they can be productive members of our world communities. 
*** The Perks***
Huge Smiles, Endless Thanks You's, A deep rooted feeling knowing that your contribution fed a child and offered goodies like cookies too!

story:
About Us

Our names are Peyton and Anthony. We are both seventeen and are currently seniors in high school. As part of our senior year curriculum, all students dedicate themselves to a community-based service project. Our project is the funding of a temporary medical clinic that will be located in Tamil Nadu, India. This clinic will serve hundreds of people who live in the surrounding villages, and will offer basic medical care as well as cataract surgeries that can cure those who have gone blind from the sun. 

Why Donate?

We have managed to fund the clinic itself already- but we need YOUR help in raising the money to travel there. The organization we are working with, LoveManifest, has arranged a trip for the upcoming February, and if we are to attend this trip in order to work in the medical clinic that we have helped create, we need the funds to cover our travel expenses. For this reason, we have set our fundraising goal at $6,000 USD.

We Need You!

Every donation helps. We are not adults trying to scam you- this is a legitimate effort we are making to help better lives across the globe, but we need your assistance to do it! If you would like, feel free to visit our project webpage (the donate link there is NOT for our travel expenses, which we are promoting here, but for the clinic itself- don't get confused!) And if you have any specific questions regarding our project, please feel free to contact us through the information below. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider our cause! We hope that you decide to join us in our efforts to complete this journey. And remember, even the smallest donation helps!

Peyton Smith    &    Anthony Del Secco

psmith14@cardinalnewman.org       adelsecco14@cardinalnewman.org

story:
About Us

The Green Mountain Druid Order (the GMDO) is a contemporary Mystery School and community in the Green Mountains of Vermont. Rooted in ancient wisdom, our Order was created in these times of great change with the intent of training a growing number of empowered stewards of the Earth. We align ourselves with the spirit of Gaia in order to heal, teach, and make a real difference in the world.

The GMDO was created in 2006 by Ivan McBeth and Fearn Lickfield, who administer the Green Mountain School of Druidry which offers regular trainings at Dreamland in Worcester, Vermont, USA and around the world by correspondence.

Our community is active and ever expanding. We gather regularly for Grove meetings, an annual Eisteddfod, public seasonal ceremonies, a 5-day Druid Camp, ecstatic dances and related workshops by other amazing teachers in the magical field. We are also excited to be hosting workshops in Permaculture as a practical extension of our commitment to serving the health of the land. 

Dreamland, the home of the Green Mountain School of Druidry, is a blossoming spiritual center, an Earth Mysteries School, a working homestead practicing sustainable living and land healing and a destination for those searching for community and deep spiritual connection with the Earth.

About Our Project

We need $21,000 to build our Geodesic Dome! Why a dome?

This dome will be our new classroom and meeting space. Currently, all our classes are held outside in the Dragon Temple (our stone circle), in our canvas teepee, or in our lovely one room hobbit house when the temperature or weather prevent us from being outside. The extra space that the dome will provide will ensure that we can host our classes, healing sessions, guests, and events. Having the dome will benefit our teaching and healing abilities and therefore the experiences of our students who are seeking to transform and heal themselves so they can be effective practitioners, teachers, and healers of the Earth.

More about Geodesic Domes

Geodesic domes are structures that look like half spheres made up of many triangle supports. They are extremely efficient and inexpensive. Buckminster "Bucky"Fuller, an American engineer who helped spread and commercialize polyhedral "geodesic" constructions throughout the country, took his dome design inspiration from nature. He marveled at the structural uniformity of things like snowflakes, seed pods, flowers and crystals and resolved that humans should emulate those simple, strong, and noticeably spherical arrangements.

Geodesic domes incorporate the strength of a strong arch shape, and they're also made up of many triangles. Pair domes with triangles, and you have one extremely durable structure. Much of that durability results from the characteristics of triangles, which are the superheroes of shapes. Triangles are the strongest shape because they have fixed angles and don't distort very easily.

The low quantity of materials necessary for geodesic domes, matched with their durability and good looks, means they've found their way into places all over the world and into Our Dream!

How We Have Done So Far

We have consulted with local natural builder, Ben Graham, to get a clear idea of materials and costs. Materials will include lumber from a local mill (Fontaine’s in East Montpelier, VT) for floor, frame, plywood, shingles and shelving. We have another builder friend who has offered us his sizable discount at local lumberyard. Other materials will include windows, door, woodstove, lighting and solar electric system, insulation.

Labor! We plan to do most of the work ourselves, with some work exchange students and the occasional work party. However, we will need professional support at certain stages and some of the money raised will go toward paying our builder friends. 

We have already co-created so much since we moved here, and it has all happened because of our vision and the loving support of our local and extended community. Last year we kicked off our fundraising locally and raised $3,000 with two great events; a BBQ localvore dinner and silent auction, and a two part series in Celtic Shamanism taught by our esteemed colleague Meri Fowler of Sacred Cauldron in Montreal.  This money has allowed us to rent an auger, to buy the footers and platform, brackets and joists.  We broke ground and started building.  See pictures in our video of the beautiful mandala we created, plus our home made cordwood home and Dragon Temple! 

Let's Build a Dome!

Assuming we meet our funding goal of $21,000, we hope to have this beautiful structure up by late fall and ready for hosting our Grand Opening by spring of 2015.  If we do not meet our full funding goal here, we will continue with other avenues of fundraising until we have manifested our dream!

Our vision is great but our personal resources are limited. We are organized, thrifty and determined and we cannot do this alone! With your support we will build a beautiful legacy for the Earth that will endure beyond our lifetimes. This land and center will be put in trust with the intent of continuing the mission of earth based spiritual and practical education in perpetuity. 

We offer you these yummy perks to further entice you to support our Indiegogo campaign and jump on our Druid Dragon Dream Dome and ride!

If you feel inspired by our vision and mission but cannot afford to contribute financially, you can still help!  Here are a few ways you can do that;

o  Help us get the word out about this campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools, email, social media and good ol’ fashioned word of mouth!

o  Get in touch if you want to come to one of our fun work parties.  No experience necessary!

o  Cook some food for a work party and/or our Grand Opening Celebration!

Visit on the web at www.greenmountaindruidorder.org

Find us on Facebook: The Green Mountain Druid Order

Blessed Be!

story:
Short Summary

We are the Bentley Triathlon Team and we are trying to raise money so that we can go to Collegiate Nationals this year as a team. Nationals are in Arizona and we need help getting our bikes there, hotel, transportation and entrance fees.

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $10,000 if we want to send our whole team to the race. If you give you can get free Bentley stickers, T-shirts and even Jackets. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate you can help us spread the word! Send out this link to everyone and anyone you can! Also like our facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/bentleytriathlon

story:
My Story

Dear friends, family, and possible contributors


As many of you know I will be graduating this May from the University of Miami's BM/BFA Musical Theater program. The University of Miami as many know is on the top 100 list of most expensive colleges.

Growing up I went to performance programs for all my k-12 education - the highlight of which was New World School of the Arts in Downtown Miami. I've been singing since before I can remember and fell in love with theater when my mom took me to see Les Mis when it came to the Broward Center for the Performing Arts in 6th grade and I first heard Eponine sing.

Being in the arts has shaped every part of who I am. At home I'm different from every member of my family simply because all of my views and my personality has been incredibly crafted by a sort of liberal idealism encouraged to young artists to "explore their imagination" or "reach to the extremities of your emotions" - things most people think is fruity junk but to me is what this world needs. I think this world needs people whose "realism" is equally paired with imagination, creativity, and artistry.


But whatever you believe about artists and why they do what they do - I know that when I was given the choice to go to state school and study something ACADEMIC on a full ride I opted instead to go to a private school that allowed me the opportunity be myself and the opportunity to get the training to pursue what I really want to do with my life. 

But for every name on a Broadway playbill or actors in a movie there are millions of people who didn't get that job and who work every day just to get enough to pay the rent. I KNEW that getting into this - and trust me it won't deter me from pounding the pavement to get to an audition everyday for the rest of my life. This would just help me jump start repaying the loans i took for school so my actual income I make otherwise can go toward moving to NYC. I'm only 21 yrs old and the cost to follow my dreams has been steep already -  so that's where you come in!


What We Need & What You Get

I've been lucky to have been granted a Dean's scholarship for a full four years of studying here - that comes out to about 16000 dollars a year as well as Bright Futures/ grant funds that have helped close the gap a bit between the 52000 tuition and that dean's scholarship. I also have wonderful parents who support me in whatever I do and are helping support me. However, I have had to take out several large loans to finance my education and this would go towards paying some of it off.


WHAT YOU GET:

IN MY FREE TIME I HAVE BECOME SOMETHING OF A SKILLED BAKER AND I WILL PROVIDE ANY DONATION OVER $20 WITH 2 DOZEN COOKIES OF A FLAVOR OF YOUR CHOICE

OVER $30 GETS MUFFINS!


THIS CAN BE COUNTED AS A TAX DEDUCTIBLE DONATION!

The Impact

Not having to pay this loan would severely decrease the amount of money that I'd have to put towards loans every month and allow me to put the money I'm saving into finding an apartment in New York City to start auditioning there. It would mean not living on Ramen noodles and tuna for a year in the city. Any money I'm not spending on loans would go to :

rent
recording time
voice lessons
food
a website for marketing myself
and many other professional expenses.

Please help if you can!

story:
Short Summary

The Eighth Annual Memphis Children’s Theatre Festival will take place May 24th and 25th, 2013 featuring children's theatre performances from some of Tennessee’s finest professional theatre companies, local community theatres, area schools and many more. The performances incorporate a variety of performance styles such as dance, mime, mask work, music, physical theatre, and storytelling. The festival also features workshops with local theatre artists, interactive visual arts experiences, and featured performances by area youth. 

Since 2006, VOTS has hosted this weekend-long event both in and around The McCoy Theatre on the Rhodes College campus over Memorial Day weekend. The Festival kicks-off Friday evening with an opening night debut performance of a new children’s play performed by VOTS interns, followed by a post show celebration on the festival grounds. The next day, the festival opens its doors from 9:00am until 5:00pm and features over a dozen performances, and activity stations that provide young people with many opportunities to engage in a wide variety of workshops taught by skilled teaching artists

The Impact

The Festival places special emphasis on great literature and storytelling from diverse southern perspectives. The event features new work from Voices of the South’s  intern company, performances and workshops from a wide range of local arts groups, and spotlights the work of individual performing/teaching artists from the Mid-South as well.

Affordable programming specifically designed for families is still somewhat rare in Memphis. There are no other projects that offer a theatre festival experience of this kind. In fact, there are still very few like it in the United States. Based on data collected via exit surveys over the past two years, the festival has proven to be one of the arts events attended by many families throughout the year. This is due to the affordability and the wide variety of family friendly programming. It is clear that excellence, education, and affordability is important to our community. The Festival is an important arts portal and will connect families to the VOTS mission and the larger role that the arts play in our region.

The Memphis Children’s Theatre Festival is a PAY WHAT YOU CAN event, creating greater accessibility for area families. In past years the festival has reached an estimated 1,200 underserved individuals. Most of these underserved were children. (An estimated 700 attendees were minority. 300 attendees were seniors.) Based on our year-long marketing efforts, we expect this growth to continue.

What We Need & What You Get

The 2012 Memphis Children’s Theatre Festival is showing progress with increased sponsorship, new private donors, a dramatic increase in in-kind donations and an overwhelming response from the community at large. Voices of the South is committed to engaging this energy, and anticipates significant growth over the next five years.

Our goal is to keep this festival a "Pay What You Can" event that makes the arts accessible to everyone, regardless of ecomonic contraints. With your donation, you will help us develop new workshops, purchase supplies, and pay artists. By donating today, you may take advantage of a series of "perks" ranging from posters and photo albums to having a slab of Memphis-style BBQ Ribs delivered straight to your front door!  Please note the list of "perks" on the right side of this webpage.

Other Ways You Can Help

While we realize that not everyone is able to help financially, there are other ways you can help!

-Volunteer to work at the Memphis Children's Theatre Festival by calling 901-726-0800.

-Forward the link for this campaign to friends the might be able to assist financially. You may also use the Indiegogo Share Tools!

-Post the link for this campaign on your personal Facebook page, tweet about us, or mention us on your blog or other social media.

-Attend the Memphis Children's Theatre Festival and personally witness the power of theatre spark a child's imagination!

story:
Para leerlo en español ve más abajo.

Our Story

 Hi we are a group of artists formed by Paola, Gerardo and Amadeo. A graphic designer, an architect and a filmmaker that are very concerned about the present social situation in Mexico, and we are convinced that the future relies on children. We strongly believe that education and a sense of community are the keys for a better and more balanced world. That is why we have been doing this program for children's development using creativity as the essential means for self transformation and community self-awareness. 

We are using Art as our own personal foundation, for the realization of this special place. A place specially made for kids and by kids. This will serve them as an example to know that they are capable of changing reality.

 

Dreams shape the world. But they wont fly without wings.

 

The Impact

Most of public schools in Mexico don't have what we think are the most important things for children's development. Very rarely children are taught to express themselves, as well as encouraged to be proud of their identity. As a result of this, they grow up forming communities that lack of self confidence.

The program is made for children of 10 to 12 years old. Fifth and sixth grade of primary school.

 What Learning to Fly (children's development program) wants to achieve, is to give these children the alternative to have a space where they can believe in themselves, by learning new ways of expression, and giving them the chance to succeed in their own personal quests. Providing them the means to portray their reality and the possible ways to change and solve their problems. Creativity in action takes the one who uses it into a new perspective where everything can be possible.

Right now the program is just operating in one public school. But with your help we will be able to expand in the near future to other schools, and continue helping the kids to spread their wings.

What We Need.

Basically what we need is funds to buy all the artistic tools and necessary things to complete the program.

+FIRST PHASE: The Factory of tales.

In this phase the kids learn to tell stories. They are encouraged to say what they want to say, in the way they want to say it. Using means such as, photographs, video, writing, painting, or even the creation of toys. They are taught about color, drawing, painting, cardboard construction. Surrounded by activities and experiences that makes them be closer as human beings. With all this they become more aware of their identity and the needs of their fellow class mates. A feeling of belonging and self-identification with community is produced.
 
Money will be used on this phase for:

Art Materials, such as pencils, paint, cardboard.
Wood for making shelves.
Paper, canvases.
Trow away cameras.
A video projector.

+SECOND PHASE: The magic orchard

The children will learn to make a house made green roof. Planting seeds to have community owned growth veggies. And plant trees to reforest near areas. Together with fun activities the children will build their green shelter, and learn about human equilibrium with nature.

Money will be used on this phase for:

Seeds, pots, black soil. Metal wire to make divisions between plantations.
Plastic container to make fertile soil from organic waste of the school.

+THIRD PHASE: The all-together-dream Mural.

All the participants on the program including teachers and children, will get together to shape a communal image in a wall of the school. Where they will express their feelings about the whole experience. Using all kinds of visual materials. Leaving on the school a trace of a live work of art, an impression of the magic of communal work. A memory engraved more than just in a school wall, in the souls of these Winged Kids.

Money will be used on this phase for:
Paint, cement, recycled plastic bags, plasticine, natural made colors, etc.

+FOURTH PHASE: Camping.

We will take the children to an open air experience. To stay 5 days in contact with nature. Having activities that will make them more aware towards the problems we face as human race on Earth. This will be the closing event for the program this academic year. This is the way we will say good bye to this 6th grade primary school Kids. Sending them to Secondary School were each one will go to a different one. But hopefully creating a bond for a lifetime. The bond of The Winged Kids Legion.

Money will be used on this phase for:
Transportation, Food, Tents, Medicines, and other travel expenses. 


You can help by...


We only need 3000 people to donate one dollar each. We dont think thats too difficult, do you? but you can contribute  from one dollar to a thousand it is up to you. Just think about this posibility of donating just one dollar, and you will become our hero today. Now if you donate more you will no just be a hero but you will be granted wings. But if you cant spend any, you can spread the word. Remember that pasion is contagious. If you feel passionate about the ways to make childrens life more exiting talk to other about Learning to Fly Childrens Development Program. The Kids will be grateful.

Take a look for the wonderful perks we have for you!!!
 

Nuestra Historia: Niños Voladores

 

Hola, somos un grupo de artistas conformado por Paola Pasapera, diseñadora gráfica, Gerardo Morales, arquitecto y Amadeo Marín, cineasta, y como a muchos nos preocupa  la situación actual en México. Creemos firmemente que la educación y el sentido de comunidad son las claves para tener un mundo mejor y más balanceado y, convencidos de que el futuro se encuentra en los niños, hemos diseñado y, ya aplicamos, el programa de desarrollo infantil, que hoy ponemos a su consideración. En este proyecto, la creatividad es herramienta esencial para lograr la auto transformación de los niños y ayudarlos a que tengan conciencia de que forman parte de la comunidad.

 

Nos valemos del arte como fundamento principal para la realización de este espacio. Un espacio especialmente hecho por niños y para ellos. Aquí, se darán cuenta de sus capacidades y de cómo, con ellas, pueden cambiar su realidad.

 

Los sueños le dan forma al mundo. Pero no podrán volar si no les damos alas.

 

 

 

El impacto

 

La mayoría de escuelas públicas en México no tienen lo que pensamos, son las cosas más importantes en el desarrollo de los niños. Muy rara vez se les enseña a expresarse y tampoco se les motiva para estar orgullosos de su propia identidad. El resultado es que crecen formando comunidades que carecen de confianza en sí mismas.

 

 

Niños Voladores, Programa de Desarrollo Infantil, está diseñado para niños de entre 10 y 12 años que cursan quinto y sexto de primaria, respectivamente.

Lo que queremos lograr, es ofrecerles la alternativa de tener un espacio donde puedan creer en sí mismos, aprendan nuevas formas de expresión y tengan la oportunidad de auto realizarse en sus aventuras personales.

 

 Se les provee de los medios para retratar su propia realidad y se les muestran los posibles caminos para cambiar y solucionar sus problemas. La creatividad puesta en acción lleva al niño a ver el mundo desde una nueva perspectiva donde todo es posible.

 

 

En este momento el programa solo se aplica en una  escuela pública. Con tu ayuda podremos expandirnos a otras escuelas y seguir con esta misión y ayudar a los niños a desplegar sus alas.

 

 

 

Lo que necesitamos.

 

Básicamente buscamos fondos para conseguir todas las herramientas artísticas necesarias para aplicar el programa y llevar a buen término esta obra.

 

 

+ PRIMERA FASE: Taller de invención de cuentos.

 

En esta fase los niños aprenden a contar historias. Son animados a decir lo que desean y en la forma que ellos escojan. Pueden valerse de la fotografía, el video, la escritura, la pintura o hasta de la creación de juguetes. Se les enseña sobre el color, dibujo, pintura, construcción con cartón, etc. Se les rodea de actividades y experiencias que los unen como seres humanos, se convierten en personitas más conscientes de su identidad y de las necesidades de sus compañeros. Se busca provocar un sentimiento de pertenencia e identificación con la comunidad.

 

Los fondos en esta etapa serán usados para:

 

Materiales de arte como lápices, pinturas, cartón.

Madera para construir libreros y repisas.

Papeles y lienzos.

Cámaras desechables y un proyector de video.

 

 

+ SEGUNDA FASE: El huerto Mágico.

 

 

Los niños aprenderán a hacer azoteas verdes. Plantarán y cosecharán vegetales para la comunidad. Árboles para reforestar áreas cercanas. Con actividades divertidas construirán su propio refugio verde para aprender sobre el equilibrio entre el ser humano y la naturaleza.

 

 

Los fondos en esta etapa serán usados para:

 

Semillas, macetas, tierra negra. Alambre para hacer divisiones entre plantaciones.

Contenedores de plástico para hacer tierra fértil con residuos orgánicos de la escuela.

 

 

 

+TERCERA FASE: Mural del sueño colectivo.

 

Todos los participantes en el programa, maestros y niños, se juntarán para dar forma a una imagen colectiva en una pared de la escuela. En ella expresarán sus sentimientos y sus experiencias en el programa. Usando toda clase de material visual dejarán en la escuela un rastro de su trabajo viviente. La impresión de la magia de la labor en comunidad. Una memoria grabada no solo en la pared de la escuela sino en el alma de cada uno de estos Niños Voladores.

 

 

Los fondos en esta etapa serán usados para:

 

Pintura, cemento, bolsas de plástico reusadas, plastilina, tintes naturales.

 

 

+CUARTA FASE: Campamento.

 

Llevaremos a los niños a una experiencia de esparcimiento en el campo. Cinco días de contacto con la naturaleza. Actividad que los hará más conscientes de los problemas que como hombres y mujeres enfrentamos en la Tierra. Con esto se clausura el programa para los niños de sexto grado de primaria. Será su viaje de despedida y graduación. Creando un lazo entre ellos, que durará para siempre. El lazo de la Legión de los Niños Voladores.

 

Los fondos en esta etapa serán usados para:

 

Transporte, comida, tiendas de campaña, medicamentos y otros gastos de viaje.

 

 

 

Tú puedes ayudar...

 

El programa solo necesita de 3000 personas que se vuelvan héroes por un día donando un dólar cada uno. No creemos que sea tan difícil o ¿tú si lo crees?.

           Tu contribución puede ser a partir de un dólar y hasta lo que desees aportar. Eso depende de ti. Los niños te lo agradecerán y apreciarán cada centavo. Ahora que si quieres donar más de un dólar no solo te convertirás en un héroe para estos niños, sino que además te crecerán alas.

 

Pero si no puedes aportar dinero, también puedes ayudar corriendo la voz. Recuerda que la pasión es contagiosa. Si ayudar a que la vida de los niños sea más emocionante te apasiona,  habla con tus amigos sobre el Programa de Desarrollo Infantil: Niños Voladores.

 

 

Te aseguro que los niños se llenarán de sonrisas.

 

 

 

¡Mira las recompensas (perks) que tenemos para ti!

story:
The School of Atlantis Vision

Education needs a revolution, and for us, the School of Atlantis is the next stage in the evolution of education. Institutionalised Educational Gaming is the way of the future and we hope to create the first platform school to change the way in which children are educated. We envision an interactive environment where students wake up excited to play, learn, create and develop their skills that will help them become everything they desire to be. We have a large number of visions for this project, and they are as follows: 

· A world where education is readily and affordably available

· Reducing the number of school dropouts throughout the world

· A virtual world where students can engage in environments that they would never have the opportunity to in real life (e.g. the great pyramids) 

· A learning environment that is fun and drives each individual student to push   themselves forward

· A safe learning environment where things such as bullying can be monitored and eradicated

· A social platform where students can interact with other students from around the world

· Interactive learning where students become part of great historical events

· A fun environment for teachers to work in and interact with students

· Increasing an entrepreneurial innovative society

What is the School of Atlantis?

The School of Atlantis (SOA) is a Massively Multistudent Online Role-Playing School (MMORPS). It combines Education, Interactive Gaming and Social Networking to create the Institutionalised Educational Gaming Industry. This industry is the next step in the evolution of education and will aim to have positive outcomes for students disenchanted with traditional educational mediums. 

Atlantis is currently in the start-up (infancy) stages of its lifecycle, but has gained a large amount of support to date. We, the Atlantis team, have been working on educational programs and products for over 10 years. We are extremely excited about continuing to develop this school and bring the educational revolution to the world. 

The Game (Interactive Gaming)

Atlantis is a world like no other. It is a world where all things educational and inspiring come to life - where students can dive into the ancient historical worlds that are long lost, complete quests and assessments that teach educational concepts, socialise with other students from around the world, and even trade and learn the concept of money and economics. The possibilities with virtual schools are endless and Atlantis will be just that; an endless world where education and learning is the game.

The Atlantis world is divided into sections, wherein each section represents a school year. In these sections of the map the students will have the ability to interact with quest-giving none player characters (NPCs). The quests will have educational outcomes for students that reinforce the theories being taught in class. 

Students will have the opportunity to design and customise their own “avatars” (game characters), allowing for an interactive online school experience, which will increase student participation and engagement. Research has shown that the utilisation of Avatars in online education allows an experience of being present similar to that of real life interaction. With the use of avatars, students will be able to interact throughout the whole Atlantis world: undertaking assessments, quests, research, and social interactions.   

The Atlantis world will be made up of visually pleasing landscapes, cities, oceans, etc. 

In the center of Atlantis will be the School of Atlantis, where students will attend class. Once it is time for class, a message will appear on their computer screen, phone or tablet informing them that it is time to head to the school for their scheduled class.

The School (Education)

The classes in the School of Atlantis will be held in a virtual classroom, allowing students access to everything in-game where they will interact with real teachers who are academically certified. 

The Atlantis team will be looking to create relationships with international education bodies such as the Cambridge International Schooling system, the International Baccalaureate (IB) Schooling system or each respective country’s educational bodies.

Students will be able to enrol into the School of Atlantis from grade/year 5 (or the respective country’s grading equivalent).  Students will be provided with the software and learning materials upon enrolment. 

The classes will be scheduled on student timetables, showing students exactly what time they need to log on and head to their classes on that day. The virtual school will work just like most schools; only this school is virtual and will innovate the way education is provided throughout the world.

All students who graduate from the School of Atlantis will gain their schooling certificate just like any other registered school throughout the world. 


How can you help?

Back us!

Get behind the revolution and be part of creating the future of education.

Share!

To make Atlantis happen, we need awareness and for people to put their hands up and say, “We want to be part of this revolution because education needs a change!” The first place to start is simply by making some noise and sharing our Indiegogo page on Facebook, Twitter, Linkdin, Tumblr etc. Help us gain awareness, ultimately leading to funding the Beta and moving education into the new millennia. 

Ask us questions and give us your ideas for the school!

Go to our website, Facebook, Twitter or Tumblr and leave your feedback and ideas.

www.schoolofatlantis.com

https://www.facebook.com/schoolofatlantis?ref=hl

https://twitter.com/SchoolAtlantis

www.schoolofatlantis.tumblr.com

Where does the funding go?

As you can imagine, the School of Atlantis is no small feat and will require a large team of experts to pull this off. Although the current Atlantis team has a broad range of knowledge, we lack certain skills that will be required across the board. The funding will be used to hire experts in game development, coding, design, sound production, teaching, research and development, historians, educational consultants and so forth. The funding will cover licensing, external fees and all those other boring business expenses. We will also require hardware (more computers) and larger servers to hold our creation. The costs to develop a virtual school such as the School of Atlantis is not as small as we would like it to be, but it is still reasonable for the amount of change we can create throughout the world.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funding that has been attracted will go towards creating a small sample beta to pitch towards venture capital funds, Angel Investors or further crowd sourcing options. We truly believe in this idea and will not rest until the School of Atlantis is up and running - helping to change education throughout the world.

The Atlantis team are big believers in a few things, such as: “If you do what you’ve always done, you’ll always get what you’ve always got,” (Mark Twain) and the theory that states, “What if the solution to the world’s problems lay dormant in the mind of someone who can’t access education?” Larger corporations do not own our company, and thus we plan on keeping control to ensure that the school is always about the student and not about the money.

Rewards

Check back here for updates on what the rewards will (potentially) look like!

FAQ?

Will the students gain an internationally recognised high school (or respective country’s equivalent) certificate?

Yes, the School of Atlantis will be creating partnerships with internationally accredited schooling bodies to certify students.

Do students still need to undertake exams?

Yes, all students will still need to undertake exams just like any other brick and mortar, distance, or virtual school.

How expensive will the school fees be?

We are aiming to have school fees around the same price as the country’s public school equivalent to make the school affordable for all students.

Will there be in-game rewards?

Yes, students will gain experience points and in-game currency from completing quests. This can be used to purchase items for avatars, such as: clothes, vehicles, property, and others (to be announced).

Will students be attending school from their homes?

Yes, students will attend school from their home, as the School of Atlantis is an online virtual school. However, if there was enough demand, tutor centers may be set up for students to attend school in particular situations where the child cannot be left alone in the home.

Will people who don’t attend the school be able to play the game?

No, the School for Atlantis is for school students only. This is for safety and learning purposes.

How will bullying be monitored?

If a student encounters bullying, they will have the option to utilize the “Report Bullying” function, which will alert a monitoring teacher. This teacher can automatically message the student who is responsible for the bullying and give them a warning. A chat log will be recorded and sent to the student’s parents so that all parties are aware of what has occurred. Students will also have a “Block Student” option so they can no longer interact with each other outside of class times.

What if you receive more funding than you have asked for?

The funding we have asked for is enough to cover the cost of the first Beta. If we receive more funding then we have asked for, we will put it all towards the development of the final polished School of Atlantis. The first launch of the school will be for grade/year 5 students only, which will give us the necessary time to develop the next section of the map for the grade/year 6 students and so on. The excess will go straight into further creation and improvement of the school.

What about sports and out-door activities?

Students will be required to be a part of an approved sports activity in their local area, and this will make up for the sport curriculum part of their schooling certificate.

How will the classes work with multiple time zones?

Every class will be recorded and stored in the school library for students to access if they miss a class due to time differences. We will also have different teams of teachers who work in certain time zones for certain countries.

Will the classes be taught in different languages?

Apart from classes that are specific to language, not straight away. The School of Atlantis will initially be taught in English, just like most international schools.

Can I purchase more than one perk/reward?

You can buy as many as you like! The more support for the school, the better. :)

If you have more questions for us, just ask!

Thanks for supporting and sharing, everyone. We really hope you see and feel the dream that is the School of Atlantis.
story_txt:
The School of Atlantis VisionEducation needs a revolution, and for us, the School of Atlantis is the next stage in the evolution of education. Institutionalised Educational Gaming is the way of the future and we hope to create the first platform school to change the way in which children are educated. We envision an interactive environment where students wake up excited to play, learn, create and develop their skills that will help them become everything they desire to be. We have a large number of visions for this project, and they are as follows: · A world where education is readily and affordably available· Reducing the number of school dropouts throughout the world· A virtual world where students can engage in environments that they would never have the opportunity to in real life (e.g. the great pyramids) · A learning environment that is fun and drives each individual student to push   themselves forward· A safe learning environment where things such as bullying can be monitored and eradicated· A social platform where students can interact with other students from around the world· Interactive learning where students become part of great historical events· A fun environment for teachers to work in and interact with students· Increasing an entrepreneurial innovative societyWhat is the School of Atlantis?

The School of Atlantis (SOA) is a Massively Multistudent Online
Role-Playing School (MMORPS). It combines Education, Interactive Gaming and
Social Networking to create the Institutionalised Educational Gaming Industry.
This industry is the next step in the evolution of education and will aim to
have positive outcomes for students disenchanted with traditional educational
mediums. 
Atlantis is currently in the start-up (infancy) stages of its
lifecycle, but has gained a large amount of support to date. We, the Atlantis
team, have been working on educational programs and products for over 10 years.
We are extremely excited about continuing to develop this school and bring the
educational revolution to the world. 
The Game (Interactive Gaming)
Atlantis
is a world like no other. It is a world where all things educational and
inspiring come to life - where students can dive into the ancient historical
worlds that are long lost, complete quests and assessments that teach
educational concepts, socialise with other students from around the world, and
even trade and learn the concept of money and economics. The possibilities with
virtual schools are endless and Atlantis will be just that; an endless world
where education and learning is the game. 
The
Atlantis world is divided into sections, wherein each section represents a
school year. In these sections of the map the students will have the ability to
interact with quest-giving none player characters (NPCs). The quests will have
educational outcomes for students that reinforce the theories being taught in
class. 

Students will have the
opportunity to design and customise their own “avatars” (game characters),
allowing for an interactive online school experience, which will increase
student participation and engagement. Research has shown that the utilisation
of Avatars in online education allows an experience of being present similar to
that of real life interaction. With the use of avatars, students will be able to
interact throughout the whole Atlantis world: undertaking assessments, quests,
research, and social interactions.   

The Atlantis world will
be made up of visually pleasing landscapes, cities, oceans, etc. 

In the center of Atlantis will be the School of Atlantis, where students
will attend class. Once it is time for class, a message will appear on their
computer screen, phone or tablet informing them that it is time to head to the
school for their scheduled class.
The School (Education)
The classes in the School of Atlantis will be held in a virtual
classroom, allowing students access to everything in-game where they will
interact with real teachers who are academically certified. 

The Atlantis team will be looking to create relationships with
international education bodies such as the Cambridge International Schooling
system, the International Baccalaureate (IB) Schooling system or each respective
country’s educational bodies. 
Students will be able to
enrol into the School of Atlantis from grade/year 5 (or the respective country’s
grading equivalent).  Students will be
provided with the software and learning materials upon enrolment. 

The classes will be
scheduled on student timetables, showing students exactly what time they need
to log on and head to their classes on that day. The virtual school will work
just like most schools; only this school is virtual and will innovate the way education
is provided throughout the world. 
All students who graduate from the School of Atlantis will gain their
schooling certificate just like any other registered school throughout the
world. 
How can you help?

Back us!

Get behind the revolution and be part of creating the future of
education. 

Share!
To make Atlantis happen, we need awareness and for people to put
their hands up and say, “We want to be part of this revolution because education
needs a change!” The first place to start is simply by making some noise and sharing
our Indiegogo page on Facebook, Twitter, Linkdin, Tumblr etc. Help us gain
awareness, ultimately leading to funding the Beta and moving education into the
new millennia.  
Ask us questions and
give us your ideas for the school!

Go to our website, Facebook, Twitter or Tumblr and leave your
feedback and ideas.
www.schoolofatlantis.com
https://www.facebook.com/schoolofatlantis?ref=hl

https://twitter.com/SchoolAtlantis
www.schoolofatlantis.tumblr.comWhere does the funding go?
As you can imagine, the School of Atlantis is no small feat and
will require a large team of experts to pull this off. Although the current
Atlantis team has a broad range of knowledge, we lack certain skills that will
be required across the board. The funding will be used to hire experts in game
development, coding, design, sound production, teaching, research and
development, historians, educational consultants and so forth. The funding will
cover licensing, external fees and all those other boring business expenses. We
will also require hardware (more computers) and larger servers to hold our
creation. The costs to develop a virtual school such as the School of Atlantis
is not as small as we would like it to be, but it is still reasonable for the
amount of change we can create throughout the world. 
If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funding that has been
attracted will go towards creating a small sample beta to pitch towards venture
capital funds, Angel Investors or further crowd sourcing options. We truly
believe in this idea and will not rest until the School of Atlantis is up and
running - helping to change education throughout the world. 
The Atlantis team are big believers in a few things, such as: “If
you do what you’ve always done, you’ll always get what you’ve always got,”
(Mark Twain) and the theory that states, “What if the solution to the world’s
problems lay dormant in the mind of someone who can’t access education?” Larger
corporations do not own our company, and thus we plan on keeping control to
ensure that the school is always about the student and not about the money. 
Rewards
Check
back here for updates on what the rewards will (potentially) look like!
FAQ?
Will the students gain an
internationally recognised high school (or respective country’s equivalent) certificate?


Yes,
the School of Atlantis will be creating partnerships with internationally
accredited schooling bodies to certify students. 
Do students still need to undertake
exams? 

Yes,
all students will still need to undertake exams just like any other brick and
mortar, distance, or virtual school. 

How expensive will the school fees
be? 

We
are aiming to have school fees around the same price as the country’s public
school equivalent to make the school affordable for all students. 
Will there be in-game rewards? 

Yes,
students will gain experience points and in-game currency from completing
quests. This can be used to purchase items for avatars, such as: clothes,
vehicles, property, and others (to be announced). 
Will students be attending school from
their homes?

Yes,
students will attend school from their home, as the School of Atlantis is an
online virtual school. However, if there was enough demand, tutor centers may
be set up for students to attend school in particular situations where the
child cannot be left alone in the home. 
Will people who don’t attend the
school be able to play the game? 

No,
the School for Atlantis is for school students only. This is for safety and
learning purposes.
How will bullying be monitored?

If
a student encounters bullying, they will have the option to utilize the “Report
Bullying” function, which will alert a monitoring teacher. This teacher can
automatically message the student who is responsible for the bullying and give
them a warning. A chat log will be recorded and sent to the student’s parents
so that all parties are aware of what has occurred. Students will also have a “Block
Student” option so they can no longer interact with each other outside of class
times. 
What if you receive more funding than
you have asked for?

The
funding we have asked for is enough to cover the cost of the first Beta. If we
receive more funding then we have asked for, we will put it all towards the
development of the final polished School of Atlantis. The first launch of the
school will be for grade/year 5 students only, which will give us the necessary
time to develop the next section of the map for the grade/year 6 students and
so on. The excess will go straight into further creation and improvement of the
school.

What about sports and out-door activities?

Students
will be required to be a part of an approved sports activity in their local
area, and this will make up for the sport curriculum part of their schooling
certificate. 
How will the classes work with
multiple time zones?

Every
class will be recorded and stored in the school library for students to access
if they miss a class due to time differences. We will also have different teams
of teachers who work in certain time zones for certain countries. 
Will the classes be taught in
different languages? 

Apart
from classes that are specific to language, not straight away. The School of Atlantis will initially be
taught in English, just like most international schools.
Can I purchase more than one perk/reward?


You
can buy as many as you like! The more support for the school, the better. :)
If
you have more questions for us, just ask! 
Thanks
for supporting and sharing, everyone. We really hope you see and feel the dream
that is the School of Atlantis.

story:
Hello! My name is Solinah Kinney and I am a full time rising Senior at Cedar Crest College. This summer I have been chosen among 5 other students from my college to travel to South Korea to participate in the Bahrom International Program. The goal of the student eschange program is to learn and experience first hand the people and culture of South Korea. I have been working hard not only in my academics but financially as well to raise funds for the trip but I need your help as well. Traveling has also been an interest of mine; last year I had explored the opportunity to travel to Australia to study abroad for the semester but had the misfortune of tearing my ACL in my left knee during the summer before the planned trip. Now I am glad to say that I am healed and ready to go! This is a once in a life time opportunity that I would love to take and would appreciate any and all help.

The Total Cost Breakdown

  • The cost of a plane ticket to Incheon International Airport from JFK approx. $1900
  • $300 registration fee to Seoul Women’s University
  • $32 mandatory travel health insurance fee
  • 4-9% fee rate for using this website

Give and Receive: Perks for YOU!

Listed on the right side of this document is a list of items/”Perks” that you can receive for contributing as well as a lifetime supply of Eternal Gratefulness from yours truly.

Mission Impact

By taking the opportunity to see how others in the world are living, you are able to realize how you can use your talents and resources to give back to and impact communities worldwide. I believe that by being a part of the Bahrom International Program I will be able to do just that. This effort may start off small, such as helping one of the SWU students adjust during their first semesters at Cedar Crest to growing large, impacting a small village in a developing country. The possibilities are truly endless.

 I feel that this trip to Korea and the BIP program would be the start of something amazing not only for myself but for others as well. I hope that I can inspire others who come from single parent homes not to get discouraged and take a chance to travel overseas and take in a new way of life and see how they too can continually challenge themselves to become globally aware citizens as well.

Please Click and Share!

I also understand that times may be difficult for some of us and a monetary donation may not be possible. Please feel free to help out by sharing my page and spreading the word! Any and all contributions are appreciated!

Thank you all!

story:
Short Summary

EUHS 25 Year Reunion… We should have charged more for the dinner, but we didn't, so we need to raise some money to pay for the photographer, name tags and all that other fun stuff that you need for this kind of event.

What We Need & What You Get

$500 is the goal, if we are short all the money will still go towards covering expenses, it just means that Daphne and Cassie will have to front the money, then beg people to donate at the reunion versus actually being able to enjoy themselves after doing all the hard work.

    The Impact

    Your donation will help make for a great reunion.

      Risks & Challenges

      The biggest challenge for some was to graduate. Then there were all the risks some have taken over the past 25 years to get to this point...

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you can not donate, and know somebody from EUHS Class of '89 you can help remind them to show up for their reunion. Thanks!

story:
Empower Girls-Fund Priyasha!

We are Priyasha Foundation; our mission is to empower marginalized women in the developing world through jewelry income generation projects.  Our goal is to change lives by teaching entrepreneurial skills.  For the past three years we've been working in India (and out of India, during the planning stages) on these jewelry income generation projects.

Because jewelers in India are traditionally men, it is not enough to simply teach the women a marketable skill. It is also necessary to build the infrastructure required to create jobs so they can apply these newly acquired skills.  A jewelry income generation project in the developing world is complicated, requires a large amount of resources, and takes several years to get off the ground.  It is a novel concept, but is a proven long lasting solution to ending poverty and sex trafficking.

A jewelry income generation project helps girls to heal, express themselves and to gain confidence in learning.  It shows them that they hold value in the world.  A project like this is so much more than simply teaching a woman a marketable skill.   Women in India don't want a hand out, they want a leg up.  It is inspiring to us how hard these women will work to achieve their goals when given a chance.  By empowering them and teaching a skill we can change lives and affect women for generations to come.  

This coming fall and winter, Priyasha Foundation will return to India to build a permanent jewelry workshop/training center in Bangalore, India. 

We can serve more women while conserving our resources by building a training center in a centralized location.  We spend the money one time on tools for one location and can partner with more NGO's and service more populations of women from one centralized location by having the women come to us. 

We save time, money, energy, and resources, rather than spending the same amount of money on tools over and over again, setting up training centers within NGO's in different locations.

The workshop in Bangalore will serve as our base, so that in years to come, we can take our mobile jewelry kits to remote locations for future jewelry income generation projects.

For more info on how a jewelry income generation project can transform a life, please read here:  http://helpost.com/read/love-encouragement-manju/


What We Need & What You Get

With your support, we're asking for $25,000.00 to set up a full jewelry production studio and training center in Bangalore, India.  Please partner with us to empower women in India.

The money will be used for travel, studio rental and set up costs, and initial set up costs for the project.  Costs will include:  travel to India, room and board and travel expenses in India,  rental and deposit for studio space (in India, a full year's rental is the deposit amount), utilities for the space, up-fit of the space (mostly painting or minimal transformation), internet, a generator for power backup, a laptop for communication with the west and running the business part of the studio, possibly a simple camera for photographing the jewelry for the website and documentation of the projects, initial salary for a watchman and guard, studio manager (one of the girls from our previous projects is already trained for this position), initial training salary for the women, shipping the already donated and purchased tools to India, purchase of supplemental jewelry tools missing from tool donations or available only in India, initial jewelry line production costs--3-D printing and two sets of casting molds, casting of the sample pieces for the line, initial material and labor costs, broker, tariffs and export fees, website design and online sales marketing and web hosting fees, professional photography of the jewelry for the website, some simple jewelry display costs, bags, boxes, jewelry info cards, hang tag and corporate identity costs for the jewelry line, sales marketing costs, bazaar show fees for sales in India, show fees for US sales.   

We're going for broke here, and asking for our pie-in-the-sky fully funded set-up of the entire project in one pitch, rather than cobbling together small fundraisers and limping along.   There's nothing more frustrating than being in India, seeing real needs and being frustrated and unable to help or move forward due to lack of funding.   We've been working hard behind the scenes for two years planning all aspects of this project, doing budgets, revising plans, working out problems, gathering tools, designing the jewelry line,  There is no money in this budget for personal salaries. or overhead.  ALL funds for this project are going directly to the girls and the set up of the studio and set up costs.  

It is our dream to not only make our goal, but to surpass our goal!  The more money we raise, the more women we can help.  This is a multi-year, multi-stage project, that will have real long term lasting effects to helping to solve the problems associated with poverty in the developing world.  However, even if we don't reach our entire goal, we will fund and fulfill the aspects of the project that are funded.  We maintain milestones and goals, and each one we reach in another step forward in helping our girls.

**PLEASE NOTE:  If you are a foundation or charity that can only donate through a tax deductible organization, we are in the process of partnering with an organization that can accept tax deductible donations on our behalf.  You can email us at Priyashafoundation@yahoo.com or at priyashafoundation@gmail.com to discuss your needs.  The link for tax deductions will be posted soon.

As a thank you for your donations for partnering with us to change girls lives in the developing world, we have some really cool perks with an Indian flavor (please see the list of Perks).  No donation is too big or too small, your donation goes a long long way in India.  Thanks for your support!

Your Impact

We have been working in and for India for three years.  We started as a simple volunteer hope project and through our partnership with the US and Indian community, we have evolved into Priyasha.  Along the way, your support in a myriad of ways, from contributing to our campaigns, organizing fundraisers, volunteering services, donating tools, or lending moral support has contributed to our success and allowed us to help these girls.  It is a true partnership of a global community that will enable these women to survive and thrive.  We are standing in this moment now, ready to build a training center because of you. 

A jewelry income generation project is a novel approach but a proven long lasting solution to ending poverty in the developing world.  We believe that we may be the first artisan jewelry income generation project in the south of India of this focus, scope and scale.  Our center will enable us to train 30 women from three local NGO's, and give advanced training to the girls from our first project. 

More importantly, the center will allow these women to become trainers and entrepreneurs in their own communities, empowering them to change their own lives, by earning money and investing in education for themselves and their daughters and affecting their families for generations to come.

We completed a successful six month test income generation project as a preliminary to two years of planning for this phase of the project.  We have everything we need to start a training center--all the pieces are in place, ready to go, all we need is your funding support!

Risks & Challenges

We are fully aware of the risks, challenges and obstacles that occur by working in the developing world because we have experienced them first-hand.  From these experiences, we have learned how to design studios and projects with limited resources in places lacking infrastructure like power, water, and internet.  We know how to avoid situations where, cheating, scandal and blocking our projects may occur, and how to work with the local community to solve problems, and overcome misunderstandings due to cultural differences. 

Our team includes a professional jeweler with 23 years of experience in setting up and running production studios and jewelry businesses.  We have six months of on the ground experience, which cultivated professional contacts in the local jewelry, NGO and ex-pat community.  This community is always willing to lend a hand to help us solve problems.  We have 3 potential NGO's with whom to partner, a local product designer on our team, and many more friends and contacts on whom we can trust and rely.  Most importantly, we have the full support of the local community.

Ultimately, in India, one must remain flexible and patient, and constantly adjust when obstacles and problems occur.  We feel confident that with the community support and our contacts and resources, we will be successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please contribute to our campaign to help us reach our goal.  We are grateful for all contributions, even the small amounts add up.  Thank you!

Even if you find yourself in a position of not being able to contribute financially, please help us spread the word by sharing our Indiegogo campaign with friends, family, and co-workers,

Please share our campaign on Facebook and email our campaign link to others.

Please help us amplify our voice on social media by sharing our campaign on  Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Facebook and Pinterest, and, while you're at it, please like our page on Facebook and follow us on social media.  Links are below.

Do you have other ideas for sharing our campaign, or would you like to volunteer?  Please contact us.

Link to our indiegogo campaign:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/empower-girls-fund-priyasha/x/179982

http://igg.me/at/priyasha

And to our videos:

http://vimeo.com/103652580

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tLL1gpnQTFU

We could not do this without you!  Thank you for your support!

Follow us, like and share on social media:

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/PriyashaFoundation

Tumblr:  http://priyasha-foundation.tumblr.com/

Instagram:  http://instagram.com/priyashafoundation

Twitter:  https://twitter.com/priyashafound

Pinterest:  http://www.pinterest.com/PriyashaFound/

**PLEASE NOTE:  If you are a foundation or charity that can only donate through a tax deductible organization, we are in the process of partnering with an organization that can accept tax deductible donations on our behalf.  You can email us at Priyashafoundation@yahoo.com or at priyashafoundation@gmail.com to discuss your needs.  The link for tax deductions will be posted soon.As a thank you for your donations for partnering with us to change girls lives in the developing world, we have some really cool perks with an Indian flavor (please see the list of Perks).  No donation is too big or too small, your donation goes a long long way in India.  Thanks for your support!
  Your Impact
We have been working in and for India for three years.  We started as a simple volunteer hope project and through our partnership with the US and Indian community, we have evolved into Priyasha.  Along the way, your support in a myriad of ways, from contributing to our campaigns, organizing fundraisers, volunteering services, donating tools, or lending moral support has contributed to our success and allowed us to help these girls.  It is a true partnership of a global community that will enable these women to survive and thrive.  We are standing in this moment now, ready to build a training center because of you.  
A jewelry income generation project is a novel approach but a proven long lasting solution to ending poverty in the developing world.  We believe that we may be the first artisan jewelry income generation project in the south of India of this focus, scope and scale.  Our center will enable us to train 30 women from three local NGO's, and give advanced training to the girls from our first project.  
More importantly, the center will allow these women to become trainers and entrepreneurs in their own communities, empowering them to change their own lives, by earning money and investing in education for themselves and their daughters and affecting their families for generations to come.
We completed a successful six month test income generation project as a preliminary to two years of planning for this phase of the project.  We have everything we need to start a training center--all the pieces are in place, ready to go, all we need is your funding support!

  Risks & Challenges
We are fully aware of the risks, challenges and obstacles that occur by working in the developing world because we have experienced them first-hand.  From these experiences, we have learned how to design studios and projects with limited resources in places lacking infrastructure like power, water, and internet.  We know how to avoid situations where, cheating, scandal and blocking our projects may occur, and how to work with the local community to solve problems, and overcome misunderstandings due to cultural differences.  
Our team includes a professional jeweler with 23 years of experience in setting up and running production studios and jewelry businesses.  We have six months of on the ground experience, which cultivated professional contacts in the local jewelry, NGO and ex-pat community.  This community is always willing to lend a hand to help us solve problems.  We have 3 potential NGO's with whom to partner, a local product designer on our team, and many more friends and contacts on whom we can trust and rely.  Most importantly, we have the full support of the local community.
Ultimately, in India, one must remain flexible and patient, and constantly adjust when obstacles and problems occur.  We feel confident that with the community support and our contacts and resources, we will be successful.
  Other Ways You Can Help Please contribute to our campaign to help us reach our goal.  We are grateful for all contributions, even the small amounts add up.  Thank you!
Even if you find yourself in a position of not being able to contribute financially, please help us spread the word by sharing our Indiegogo campaign with friends, family, and co-workers, 
Please share our campaign on Facebook and email our campaign link to others.
Please help us amplify our voice on social media by sharing our campaign on  Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Facebook and Pinterest, and, while you're at it, please like our page on Facebook and follow us on social media.  Links are below. 
Do you have other ideas for sharing our campaign, or would you like to volunteer?  Please contact us.
Link to our indiegogo campaign:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/empower-girls-fund-priyasha/x/179982
http://igg.me/at/priyasha

And to our videos:

http://vimeo.com/103652580
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tLL1gpnQTFU
We could not do this without you!  Thank you for your support!
Follow us, like and share on social media:
Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/PriyashaFoundation
Tumblr:  http://priyasha-foundation.tumblr.com/
Instagram:  http://instagram.com/priyashafoundation
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/priyashafound
Pinterest:  http://www.pinterest.com/PriyashaFound/

story:
Hello all, I am currently a certified ESL Middle School teacher in South Korea and  I am raising money to pursue a Master's Degree in Environmental Public Health in Bangkok Thailand in December of this year. 
The scholarship I was hoping to receive fell through unfortunately.
 I still will be attending the school but my financial situation has changed significantly since finding out the tuition would not be covered by scholarship.  
 I would like to continue my education while teaching English to students in Thailand.  I will be using the money raised to attend a 1 year Master's program focusing on the public health issues we face today, it's very humanitarian and adresses significant modern problems. Especially, the affects of human interactions in specific regions of the world that result in the introduction of new and reemerging diseases. 
 I would like to use this degree to upgrade my teaching qualifications to the University level and be able to teach my field as a University Professor  and further research Third World health epidemics. 
  The goal amount that I have provided is the actual cost of the program but i would be very satisfied with receiving even just half of my goal.  
The $10,000 is for the entire course program that is broken up into 3 trimesters 
The best part about the goal is that even if I raise 1/3 or even half of it I will still be attending the school, so regardless all funding that is raised will be used toward my education even if the goal is not met. 

Thank you for your time and your assistance is much appreciated.

story:
Mason Needs a New Laptop 4 High School

Mason is my nephew and he lives with his grandparents. He has been living with them for 11 years and they are raising him while living on social security which doesn't leave much money for anything more than the basics. Mason is a fine young man who enjoys helping other people, reading, computer games and surfing the internet, and he wants to become a teacher after college.

He is a Junior, gets excellent grades in school, polite, willing to lend a hand when needed, and is a delight to have in his classes according to his teachers. He utlimately wants to attend college and pursue teaching career in either either Math or Science.

I have a great respect for my parents for dedicating their lives to raising Mason and I think getting Mason a computer would be a nice way to give something to him that they are unable to afford.

I am encouraging everyone to donate something and make this a gift from everyone who loves Mason or wants to see that Mason get a good education so he can become a Teacher someday and give back to our future children.

In summary: Mason is a great kid and very deserving of a new laptop computer to help him High School and get ready for college.

Thanks in advance to anyone who helps with donations to helping get Mason a new computer. Whether we get to our goal or not I intend to purchase him a new laptop.

story:
Our Story

The Damian Carmona Primary School in Sayulita Nayarit is filled with 350 bright and beautiful students, sweet and eager to learn.  A local organization, Grupo Pro Sayulita, raised money to build a library in the school.  This is the first library the town of Sayulita has ever had.  This year I had the pleasure of opening the doors of the library for most of the school year.  I was overwhelmed with students coming in to exchange their books, sometimes two and three times a day.  During recess, I keep the doors open to use the room and various donated supplies to run an art program for the children.  Most days there is standing room only, as the children are able to explore their creativity with art supplies many have never had the opportunity to use.  The library has become a place that offers not only access to information, by way of books but I also bring my computer in with me, connected to a neighbor's wireless signal to give both the students and teachers the ability to utilize the internet, some for the first time.  I would love to see more computers at the school, so they can continue to experience the benefits of easy access to the internet.  As much as possible, I keep the room stocked with water, fruit and healthy snacks for the children who find themselves in school without lunch or money; something that happens far too often.  The Damian Carmona Primary School Library is a place for students to discover their true capabilities: through access to resources, tutoring or simply seeing to it that no student is trying to learn on an empty stomach. 

The Impact

The program is already a success by way of the generous support from GPS and the local Sayulita community.  We can keep our doors open and many wonderful people have donated materials, time and food to the students.  However my goal is to fill the shelves with books for the kids.  I would love to be able to provide paper and pencils free of charge.  I want to be able to keep the doors open after school so the children have the opportunity to do homework with tutors, bringing up standardized test scores that are some of the lowest in Mexico.  I want to see at least 5 computers in the room with internet access, connected to a laser printer.  When I first opened the doors, one of the second grade girls asked me what the library was for.  I told her it was there so that she and her classmates could learn to read, to be creative and that if she ever needed help with her homework, while the doors were open, someone would be there to help her.  She paused a moment, taking in what I had said.  Then she looked up at me with big, watery eyes, and ran forward to embrace me.  "Muchas gracias, Teacher.  Muchas gracias."  How can we quantify the impact of even one student's mind expanding, feeling believed in or not being hungry?  It is my goal to help each one of these students become aware of the possibilities that are open to them and provide the resources needed to become who ever it is they want to be.

What We Need

We need computers, books, paper, pens, paints, tape, pencil sharpeners, snacks, water and tutors.  The beautiful thing about donating to this program is that it doesn't take much to make a difference.  For example, $5 will buy a stack of white paper that equals 500 kids getting to explore their creativity.  This is a school with virtually nothing.  The children's family pays for things like classroom cleaning supplies, filtered water and toilet paper.  There isn't soap in the bathrooms.  These things may not seem very expensive but stocking a school with supplies for hundreds of children more than 40 weeks a year really starts to add up.  It is not an exaggeration to say that every penny counts.  Give what you can.  I promise you  each one of these beautiful little people is worth it.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this cause by forwarding this page to your Facebook community and/or email list.  If you happen to be in the Sayulita, Nayarit MX area, stop by and lend a hand, read to a child or just pop in and visit us.  We would love to see you.
