story:
Dear Viewer-

 

My name is Hannah McKee and I am hoping to travel to Europe with the People to People Student Ambassador Programs.

 

(To learn more about the trip: http://peopletopeople.com/find/local/eu/celtic-... )

 

Backstory:

I am the youngest of thirteen children: ten girls and three boys. In my house I am the care-taker; I pack lunches, clean up, babysit nieces and nephews, and create family fun activities. Currently I am a junior in high school and a freshman in college. I am training to become a high school math teacher.

Why:

This Program would open so many doors for me. It would teach me things I couldn’t possible pick up in a classroom. (Repelling off a castle: 101?) People to People is a program that would help me get into great colleges with amazing scholarships. Plus, the people I meet will become my friends for a lifetime.

What if I don’t make it?:

If I don’t reach my goal through indiegogo and individual fundraising then all the money I earn will be split between the charities of your choice. I am sponsoring four: The Red Cross, St. Jude Children Research Hospital, Susan G. Koeman for The Cure, and ASPCA. All you have to do is email me your choice and I will email you back with either pictures from my trip or the confirmation of your accepted donation.  

My history:

I have volunteered for KSPS answering phones to take donations for public access television.

I have created my own Red Cross cupcake drive, raising three hundred dollars.

 

Letter from me to you:

I understand times are tough.  Most people barely have enough money to keep their household afloat. I greatly appreciate the time you took out of your day to read this. I’d be thankful for any donation you can; whether that be ten cents or $100. If you can’t donate at all please tell your friends and family about my situation and maybe they will take it in their hearts to help me out. $8,000 is a lot of money to earn, but I know with your help and the power of social networking we can make this happen.

Thank you so much for your time.

 

<!-- Begin Official PayPal Seal --><a href="https://www.paypal.com/us/verified/pal=ham13mckee%40comcast%2enet" target="_blank"><img src="https://www.paypal.com/en_US/i/icon/verification_seal.gif" border="0" alt="Official PayPal Seal"></A><!-- End Official PayPal Seal -->

story:
Holly's family comes from China and she will be the first in her family to go to college. She is an avid reader and dedicated student.  Her teachers tell us that "Holly pushes herself to excel and continually improve, while always maintaining a positive attitude.  She leads by quiet example."

 

Holly writes, "When I was in first grade, I was an average student.  However, I worked my way up and now I'm one of the top students in the sixth grade."

 

Your support will provide Holly with free summer and afterschool programs for a year so that she can achieve her dream of becoming a dentist one day.

Holly writes, "When I was in first grade, I was an average student.  However, I worked my way up and now I'm one of the top students in the sixth grade."

story:
Nice to meet you...

Hi, my name is Ana and I am extremely passionate about education and changing lives. I recently opened an early childhood program for ages 6 weeks - 5 years of age and am so thrilled to be taking on such a venture! I have been a teacher and administrator for over 10 years, primarly for ages K-12 and realized that there is such a need for early childhood programs that teach creativity, innovation and critical thinking skills for their future success.

This school wants to include a new technology and innovation lab where we can truly put STEM and change it into STREAM, integrating Reading and the Arts into action for the youngest of our students.

I am launching this campaign because so many of my family and friends have shared in my excitement and continue to ask how they can help build the program. The request has been overwhelming and I am blessed to have so many supporters.  Here is how you can help!!!

I would like to include a technology and innovation lab!

Your awesome donation will allow me to purchase the desktops and ipads needed for the technology lab and I am certain that the students will be thrilled to have these classes added to their day.

I invite you to explore the website at hawaiistreamacademy.org and learn more! 

Every Dollar Counts!!!

I need $35,000 for Mac Desktops, iPads, and Whiteboard Interactive Presentation Boards.

Thank you so much...

Thank you again for taking the time to read this! Your contribution will allow us to reach our goal and will certainly bring smiles to many young faces for years to come. The early years last forever! Please help. Every dollar counts!!!
 
Please pass this on and spread the word. Aloha!

story:
Govan RIC was set up in March of this year , to try to persuade the people of Govan and surrounding communities that “Another Scotland is Possible” Govan holds an iconic position in Scottish Politics the seat produced two stunning by elections that shook Scottish Politics to the core and furthered the cause of Independence Margo Mc Donald’s victory in 1973 and Jim Sillars in 1988 .We simply have to win in Govan in September Since starting Govan RIC has held a weekly stall at Govan X on Saturday mornings. Our members have participated in the Castlemilk Easterhouse and Drumchapel mass canvass and the subway leaflet drop on Mayday . From next week 7th May we will be starting Wednesday afternoon canvass sessions.

We plan do more Through local contacts with the Kinning Park Complex we have booked a public meeting for the 5 th of June. The cost of hiring the hall is £180 and we envisage spending £100 on leaflets and posters advertising the meeting The membership of Govan RIC is made up of retired people, students and people whose sole income is welfare benefits . We are struggling to raise the funds to pay for the hall We are well aware that we need more members are undertake some fund-raising ourselves .

It is hoped that the public meeting will bring us more members and a collection will help us purchase more campaign material to take the RIC agenda to the people of Govan and surrounding communities of Kinning Park Ibrox Cessnock Linthouse and Drumoyne We are appealing to the wider Yes campaign to help fund our public meeting on the 5th June . On our part we will undertake to campaign tirelessly to deliver a resounding Yes vote from the people of Govan and surrounding communities on the 18th of September 2014.

Another Scotland is possible, lets make it happen


Thank You

Govan RIC

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Matt Kurtyka and I am a senior at Drexel University, studying Entertainment and Arts Management. I am working with several other Drexel comrades in attempt to give back to my fellow students pursuing their future career goals in the fields of media, arts, and design.
  • The Co-op Scholarship Fund is a campaign designed to raise money for the Westphal students of Drexel University who sell their souls to unpaid internships over the summer. By raising money for students on unpaid co-op, we are alleviating the financial burdens of transportation, housing, and other living expenses, allowing students to focus their efforts towards their future career goals and academic success.
  • Contributing to this cause would immensely help the Co-op Scholarship Fund. You would not only be providing money to support our Drexel sophomores and juniors embarking on unpaid internships, but contributing to this fund's first annual fundraising event. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • To reach our goal, we would like to raise $5,000. The money will be deposited into an account managed by the Entertainment and Arts Program of Drexel University's Westphal College. This money will then be transferred to a University established fund; a small percentage of the money raised will go into the production of an annual fundraising event and the rest will be allocated to students through University developed fund.
  • Whether or not we reach our target goal, every last dollar will go towards helping the students. Any amount is greatly appreciated, and please know that each and every student will have the opportunity to benefit from this fundraiser. 

The Impact

  • This project is valuable not only to Drexel students, but to it's contributors and the world of media, arts, and design. By enabling students to pursue the best possible opportunities in their field of interest, we are fueling the world of creativity and creating new paths and gateways for the next generation of brilliant minds.
  • College isn't cheap and when forced to do an internship for credit, some students have very little time to work for money. Initially, we are providing support to Westphal's Entertainment and Arts Management (EAM) and Music Industry (MIP) students because statistically, they participate in the highest number of unpaid co-ops, 
  • Within the next several years, I would like this fund to grow and eventually support the entire Westphal College. This may seem like a daunting task but with the support from students, faculty, alumni, businesses, local community, and you, I know we can achieve this goal and impact the lives of growing college students for the coming years.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Whether or not you donate to this cause, do the students a favor and get the word out about this fundraiser and unpaid internships.  If we raise awareness for unpaid internships, perhaps other universities and colleges across the country will take note and begin to offer internship support through their own arts, media, and design programs.
  • Let's raise the bar and a light a fire that's bright enough for other college communities to see!
story_txt:
Short SummaryMy name is Matt Kurtyka and I am a senior at Drexel University, studying Entertainment and Arts Management. I am working with several other Drexel comrades in attempt to give back to my fellow students pursuing their future career goals in the fields of media, arts, and design.
The Co-op Scholarship Fund is a campaign designed to raise money for the Westphal students of Drexel University who sell their souls to unpaid internships over the summer. By raising money for students on unpaid co-op, we are
alleviating the financial burdens of transportation, housing, and other
living expenses, allowing students to focus their efforts towards their future
career goals and academic success.Contributing to this cause would immensely help the Co-op Scholarship Fund. You would not only be providing money to support our Drexel sophomores and juniors embarking on unpaid internships, but contributing to this fund's first annual fundraising event. What We Need & What You Get
To reach our goal, we would like to raise $5,000. The money will be deposited into an account managed by the Entertainment and Arts Program of Drexel University's Westphal College. This money will then be transferred to a University established fund; a small percentage of the money raised will go into the production of an annual fundraising event and the rest will be allocated to students through University developed fund.

Whether or not we reach our target goal, every last dollar will go towards helping the students. Any amount is greatly appreciated, and please know that each and every student will have the opportunity to benefit from this fundraiser. 
The ImpactThis project is valuable not only to Drexel students, but to it's contributors and the world of media, arts, and design. By enabling students to pursue the best possible opportunities in their field of interest, we are fueling the world of creativity and creating new paths and gateways for the next generation of brilliant minds.College isn't cheap and when forced to do an internship for credit, some students have very little time to work for money. Initially, we are providing support to Westphal's Entertainment and Arts Management (EAM) and Music Industry (MIP) students because statistically, they participate in the highest number of unpaid co-ops, 
Within the next several years, I would like this fund to grow and eventually support the entire Westphal College. This may seem like a daunting task but with the support from students, faculty, alumni, businesses, local community, and you, I know we can achieve this goal and impact the lives of growing college students for the coming years.

Other Ways You Can HelpWhether or not you donate to this cause, do the students a favor and get the word out about this fundraiser and unpaid internships.  If we raise awareness for unpaid internships, perhaps other universities and colleges across the country will take note and begin to offer internship support through their own arts, media, and design programs.Let's raise the bar and a light a fire that's bright enough for other college communities to see!

story:
Short Summary

So I am David, and I am a freshman in college.  My top choice school was too expensive, and fortunately I was able to stay on campus, but also did not get any additional aid for this.  Throughout high school I had pushed myself to do as best as possible.  I had kept up high honors all four years, as well as being inducted National Honor Society.  I had worked a part time job, but was laid off because I wasn't able to work due to school.  I had contributed most of my earnings from my job to my parents to pay towards this semester of schooling.  With Stafford loans, I have to pay around $15000 which will be much harder to pay this following semester and further on.  My state school gave me no financial aid other than federal loans.  Any donations I can receive will greatly be appreciated.

What We Need & What You Get

Any funds at all I can raise, will greatly help offset the cost of college for my family and I.  I don't really have anything to offer as an incentive, but anything that I can receive won't go to waste.

The Impact

This is important to me, because I want to get a college degree, but I also don't want to end up having to have large amounts of debt in the process.  I had to settle for my 2nd choice school because financially it worked out, but I appreciate everything my family has done for me and understand the situation.

story:
Short Summary

I don’t need to tell you that in today’s world our youth are more likely to look at a screen than play outside. It’s what they talk about, brag about and look forward to. This screenager philosophy is what makes it so amazing that our kids at Knova Learning Charter School want to go to out-door school!

The school is a week-long outing in which the students learn how to take water and soil samples, as well as discovering what minerals and living things are present in nature. They learn about local plant life: what’s edible, dangerous or medicinal. Students will also learn about local wild life, including how to track and identify a variety of local animals. The students sleep in cabins integrated with students from other schools, which will help build strong social ties with others in our community. They also receive three nutritious meals a day to help their bodies keep up with the task of learning and hiking. 

What We Need & What You Get

The cost break down is $250 per student. Our 6th grade class consists of 30 potential, eager, out-door enthusiasts. That brings the grand total to $7,500. I mentioned that our students want to go to out-door school! They have demonstrated this desire by raising all but $3,000 through multiple fundraising activities. Please help give these students a chance to learn about the out-doors, in doing so, you are giving these students an opportunity to explore our wide world, to engage in nature and to do what many of today’s youth has trouble doing well, having fun.

story:
INTRODUCTION

Greetings!  I am Dr. Angela Kennedy, a former educator with Orange County Public Schools for the past 13 years.  My undergraduate education in Communicative
Disorders was earned from the University of Central Florida.  Both of my post graduate degrees were obtained from NOVA Southeastern University in Early
childhood education and Organizational Leadership with a specialization in nonprofit.  As an educator, I have been able to serve in the capacities of a kindergarten and first grade teacher, Mentor and Team Leader, Reading, Instructional and Academic Coach, along with coordinating Curriculum Compliance for the English Language Learners (ELL).  I have always been aware of leadership skills that I possess and strive to mature those skills to be an effective leader in all of my endeavors. Through my experiences and the calling I believe to do this work, I am now continuing my
vision of developing Deeper Root Academy to service the needs of students and
families. 

Deeper Root Academy is a premier private Christian-based private school that provides character education with the incorporation of the multiple intelligences.  This one of a kind teaching model focuses on academic achievement with an emphasis on discovering students’ strengths to use as a platform to provide a customized educational experience. Each student will receive a full psychoeducational evaluation so the most effective modes for learning can be identified and implemented. Our after school program incorporates Arts Enrichment.  It is designed to restore the appreciation of the Arts back to the community.  There is exposure to all art genres (Music, Instrumentation, Voice, Dance, Drawing, Drama, etc.) so individuals can discover and nurture their innate talents enabling them to have opportunities that will enhance their life. 



THE NEED/BENEFIT OF SUPPORT

Have you ever wondered why so many of today's children are not able to make the connections necessary to grasp the concepts taught in a traditional school? Our system is failing our kids because the focus is on how they perform rather than what they perform.  If we do not address this critical area, our world is in danger of not equipping our students for the world we live in.   The current system is trying to catch up with our ever changing world and leaving many of our students behind rather than
closing the gap. “Closing the Gap", a phrase we hear so often in education
when in fact, the gap is not closing for the majority of students.  It is widening because the shift that is taking place does not leave room for those who learn differently but are very capable.  This audacious task of opening a school that provides these types of learning opportunities carries a great expense.  Not making this investment will be to our detriment.  We need $50,000 in order to secure an additional instructor, manipulatives, additional computers for classroom/instructional use, and to make funding available to families who need financial assistance to provide this opportunity for their child. 

The vision of Deeper Root Academy is to provide business and educational excellence by serving our clients and community with compassion, commitment, and
character.  The educational focus is based on the study of Howard Gardner's theory of Multiple Intelligence.  At the core of this theory is the recognition that people think and learn differently and that intelligence can be expressed in a multitude of ways. This approach differs from the traditional education provided in public, and most private schools in Florida.  Using the Common Core State Standards and
Nationwide benchmarks, our teaching will incorporate each of the seven major
intellectual domains defined by Dr. Gardner and provide opportunities for each
student to use his or her unique intelligence to understand the subject matter.
In addition, we will help students understand their strengths and challenges
using Multiple Intelligence as a tool. Students will learn to use strengths to
acquire new information and work on more fully developing their knowledge in
areas that are a challenge for them.  We seek to rule out any chance of failure and teach our students to embrace their abilities and talents in order to develop their
understanding of how they can positively impact our world.  This opportunity will be extended to those who qualify for scholarship based on academic or developmental needs as well as provide scholarship opportunities for those who may not be able to afford this type of quality education.  This is your opportunity to become an integral part of the educational change we as a country need in order to compete globally.  Your support will be far reaching and impact lives that will, in turn, enhance our world now and for years to come.  We are experiencing success and our students are deserving of all our efforts.  We need your help in order to get this type of individualized quality education in the hands of our future leaders. 




IMPACT

The desire to develop this type of educational experience originates from our tutoring program, that began as a private pay program to being approved as a vendor with the State of Florida to provide services to students in Title 1 (Economically Disadvantaged) schools.  This experience has fueled my passion along with the requests of my clients to provide this type of academic enrichment to a full day school setting.  We have a service rating of excellent with the Department of Education.  It is my goal to reach more students and families.


Multiple Intelligence and The Arts, a few of the many services offered, is a priority, as we know that a strong arts education promotes the skills children need to be
successful. Exposure to art education promotes self-directed learning, improves
school attendance and sharpens critical and creative skills. In fact, several recent studies have concluded that the creativity and innovation utilized in the artistic process will be highly valued by employers in the United States in the coming years as we continue to shift into a global economy.  We want to be that channel for individuals to prosper now and in the days to come.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


Support Deeper Root Academy, the areas newest school of academic excellence. We seek to address the needs of the whole child while focusing more on their strengths rather than magnifying their weaknesses. We endeavor to understand HOW they are smart! Please visit our website: www.deeperrootacademy.org and discover your intelligence.   Share this information with your family and friends.  You can use the tools on our site or the Indiegogo share tools.  Thank you for your support!

story:
The History

      The Two Medicine River Dinosaur Center is one of only two dinosaur research facilities in the State of Montana – an area richer and more diverse in its dinosaurs than  any other state.  However, for over 100 years, Montana’s dinosaur fossils have gone to museums around the world with few left in the State. Since 1995, the Two Medicine Dinosaur Center, a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization, has worked to not only better understand the past through its fossils and dinosaurs, but to also keep these remarkable fossils where they were discovered. The Two Medicine Dinosaur Center has also been responsible for paradigm shifts in understanding animal interactions and the prehistory of western North America.  

     The Two Medicine Dinosaur provides educational field experiences for all ages, as well as lending its expertise to other small facilities across Montana, which, in turn, helps establish more educational programs and furthers research. The research conducted by the Two Medicine Dinosaur Center has been at the heart of several new species reports and numerous reinterpretations of paleontology. Dave Trexler, the lead paleontologist at the Two Medicine Dinosaur Center, was the featured scientist in the Discovery Channel special, “Secrets of the Dinosaur Mummy.”  

     The Two Medicine Dinosaur Center began with zero assets and still today receives no tax dollars for its operational costs. Located in Bynum, Montana - a town with a population of less than 100 people - the Two Medicine Dinosaur Center is limited in its ability to gather local funding necessary to expand; however, due to its unique local geology, the area is excellent for research and field experience opportunities.

 Opportunity: "The Learning Center"

     After 16 years of steady growth and pressing needs from the community and Montana itself, the Two Medicine Dinosaur Center has grown beyond its physical capacity. Currently, in order to conduct indoor educational programs, the facility must be closed to the public due to lack of space. Newly excavated plaster blocks of fossils must be stored in the exhibit area due to lack of space in the collections area. Community meetings are also held in the facility, crammed into the gift store area due to lack of other space.

     Currently, the facility is entirely supported  through gift shop revenues, programs, memberships, and donations. Due to funding limitations,  growth occurs “a piece at a time” as income permits. It has only been the past few years that the facility has been able to hire part-time staff.

     This Fall, the organization received its first major grant – a Montana Tourism Infrastructure Investment Program (TIIP) grant. The grant will provide partial funding for the construction of the "Learning Center," a second floor expansion which will provide a permanent area for guest speakers, research, and year-round educational programs for all ages. This addition will free up existing first floor space for additional exhibits of fossil and new archeological artifacts and a larger collections and laboratory area. This larger collections area will more adequately meet the federal requirements to house specimens collected on State and Federal lands.

     This new addition will also provide the Bynum community its only public meeting space.

     This is an exciting time for the Two Medicine Dinosaur Center! This new endeavor will greatly increase the Two Medicine Dinosaur Center's ability  to provide multiple opportunities - from education, to research, to a stronger community.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The TIIP grant provides $2 for every $1 raised. Concentrated fundraising efforts are underway to meet the minimum $25,000 match. The grant provides $50,000 towards our $110,000 project.

In order to match the grant and complete the project before our May 1 summer opening date, time is critical and your help is vital.

The Two Medicine Dinosaur Center is a recognized 501(c)3  charitable non-profit organization. Whatever you are willing and able to donate is not only greatly appreciated, but also is tax deductible. We also have incentives for your help - Check them out!

Again, your help is vital to our ability to continue this research facility. Thanks so much for your interest and support!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 Whether or not you are able to donate,  please spread the word. You can ‘Like’ us on Facebook. Please visit our website tmdinsaur.org to see the collection, crew and facility. If you make a trip out to Montana, feel free to stop in and visit us and see the incredible fossil discoveries of Montana.

story:
Thank a teacher.   My project goal is to have at least 100 people "pay it backwards" and thank a teacher or Mentor.  When you select a perk, that Item will be shipped to your teacher/mentor with a note of thanks.  (Optionally, I can ship it to you and you can deliver it). Help me express the attitude of gratitude to teachers/mentors that have helped us succeed.


  • I'm a 16 year old high school student and have a passion for wood-turning.  I have had multiple adults pour their life experience in to my life and for that I am extremely grateful.  Nick Offerman is someone I admire .. he is a woodworker and knows the value of a mentor.   I'd love to meet him some day! Google search Nick and his mentor Professor Emeritus Shozo Sato to see what I mean. (After you back my project of course!)

  • My goal in creating this project is to express gratitude to my own mentors, and allow others to thank the mentor(s) in their own life by creating a hand-crafted gift to show appreciation.  When I get my lathe, I will be making gifts to give to my teachers and mentors.
  •  With your support we can send a gift with a note of thanks to a teacher/mentor.  This project allows you to express your gratitude toward that special mentor now rather than 20 years later. Here is your chance to support the mentoring movement.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need funding to purchase a lathe, lathe tools and supplies to make, finish and deliver the gifts/perks to my backers.  At a minimum I need $800 to purchase a good quality lathe (Jet VS1221).  This project has a $500 minimum as I have several hundred dollars of my own that I am putting toward this project.  I am asking for additional funding.. not a hand-out! If things go better than planned.. I really want a 1224 Oneway Lathe. 
  • The gifts and perks I create will be unique and of excellent quality. Each pen is made from local sourced North Carolina woods.*  Note: No exotic woods. i.e no rain forests will be harmed by the making of this pen/gifts. Choose from Maple, black walnut ,cherry and other NC hardwoods including some beautiful spalted maple show below. Parker style refills. The pens I turn are great writing instruments! 
  • All backers will get immense satisfaction for helping out a cool project. Supporting a project that spreads good will and thankfulness in our world, who wouldn't want to do that?
  • If I do not reach my goal to purchase my own lathe, I will still fulfill the perks through the use of lathe from by mentor Todd Hartzel in Raleigh.  Any excess funds will be added to my own savings to purchase a lathe in the near future.


    • Just in time for the Holidays.. Back me with $100.00 and get five ornaments!

The Bolt action pens pictured above are the coolest.  Get one for yourself, give one to a mentor.  (Note: Not recommended for teachers as bullets = violence in a school setting) Well.. tell them not to take it to school!

Above: two pens made from spalted maple.  Absolutely awesome! When the project ends, I will contact you for the wood and finish choice.

Round boxes are cool. Everyone should have one.  The person receiving it will appreciate your gratefulness.  Or get one for yourself?

The Impact of this Project

  • My project spreads gratitude in this world. I don't think anyone can argue that we don't need more of that.  Teachers/mentors, those who often for very little pay invest their energies to give .. need to be thanked.  Please help me do this by funding this project.
  • You will also be supporting a young person to get off the couch and makes stuff! 

Risks & Challenges

  • Producing a large number of items in a timely manner will be the biggest challenge I see. I have staggered my delivery schedule to allow for some breathing room. As a backup, my older brother is learning to turn as well and he can rough turn the pieces before I apply the final cuts.

    Finding a good supply of North Carolina locally sourced wood could be a challenge.  I have made some contacts with a friend who owns his own sawmill and should prove to solve this challenge.  In addition, I now know several other wood-turners that always have a piece of wood with a story laying around the shop.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your congressman about me.. Tell the press.  Tell your friends about this project.  Post it on Facebook , tweet about it.
  • Help me meet Nick Offerman one day.  Someone should tweet about that.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

Other Details:

After the project is funded  Wentworthwoodworking.com will be launched  to keep everyone updated on the project/progress. My dad registered this domain name as a gift to me for my  16th birthday. Your pledge for this project is helping to buy the lathe etc., but really, you are starting a movement of gratitude , that is the project!  Please Back my project today!

  • Shipping of gifts is for continental United States.  I cannot ship internationally. Contact me at wentworthwoodworkingnc.com if you have questions.
  • My father , Paul Wentworth (someone over 18) will be supervising this campaign.

The Pizza cutter Image can be seen below.  Give it to a friend or teacher that has fed your soul..  I made one of these for my Dad back in June.. we use it often and love how it cuts through in a single pass. Note: The handle detaches so the blade can be washed by hand or in the dishwasher.

A natural Edge Bowl... this is a unique gift that will be appreciated by it's recipient. This is a limited edition item.  I only plan to make 5.
story_txt:
Thank a teacher.   My project goal is to have at least 100 people "pay it backwards" and thank a teacher or Mentor.  When you select a perk, that Item will be shipped to your teacher/mentor with a note of thanks.  (Optionally, I can ship it to you and you can deliver it). Help me express the attitude of gratitude to teachers/mentors that have helped us succeed.
I'm a 16 year old high school student and have a passion for wood-turning.  I have had multiple adults pour their life experience in to my life and for that I am extremely grateful.  Nick Offerman is someone I admire .. he is a woodworker and knows the value of a mentor.   I'd love to meet him some day! Google search Nick and his mentor Professor Emeritus Shozo Sato to see what I mean. (After you back my project of course!)



My goal in creating this project is to express gratitude to my 
own mentors, and allow others to thank the mentor(s) in their own life by creating a hand-crafted gift to show appreciation.  When I get my lathe, I will be making gifts to give to my teachers and mentors.

 With your support we can send a gift with a note of thanks to a 
teacher/mentor.  This project allows you to express your gratitude 
toward that special mentor now rather than 20 years later. Here is your chance to support the mentoring movement.

  What We Need & What You Get 
I need funding to purchase a lathe, lathe tools and supplies to make, finish and deliver the gifts/perks to my backers.  At a minimum I need $800 to purchase a good quality lathe (Jet VS1221).  This project has a $500 minimum as I have several hundred dollars of my own that I am putting toward this project.  I am asking for additional funding.. not a hand-out! If things go better than planned.. I really want a 1224 Oneway Lathe.  

The gifts and perks I create will be unique and of excellent quality. Each pen is made from local sourced North Carolina woods.*  Note: No exotic woods. i.e no rain forests will be harmed by the making of this pen/gifts. Choose from Maple, black walnut ,cherry and other NC hardwoods including some beautiful spalted maple show below.  
Parker style refills. The pens I turn are great writing instruments! 
All backers will get immense satisfaction for helping out a cool 
project. Supporting a project that spreads good will and thankfulness in
 our world, who wouldn't want to do that? 
 If I do not reach my goal to purchase my own lathe, I will still fulfill the perks through the use of lathe from by mentor Todd Hartzel in Raleigh.  Any excess funds will be added to my own savings to purchase a lathe in the near future.



Just in time for the Holidays.. Back me with $100.00 and get five ornaments!


  The Bolt action pens pictured above are the coolest.  Get one for yourself, give one to a mentor.  (Note: Not recommended for teachers as bullets = violence in a school setting) Well.. tell them not to take it to school!

Above: two pens made from spalted maple.  Absolutely awesome! When the project ends, I will contact you for the wood and finish choice.
Round boxes are cool. Everyone should have one.  The person receiving it will appreciate your gratefulness.  Or get one for yourself?The Impact of this Project
 
My project spreads gratitude in this world. I don't think anyone can argue that we don't need more of that.  Teachers/mentors, those who often for very little pay invest their energies to give .. need to be thanked.  Please help me do this by funding this project.
You will also be supporting a young person to get off the couch and makes stuff!  


  Risks & Challenges   
Producing a large number of items in a timely manner will be the 
biggest challenge I see.  I have staggered my delivery schedule to allow
 for some breathing room.  As a backup, my older brother is learning to 
turn as well and he can rough turn the pieces before I apply the final 
cuts.
Finding a good supply of North Carolina locally sourced wood could be
 a challenge.   I have made some contacts with a friend who owns his own sawmill and should prove to solve 
this challenge.  In addition, I now know several other wood-turners that always have a piece of wood with a story laying around the shop.

  Other Ways You Can Help 
Tell your congressman about me.. Tell the press.  Tell your friends about this project.  Post it on Facebook , tweet about it.

Help me meet Nick Offerman one day.  Someone should tweet about that.
 use the Indiegogo share tools!

Other Details:
 After the 
project is funded   Wentworthwoodworking.com
 will be launched  to keep everyone updated on the project/progress.  My dad registered this 
domain name as a gift to me for my  16th birthday. Your pledge for this project is helping to 
buy the lathe etc., but really, you are starting a movement of gratitude , that is the project!  Please Back my project today!

Shipping of gifts is for continental United States.  I cannot ship internationally. Contact me at wentworthwoodworkingnc.com if you have questions.
My father , Paul Wentworth (someone over 18) will be supervising this campaign.

The Pizza cutter Image can be seen below.  Give it to a friend or teacher that has fed your soul..  I made one of these for my Dad back in June.. we use it often and love how it cuts through in a single pass. Note: The handle detaches so the blade can be washed by hand or in the dishwasher.


A natural Edge Bowl... this is a unique gift that will be appreciated by it's recipient. This is a limited edition item.  I only plan to make 5.

story:
I am a second year student studying Cellular and Molecular Medicine at the University of Bristol, and want to spend my summer doing something worthwhile.

I decided that I want to spend my summer volunteering, and set about doing research as to how best I could spend my time and money. The conclusion of which was Moving Mountains' trip to Nepal, where I can genuinely make a difference to people's lives and living standards by setting up medical camps in remote villages.

In many villages there are currently no permanent medical facilities and the nearest doctor or dentist is a 2 day walk away.In previous years the volunteers have seen over 1,000 patients in 10 days.Volunteers aim to see as many patients as possible and collect medical data to gain a better understanding of the most common health issues in the area. This can help Moving Mountains provide more effective medical clinics, and guide their research in building a permanent medical clinic in this area, which is the long term aim. They also aim to provide some basic medical education to the local people.

The trip involves travel into the breath-taking Himalayan foothills to help set up and run a medical and dental clinic in two beautiful and remote Nepali villages.
The trip offers a unique and fascinating insight into healthcare in a setting not often seen to tourists. We will trek through the foothills to reach the villages of Bumburi and Bupsa, where the medical camps will be set up.

This scheme is part of a wider initiative to improve the quality of life of people in the lower Khumbu region of Nepal, which has so far been achieved via investment in infrastructure, education and healthcare as well as training and reliable employment.


Where's the money going?

Unfortunately, I'm not in the position that I can choose to volunteer where ever I am needed. I am already a volunteer with St John Ambulance, Callington Road Mental Health Hospital in Bristol and various youth groups. However, my ambitions are starting to stretch outside of the UK.

The money raised on this page will contribute to the flights, visas and vaccinations needed to get me to Nepal so that I can continue helping those less fortunate than me and carry on the fantastic work that Moving Mountains Trust does. I will also be raising money via bake sales and doing other sponsored events such as running a 10K in June, of which, £750 will go directly to the Moving Mountains Trust charity.

story:
***In order to disburse funds as quickly as possible we ask that donations be made through PAYPAL, where possible.***

We are in a crisis with these dogs, and we need your help.

Last week we found a group of dogs and their puppies injured and suffering from malnutrition and exposure in Sky Valley. Sky Valley is a beautiful place but it is harsh; baking sun in the day time and freezing at nighttime, especially now during the holidays.

We have 10 puppies, the injured adult male, and the younger nursing female so far.

They all have sarcoptic mange - which is highly contagious.

We are searching frantically for a place for them to go and then the work really starts to finish saving their lives. Besides the shots and spaying and neutering when they are healthy enough, we are doing nutrition intervention and the new medical costs are going to run in to the thousands.

And this is with every person involved donating their time - hours & hours of it. We need help raising money for their their medical care and it is urgent. 

This is not unusual. Every single rescue is exactly like this. You never go and rescue a dog, cuddle and love it, and then place it in a home. It just doesn't work like that. Every single one needs medical attention of some kind and that is before the shots, spaying and neutering. 

These lives are worth saving and we need your help to save these poor babies.

story:
1...2...3...4.... We don't want your racist war
5...6...7...8...Stop the violence, stop the hate!

Say what? ...There is an activist scholarship fund?

Yes! We are the Davis-Putter Scholarship Fund. We are a national fund that supports activist students all over the U.S.

Over fifty years ago, veterans of the sit-in movement boarded buses with hopes of desegregating the south - putting their lives on the line and building an ever growing student movement.  That same year the Davis-Putter Scholarship Fund was created.

The Fund has provided $2.8 million in grants to over 900 students over the past five decades.

Our grantees have been at the forefront of virtually every major progressive social movement.  Student Non-Violent Coordinating Committee activists, Vietnam War resisters, anti-imperialist solidarity organizers, Puerto Rican independence leaders. They have been on the frontlines working against the prison industrial complex, police abuse, gentrification and militarization and for the rights of workers, women, LGBT community and immigrants. Our community of grantees includes artists, scholars, people's lawyers, political prisoners and organizers.

And the best part... the fund has supported radical student activists with funds from our communities and our movements! There’s no endowment, we are funded by many committed donors who have been supporting the Fund over the years and we need you to join with them in supporting these amazing activists!

What's our idea?

Our idea is to continue to support students who are taking it to the streets and making change happen for years to come! Our grantees are working to re-imagine broken systems and are organizing to end all forms of oppression.

We want to ensure the sustainability of DPSF and we want to invite you to join us in this movement building effort. The change we all seek will not happen tomorrow, we must continue to support student activists working to achieve a sustainable future.

Our scholarship application is due on April 1st. By then, we want to raise a total of $10,000 – this should support two additional students, students who are advancing the social movements in their local communities, their cities and their states.

Awesome! How can I help?

You can help move our collective vision forward by donating today! $10, $25, $50, $100, $500, $1000 - Any amount helps and only you know what you can give!

You can also help us spread the word about this campaign, asking your friends and comrades to support us too - and tell all the radical students you know to apply for the scholarship before April 1st. Go to www.davisputter.org  to download instructions and the application.

What if you raise less than your $10,000 goal? We keep it and use it toward a grant for one of these amazing activists.

And what if you make way more than $10,000? That would be awesome - we can fund even more students!

OK. I'm in! Is there a deadline on the contributions?

Yes. April 1st is our deadline for contributions for this campaign and for the scholarship applications. (But your donations are always welcome!)

Last Question... Why is it called the Davis-Putter Fund? Is Angela Davis involved?

The Fund was founded in 1961 as the Marian Davis Scholarship Fund, a memorial to a teacher and political activist who died of breast cancer in 1960. Marian was an advocate for racial justice and the rights of labor. In the mid 1980’s, Norton S. Putter, a fixture in progressive politics in Syracuse, New York, who worked for peace and justice and became central to the work of the Fund, providing both time and resources. And actually, yes, Angela Davis is one of our longtime sponsors along with other movement leaders and activist scholars, past and present, including : Robin D.G. Kelley, Howard Zinn, Dr. Bernice Johnson Reagon, Noam Chomsky, Pete Seeger, Julian Bond, Lennox Hinds, Huwaida Arraf, Anne and Carl Braden and Margaret Burnham, just to name a few.

And here’s a current list of our board of trustees:

Mónica Enríquez-Enríquez -Program Officer, Astraea Foundation, 2003, ’04, ’07 grantee.

Simone Weil Davis, Ph.D. -Ethics, University of Toronto, and Inside-Out Canada/Walls to Bridges Collective at Wilfrid Laurier University.

Walter L. Putter - Syracuse Center for Peace and Social Justice, Inc.

Laura McSpedon - Organizer, Committee of Interns & Residents/SEIU Healthcare, 1999 grantee.

Davarian L. Baldwin, Ph.D., Professor of American Studies, Trinity College.

Lisa Brock, Ph.D., Academic Director of the Arcus Center for Social Justice Leadership, Kalamazoo College.

James A. Donaldson, Ph.D., Mathematics Professor and Former Dean of Arts and Sciences, Howard University.

Carol Giardina, Ph.D., Queens College, Assistant Professor of History, 1998-99 grantee.

Allison Guttu, Staff Attorney and Pro Bono Coordinator, Advocates for Children of New York and a leader in National Women’s Liberation, 2004-06 grantee.

Sora Han, Ph.D., Criminology, Law & Society, University of California, Irvine, 2002-05 grantee.

Carol J. Kraemer, Davis-Putter Scholarship Fund Director

Clarence Lang, Ph.D., Associate Professor of African and African-American Studies, University of Kansas, and a former Langston Hughes Visiting Professor, 2000 grantee.l

Luke Aidger Patterson, Coalition Coordinator for Peoples’ Justice for Community Control & Police Accountability, a multidisciplinary artist and a 2011/12 grantee.

Clarissa Rojas, Ph.D.,  Assistant Professor, Women’s, Gender and Sexuality Studies and Chicano/Latino Studies, CSU Long Beach.

Gina Velasco, Ph.D. – Assistant Professor, Women’s and Gender Studies, Keene State College, 2007/08 grantee.

Diana Pei Wu – Organizing Director, Asian Pacific American Network of Oregon (APANO), and continuing to consult and volunteer on creative resistance and strategic communications, 2003/04 grantee.

Rachel Stocking, Ph.D., Dept of History, Southern Illinois University Carbondale.

story:
Hello, my name is Michele Harvey. I am a writer as well as a volunteer teammate for Humanity's Team, a top-rated nonprofit organization, and a global grassroots spiritual movement with a mission to promote Global Oneness.

It is through my work with Humanity's Team that I met fellow Humanity's Team member, and my dear friend Mukul Nandi, founder of Phulbari English Medium K.G School, a school for young children located in a rural village, in the poor country of Bangladesh. Phulbari English Medium K.G School was founded in 1999, and is in dire need of structural repairs and enhancements for the health, safety, and well being of its 200 children.

Your donation will make it possible for these children to learn in a school with classrooms separated by walls instead of mats, classrooms with adequate lighting in lieu of darkness, and in a school that is properly insulated from heavy rains and flooding. Your donation will make it possible for these children to learn in a clean school with adequate plumbing and toilet facilities.

Bangladesh has a low but climbing literacy rate. Your donation will help make a difference in the lives of these children, their teachers, their families, and the future.

What We Need

Phulbari English Medium K.G School needs $6500 in order to complete all needed construction and structural repairs. This estimate was given to Mukul Nandi by a structural engineer who toured the school and it includes both materials and labor. All donations will be wired by Indiegogo directly into the Phulbari English Medium K.G School's bank account in Bangladesh.

The Phulbari English Medium K.G School's needed construction and repairs are as follows:

A new roof, new floors, construction of two bathrooms, light fittings in every classroom, an electric fan in every classroom, walls to separate the classrooms, and the construction of an office space.  

A flexible campaign

This is a flexible campaign which means Phulbari English Medium K.G School will receive all donations made to this campaign through Indiegogo by the campaign deadline, regardless of whether our fund raising goal is reached or exceeded. All donations will be wired by Indiegogo directly into the Phulbari English Medium K.G School's bank account in Bangladesh at the end of the campaign deadline.


The Phulbari English Medium K.G School is the brainchild of Mukul Nandi, who has dedicated his life to educating the children in his village, so they may be afforded opportunities for a better life. Over the years, Mukul Nandi has shared many details about his school, the children, their dedicated teachers, and the many difficulties they have had to endure in Bangladesh, one of the poorest countries in the world.

In Gratitude For Your Donation

We encourage all donors to please print the photos of these beautiful children as they are updated on this site, and post them on your refrigerator as a reminder of the children and families being served through your thoughtful gift.

If you contribute $50 or more, your name will be written on a stone placed in front of Phulbari English Medium K.G School. Photos of the stone with your name will be emailed to you and shared on social media. You can also print these photos.

Contributors of $100 or more will receive a hand-written letter of thanks sent from the students at Phulbari English Medium K.G School.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign on social media and share the photographs of the children and their school with your friends.  Please consider asking for a matching donation from teachers, churches, and friends. Please encourage donations of any amount. Together we shall make a difference.

story:
Today I want to introduce you to a new non-profit organization that is making a major positive impact on the youth of today.

In todays troubled times many things are neglected, either because of a lack of financial ability or pure lack of concern. Children often pay the price.  Every day these kids are making choices, their action showing up on city property, in the paper and on the evening news.  These actions not only affect the appearance, but also the perception of a city as a whole, as well as the financial stability of a community.

Our youth outreach program is currently working with UALR Children International & The Hillary Rodham Clinton Children's Library and Learning Center providing kids with life skills such as self-respect and self-worth through our martial arts program and its training principles. 

The Han Center Youth Outreach Program will provides instruction and mentoring in basic core life values through instruction in martial arts and six training principles.  Youth develop self-respect and self-worth through hard work and dedication in the martial arts while striving to live every day by the following training principles:

1.  Be Polite

2.  Be Patient

3.  Be Alert

4.  Be Brave

5.  Do Your Best

6.  Respect Yourself & Others

These principles are transformed into learned traits and provide youth with the skills to make positive life choices as they mature into community and world leaders.


Our goal with this fundraiser is to provide two summer camp programs for at risk and under privileged children.  


The summer camp programs will introduce youths ages 5-16 to the martial arts program available at the Hillary Clinton Children’s Library. 

Each camp will be 2 weeks providing the youth with mentoring, abduction prevention, self confidence & self respect using Martial Arts as a guide. It will provide them with life skills they need to make intelligent positive choices as they are faced with the challenges of life.  Through hard work and positive role models, the training principles (Be Polite, Be Patient, Be Alert, Be Brave, Do Your Best, Respect yourself & Others) are taught by example, the youth will gain confidence and self-respect.  These skills will help guide them as they make the choices they face, and help them chose the path that allows them to realize their dreams.  Youth that have this “skill” are less likely to commit acts of violence, theft, and vandalism.  They become better, more respectful citizens, not only of themselves, but their neighbors as well.  This leads to safer more economically stable communities. 


In addition to providing instruction in these life skills, physical exercise and classes on healthy foods will also be covered.


What We Need:

Our goal of $15000.00 for these programs will be used as follows:

  • Provide a safe and secure learning environment for the youth. 
  • Provide each youth with a summer camp work out uniform to include contact pants, event  t-shirt, and a martial arts belt.  All that they get to keep after camp.
  • A healthy snack daily, this will include fruits and bottled waters.
  • A summer camp completion award. 

Let me share:


Many of the youth our program will reach come from large impoverished families and communities.  The role models and life skills they learn are mostly taught on the street.  They see violence, drugs and death as their tools and/or escape.  We want to change that, too many youth are lost to death or jail with no hope of following their dreams.  Together we can provide them with the role models, and character building environment that they crave.  Help us show these kids the path and support their reaching for the star that can be their future.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Visit thehancenter.org and become a monthly donor.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and help us reach our goal!

Today I want to introduce you to a new non-profit
organization that is making a major positive impact on the youth of today.
In todays troubled times many
things are neglected, either because of a lack of financial ability or pure
lack of concern. Children often pay the price. 
Every day these kids are making choices, their action showing up on city
property, in the paper and on the evening news. 
These actions not only affect the appearance, but also the perception of a city as a whole, as well as the financial stability of a community.

Our youth outreach program is currently working
with UALR Children International & The Hillary Rodham Clinton Children's Library and Learning Center providing kids with life skills such as
self-respect and self-worth through our martial arts program and its training
principles. The

Best
